author: {'steamid': '76561198193678029', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 31, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1712182655}
review: Tetris is always fun, and playing with friends is a blast, but words cannot describe my rage trying to meet any point goal in puyo puyo when playing the story. Getting enough points to get 3 stars on any level like that requires setting up a massive combo quick enough that you don't get blocked by trash pieces but without falling into to many connections because, at least in the early stages, the ai is so terribly shit that if you send even one bit of trash to them they fall apart and lose too quickly to get any decent amount of points. Part of it is a me problem, since whatever in my brain makes me good at tetris absolutely fries trying to play puyo. The general gameplay is fun, but god help you if you try to play the story to unlock stuff and hate the sight of an unfinished level. I know I'm not content to leave anything at one star, especially when any level with tetris is an easy three star for me.

review:
I love this game. I always loved Puyo Puyo. The mix with Tetris is crazy and really fun

I didn't try to play online, but the game works wonderfully on local multiplayer, which I've played a while with friends.

The main story mode is long enough though pretty easy to beat. 

All in All a very good puzzle game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198298589233', 'num_games_owned': 56, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 10054, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10054, 'last_played': 1611467867}
review:
Este juego me lo regalo mi mejor amiga por allÃ¡ en el 2018, al inicio me parecÃ­a una vrga (un tetris qliao) asÃ­ que empezamos a jugarlo juntos, y la verdad me termino gustando, tanto que lo jugaba por mi cuenta contra la maquina con tal de ganarle cuando volviÃ©ramos a competir.
Por un problema personal con mi ex caÃ­ en depresiÃ³n, mi amiga estuvo desde el inicio apoyÃ¡ndome ya que era licenciada en psicologÃ­a (pecÃ© a que tambiÃ©n tenia sus problemas, problemas severos de autoestima relacionados con el "automuriciÃ³n"), me aguanto todas las tonterÃ­as que hice tratando de arreglar las cosas con mi ex pareja una y otra vez, la cague de forma brutal, ella quedo agotada y se fue distanciando, hasta que un dÃ­a ya no me respondÃ­a, simplemente se harto (y con justa razÃ³n, fui un estÃºpido arrogante egoÃ­sta de mrda).
Tenia 16, ahora tengo 22
Ya tengo mÃ¡s que superada esa etapa de mi vida, no he vuelto a tener una pareja ya que me he centrado en mÃ­, mis estudios, trabajo y salud personal, llevo casi 2 aÃ±os entrenando en el gym, en resumen que estoy relativamente bien. Hoy vi este juego en mi biblioteca y me recordÃ³ todo esto, y aunque ya no sÃ© absolutamente nada de ella, ni siquiera si sigue viva, siempre estarÃ© mÃ¡s que agradecido por todo lo que hizo por mi, gracias a ella pude dar los primeros pasos para salir de ese lugar tan oscuro y corrupto dentro de mi mente, a costa de su salud mental. No fue su mejor decisiÃ³n, pero jamÃ¡s olvidare tal acto.
DespuÃ©s de tantos aÃ±os volvÃ­ a instalarlo, veamos que tal esta
Y quizÃ¡s, poder revivir esos viejos tiempos de felicidad que atesoro en lo mÃ¡s profundo mi cabeza, calmando un poco la culpa y remordimiento de mis acciones pasadas que cada dÃ­a me recuerda esta soledad que me acompaÃ±a desde entonces.


Juego recomendado

author: {'steamid': '76561199638288098', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 750, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 333, 'playtime_at_review': 259, 'last_played': 1712198683}
review:
I owned this game on another platform for years, and bought the Steam version for multiplayer.

The title almost recommends itself:  Puyo Puyo is already fun, and so is Tetris, and this game has both.  If desired, players can play just the modes they prefer.  But its almost possible to have crossover matches (where one player plays Tetris and the other plays Puyo) or "Swap" matches (where you begin playing one game but the board will swap to the other).

The cherry on top is there's actually a story mode, which is just the most adorable thing ever.

review:
How can you make Tetris and Puyo even better? Merge them together! 

So addictive and the game modes are so diverse and the challenges are well done. It sucks that the online is dead but the game itself provides a fun local coop which encourages people to see the outside world and interact with other homo-sapiens to befriend them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087722573', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 466, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 466, 'last_played': 1705294784}
review: There was a time where I played little puzzle games on my gameboy or tetris on my super nintendo and I actually could play those games. This I cannot play. The A. I. in this game is somehow smarter or just beats the hell out of me and instead of a nostalgia trip I was just frustratingly losing... Always. I guess I'll leave fond memories in the past and keep playing other games. just not as good anymore and to always lose is not fun. Plenty of videos out there of tutorials of how to combo and "properly" play the game. However a game without creativity (Where everyone must use the same strats to beat the A.I.) just doesn't have a very long replayability. And I know, it's tetris what was I expecting? Maybe something easier I guess. lol. It's stacking blocks and making lines and somehow they complicated even that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139381430', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3086, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3086, 'last_played': 1698669761}
review:
For the casual gamer, this is a good time waster. For the active player like me, now ain't a good time to buy this game unless it is at a low price. The online community is very dormant and I had to turn to friends to help me with the online achievements.

Still a fun game with a cheesy story and post-story. :p

author: {'steamid': '76561198042145088', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 821, 'last_played': 1695951223}
review: It is as advertised. Both games are good non-complicated versions. No dumb DLC, you can unlock all the little side characters and stuff from playing the game. The 'Adventure' mode is a mix of both games, and was glad I was forced to play both because I was more unfamiliar with one side. The only downside is, the few times I checked online, no one was in the multiplayer lobbies but maybe that's a time of day issue? This game is a 9/10 easy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198245412570', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 798, 'last_played': 1695044533}
review:
Bought the game for my GF. Had to buy a new controller shortly after. Intrigued as to how come she got so pissed off to that point (and super glad she wasn't playing on Steam Deck) I decided to play it for myself. 

Great game with nice graphics and tight control but only for the masochists. Mind you, I got Deadcells to 5BC. Finished every single side-whatever on Enter the Gungeon. Manage to Top5 fairly consistently on Tetris 100. Played the SHIT of Lumines on my phone as well as Columns on my Game Gear when I was 6 (Im old as fuck ><) and I canÂ´t beat a medium PC here. Watching her play the PC it is NOT fair, it is NOT competitive and fuck being fun, its aggravating.

The game is competent though and I still have fun 4-playering with friends but if you're planning to play the PC, well, lets just say that my SL1 run on Elden Ring felt like an auto-clicker compared to this. Itâ€™s broken and for that I DO NOT recommend but alas... to each its own.

One last thing.... "garbage" machics IMHO DO NOT gel well with Puyo Puyo and makes some games 50/50 luck.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089688857', 'num_games_owned': 428, 'num_reviews': 132, 'playtime_forever': 119, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1697469223}
review:
Seems solid enough as a Tetris and Puyo Puyo multiplayer game, but the childish voice acting and story are gawd awful. There's no option just to play classic Tetris or Puyo Puyo. The options are play against bots or humans. If you're not into multiplayer then you can skip this version.

It's a sad state in PC gaming that emulation is still the best way to play these games. I got the game on sale so I won't thumb it down.

author: {'steamid': '76561198406304117', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 386, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 386, 'last_played': 1536372379}
review:
This is coming from a fan of both of these series, fun in their own ways. What could go wrong? Well it isn't buggy but it is certainly unbalanced in its own ways, infact an advice is to stay away from multiplayer of these games EVER. They've been around for a long time in slightly different styles but the same games and a large majority of anyone who still plays these are really sunken into it. Frankly I'd go standalone for these games, especially when Tetris has been tossed to plenty of different companies and its interesting seeing that they do. Puyo had some ways of being interesting though still addicting but we NEVER talk about "n~".
This game is kinda cute though...

author: {'steamid': '76561199048603642', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 869, 'last_played': 1702512560}
review:
This is coming from a guy who plays Tetrio

Set das and arr makes the game based on efficiency, not speed. This makes it great to practice efficiency. However, the mulitplayer is dead on pc (aside from when wumbo plays). Due to this, I usually only play vs Cold clear (You need to download a client). Also, most tournaments aren't on pc (On switch).

Learning how to play puyo is also kind of fun (I think). It's a nice break from tetris.

If its on sale, buy it if you want (What i did), if not, don't buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198007343154', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 449, 'playtime_forever': 382, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 382, 'last_played': 1681987837}
review: I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

author: {'steamid': '76561199098399115', 'num_games_owned': 80, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 111, 'last_played': 1691424684}
review:
spoilers

the merging of the dimensions of puyo-puyo and tetris is presented as the main problem, resolved through a portal which allows for visitation between the edge of spacetime and the SS tetra.

is this a metaphor for japan's current stance on trade, which insists on open barriers to further its economy which has built itself on the export of manufactured products alongside high investment in the rest of the asian region? potentially. 

are the use of portals a metaphor for the necessity of controlled trade rather than completely open barriers? potentially. 

most importantly, is the fact that the fate of the universe in the hands of a series of teenagers a metaphor for how the climate change issue has been pushed onto "further generations," rather than forcing those who caused it to take accountability? potentially. 

still, a hopeful call for a future of peace emerges. thank you SEGA.

review: So right off the bat I only really bough PPT for the online multiplayer (but I would still like to try puyo puyo.) I went and purchased it and the multiplayer is just flat out barren. Literally no rooms active, it says players are online for about 80 people but I literally waited for an hour for a match and none. Everything is still alright in the offline aspects though. It's just that if you're buying this game for the online matches, I suggest buying PPT 2 instead

author: {'steamid': '76561198188664927', 'num_games_owned': 1605, 'num_reviews': 386, 'playtime_forever': 844, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 844, 'last_played': 1678215893}
review:
[quote]Follow my Curator page, [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/41363546-Fruit-N-Doggie-Reviews/]Fruit N Doggie Reviews,[/url] so you can be updated whenever I post a new review.[/quote]
[h1]Overall Rating - High Quality â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜…â˜†[/h1]

[h1]First Impressions[/h1] 
Throughout the last few years, I've seen several clips of people playing Puyo Puyo Tetris (PPT), watching as they'd mix and match styles and demonstrate puzzling prowess in their game of choice. A gamer like me can only sit back and watch for so long before the urge to play gets too overwhelming, and I bought PPT while it was on sale. I could have skipped the first one for the sequel, but having never tried the original, I didn't want to buy a more expensive game I might not enjoy as much as I'd hope. 


[h1]Gameplay[/h1] 
Combining two highly popular, block-clearing puzzle games together is the sort of idea people might come up with because they couldn't decide which is better. However, actually pulling it off requires a decent amount of ingenuity. At a surface-level glance there's some similarities, but each requires a very different approach and mindset. It's why, generally speaking, Westerners tend to do better in Tetris, while those from the East excel in Puyo Puyo. Even when that's not the case, most people will have a predilection between the two, and it's pretty impressive if someone can rock at both.

Most of the game modes focuses on one of the two puzzle games at a time, even though each player decides for themselves which they want to play. There's some variety in the mechanics, with some being a bit gimmicky. For instance, Party Mode drops power-ups that when cleared will either put up some form of defense for you or screw with your opponent. I prefer the more conventional Versus Mode, although Swap has you spend time playing both games, where you have to stay alive and try to defeat your opponent in one or the other. Fusion Mode is the most complex, as it has both pieces on the same board, with its own set of rules and interactions. In-game tutorials exist, covering the basics of Tetris and Puyo Puyo, as well as Fusion Mode, since it's the most unorthodox. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2943243030
[h1]Controls[/h1] 
This is a game I specifically bought a controller with a solid d-pad for, because it allows me to make exact movements in a more controlled manner. You could play PPT with the keyboard, but when I hooked up my controller, it worked like a charm. It responds to every input without lag or delay, the way pieces rotate becomes second nature after a while, and even holding pieces in Tetris with the shoulder button felt natural. I couldn't ask for anything better.  


[h1]Story[/h1] 
I somewhat recognize characters from the Puyo Puyo cast, but haven't a clue if they made an entirely new set for the Tetris side or drew them from other source material. However, there's certainly a lot of parallels in personality types and lore, which isn't all that shocking with how the two puzzle games slightly mirror each other. With all of the characters mixed up, they're dealing with the issue of their two games colliding together, learning more about one another's worlds and puzzle piece of choice. It's a pretty silly situation, and showcases each character's personality well. 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2943223384
[h1]Visuals[/h1] 
Starting on a blank copy, you'll only have default options for how you want the puzzle pieces to look, although I think the neutral pieces have a clear, non-distracting appearance. There's a shop available in the options where you can purchase other skins, though I'd think many would be more of a detriment than anything, as some of them are so unusual. For instance, Tetris pieces made out of pool balls. Even with these atypical designs, each distinct piece has their own color and pattern, to better help distinguish them for faster play. Although I largely like the characters, their designs and portraits skew towards the simple side of things. For instance, their animations when you trigger a large chain make me think of a storybook because they're pretty crude, especially in contrast to something like Bust a Move 4. 


[h1]Sound Design[/h1] 
Considering the amount of modes, backgrounds, and characters, I think they could have included a few more songs, despite the fairly high number in the game. I say that primarily because it's a nice touch when you associate a song to a character, which is how many puzzle games with a versus mode would have presented it. That's a minor complaint though, as there's plenty of good tunes available. Like with most other aspects, they took inspiration from the past of both games when composing and assembling songs for PPT. It has a solid mix with different styles, none of which ever threw off my concentration. Part of each characters' personality comes from their voice acting, with a tendency for them to be expressive sorts. I didn't notice any off line-delivery or duds, which is more impressive for the ones that can only utter, â€œGuâ€ or Pi.â€ 

https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2943223062
[h1]Pros[/h1] 
ğŸŒŸ Since the two game types can play matches against each other, the balancing system can never be made perfectly even, as there's so many factors to consider. It's pretty reasonable though. 
ğŸŒŸ Being able to play quality versions of both Puyo Puyo and Tetris in the same title is a great benefit by itself. Especially when the game's price isn't that high. 


[h1]Cons[/h1] 
âŒ With the sequel out, online play has dropped off considerably. Sort of a, â€œNo duh.â€ I did find a few people to play against, but it was sparse.  
âŒ Not every mode is likely to be a winner, depending on your own preferences. Party and Fusion Mode weren't my cup of tea. 


[h1]Tips[/h1]
ğŸ” The various single-player game modes are a good way to work any rust off and get used to the nuances of PPT before facing other players. 
ğŸ” There are video tutorials on YouTube to get a better understanding on either game's mechanics.


[h1]Final Thoughts[/h1] 
Knowing how much I was enjoying PPT, I was curious what others were disliking about it. From what I saw, there were two issues that kept coming up. As I've acknowledged, a direct sequel usually disrupts the online play of older games in a series, and that's no different here. The second was from people who compared the Steam version to other ports, because this was an inferior version. Not having other consoles to do my own testing with, I'm unable to determine that for myself. 

Regarding a lack of players online, I intentionally bought PPT because I wanted to hedge my bets, and that comes at the cost of having the out of date game. That's my own fault. This is the first time I've gotten to play modern versions of Tetris and Puyo Puyo, trying for myself mechanics like T-spins and Fever Mode. Personally, I could use more practice getting used to these features, so I'm not opposed to putting in time by myself. Unless you have a specific reason for it, I'd suggest skipping ahead to the sequel, but because this took a crazy idea and made it functional, I have to recommend PPT. I've had too much fun to do otherwise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198993944032', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 158, 'playtime_forever': 706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 706, 'last_played': 1674114277}
review:
Puyo Puyo Tetris! Before playing this game (originally, back on the Switch) I didn't know exactly what Puyo Puyo was, though I recognized the gameplay once I started playing. I found myself a fan of both Puyo Puyo and Tetris, and really enjoyed the inventiveness that came with many of the levels. I had so much nostalgia for it from the switch, in fact, that I happily bought it here on steam, when it went on sale.

Unfortunately, though, as I tried to make my way through the story levels, I was reminded of why I'd never completed the game on the switch.

Playing versus the AI feels incredibly punishing, with levels seeming to spike in difficulty unexpectedly. I found myself wondering if it was purely my own skill level. I will be the first to admit I am no Puyo Puyo or Tetris master. But I eventually stumbled across an explanation, when I found that many others had experienced the same issue; the AI difficulty scaling is very broken; or at least, its designed on a steep curve, and without a built-in easy explanation.

I will say, take what I say with a grain of salt, as I am no game expert myself, but anecdotally I found it to be true. 

Gameplay tends to go like this: You will start a level, each of which has its own difficulty built in, based on your AI opponent. Eventually, you beat that level, and the AI notes your time and adjusts its difficulty modifier for the next level accordingly, so that the AI opponent will be more challenging and be able to win in a shorter span.

Eventually, you hit a peak of your ability to win, and when you lose, you're given two options; "Retry" and "exit to menu." 

If you hit exit to menu, the AI records that loss data, and registers that its possibly being too hard on you, adjusting difficulty for your next match. If, however, you hit retry, it maintains the exact same difficulty modifier as before, making no adjustments for your loss...no matter how many times you may have lost.

In theory, I think this would lead to you continually trying to get better and improving your skills. However, this mechanic is not something that is ever explained in the game, and so in practice, it looks like a frustrating hour-long loop of desperately trying to beat the same level, over and over again, and often dying in under 60 seconds. When I read a discussion of that it matched my experiences, and made me realize why I'd been able to win only when doing 2-3 levels in a sitting, even if they were quick levels.

I think that this game is great for those looking to really improve upon their skills, but for people who had hoped to play just casually, that loop becomes incredibly frustrating. I just found myself hating the experience of playing, which is never fun in a game.

So, tl;dr: Game is good, concept is fun, but gameplay loop can be insanely difficult, imo. Online play also doesn't seem to be very active anymore. Make sure you know what experience you hope to get when you go into the game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198113026824', 'num_games_owned': 374, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1702650733}
review:
An amazing mashup of two of the best puzzle games out there.
If you like Tetris, Puyo Puyo or both, you'll have an absolute blast playing this!
You should probably get Puyo Puyo Tetris 2 though, if you don't care about the story mode.

I personally used to own this game for Nintendo Switch but ended up selling that copy because of the Switch's crappy Joy-Con and Pro Controller dpads that made it literally unplayable to me.
Bought the 2nd game on Xbox recently but came here to beat Puyo Puyo Tetris 1's story before starting the 2nd one.
So I've played it before, but think the story mode from PPT1 is worth the 5 bucks.

review:
came for the tetris and... stayed for the tetris. I don't get puyo at all, and it'll suck a bit if you go for the campaign mode and have to play puyo or have to vs against puyo players. Absolutely unfair in their favour.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137284043', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 761, 'playtime_forever': 463, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 7, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1711655269}
review:
I'm not a very good Puyo Puyo player, because it requires you to pre-plan out your combos and counting for everything that comes in next. Tetris for me is like breathing, I don't have to think and can play it on pure instinct. Mixing those two is brilliant, because it really makes for this beautiful chaos.

I didn't care much for the story, but it had some interesting challanges. It is pretty hard if you suck at any of those two games, but after 3 losses, you can skip a level.

Time to finish: 5,7 hours

Ademas sin contar que esta versiÃ³n tiene algunos errores, una historia mas corta, y mas limitado en contenido a comparaciÃ³n de su secuela.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096281830', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1656312311}
review:
El juego estÃ¡ bien, visualmente decente, aunque las texturas de los bloques no es que sean muy atractivas.
Si se trata de un jugador contra el bot, pero literalmente pasas de ganarle a un bot fÃ¡cil a uno que estÃ¡ en modo dios, no puede ser tan difÃ­cil, no hay medio, es difÃ­cil o fÃ¡cil.
Si se trata de jugar multijugador, nunca encuentras una partida.
PodrÃ­a decir que fuÃ© por muy lejos mÃ¡s entretenido jugar el Tetris Battle que para el colmo era gratuito y las cosas se ganaban jugando, que este juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997007568', 'num_games_owned': 385, 'num_reviews': 76, 'playtime_forever': 945, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 945, 'last_played': 1661882402}
review:
This is a bad, region-locked localization of a very good game, and doesn't allow you to change the text to Japanese to undo the damage. Denuvo DRM is bad as well but not a deal-breaker. There really isn't much to do until you're decent enough at the game(s) to ace the singleplayer. If you're not good enough to beat the campaigns, you're going to be very lonely online.

It's smoothly engineered and it'll hold your attention if you're after a challenge and you don't mind the rewritten characters and dialogue. The story is trite to begin with anyway. The achievements are grindy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097549264', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 49652, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49644, 'last_played': 1660244314}
review:
I love this game. The only reason why I can't recommend it is pretty much because the online is completely vacant with the release of Puyo Puyo Tetris 2, which means there's no good reason to buy this game. If you're looking for a proper negative review? Move on, unless you're interested in a few measly nitpicks I have.

The game is challenging to learn, especially Puyo, but Tetris probably isn't as easy as you think either. But once you learn it? It's one of the best playing puzzle games out there, the controls are super fluid and responsive, and building up large combos is euphoric. This is probably the best playing Tetris game, and the best playing Puyo Puyo game. If you just want a simple client to play Puyo or Tetris with a few friends at a party? this works great for that as well. 

The main campaign of this game is... It's ok. There's a lot of levels, and with this game's many gamemodes, and the fact that its two puzzle games put together, there's a good amount of variety in it too. The actual story is pretty awful, and even downright hard to sit through at times, with characters that all suck... Which makes this one of the best puzzle game stories ever, by default of course. But as a guilty pleasure, I kind of like it. It's sweet and simple, and for a brief second, even tricked me into caring about the characters for half a second, even if it's by using the most overused and shallow ways to make you feel bad for a character.

author: {'steamid': '76561199086258769', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 1612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 39, 'playtime_at_review': 1339, 'last_played': 1711343497}
review:
Puyo Puyo Tetris? Is it worth they money?
--------------------------------------------
this is rather debatable non the less due to the price and in general small fan-base compared to so called Tetris 99 and other games of this genre.

Puyo
--------------------------------------------
Puyo is a Sega original game created to be a difficult puzzle game with these "Puyo's" that can be used to chain and combo, Puyo was originally made for multiplayer so it had a chance to be very competitive.

this game brings it to another level in a way. By including Tetris the game seems to have boosted in popularity! this was from personal experience due to others not being knowledgeable of Puyo's existence, The Premise is fun and exhilarating only putting audiences off due to being a puzzle game. But fret not Puyo in fact is a fun game even by itself!

with its very fun art-style and characters it feels more appealing to those who are playing it, i am unsure if other characters do have an advantage though-
The game-play is rather simple too, connect the Puyo's by rotating and moving them from left to right, and try making chains to beat out the opponent, Just make sure you have room to make a chain or else you lose.
There are about uuh- five?
Red
Blue
Yellow
Green
Purple
This variety of Puyo's can be utilized not by appearance but chains, they are separated by color.

Puyo also has a story mode for itself, its small and bland though so its not an in depth story where they go on a mission to defeat the giant dragon uuuh- lets do Veldora, and make a big town with in depth character development.

 (Reincarnated as a slime reference lol, its good i recommend)

Anyways, its more like introductions and small personality specs like pranking and modesty, nothing big though.

Puyo is in general a very underrated puzzle game that deserves more attention overall so give it a try if you have something like the Nintendo switch super Nintendo online subscription.

Tetris
--------------------------------------------

Tetris was the equivalent to a nuclear war when it came with the gameboy and in general succession, it was massively successful making it to the tops of all selling LITERALLY! it has done very well and is still played to this day! Tetris is Similar to Puyo but with minor- *cough* decently large differences in game-play.

Tetris has overcome many changes to game-play. Before, for the Gameboy, there was no grid, shadow, and with limited view of next pieces. There were no Hard drops whatsoever and switching was never a thing, all there were is just turning and moving pieces to the bottom.

The premise is also simple but even more compared to Puyo.
Tetris uses 7 Pieces for the game

Box
T
L
J
I
S
Z

were the assigned names for the pieces, due to the shape of course, The Pieces are known as Tetraminos, To clear the screen, you must make a full row from left to right. reach the top, and your a goner.

 Tetris was known for its fast pace and difficult way of play, it was based on strategy, observation and speed, unlike Puyo Puyo with predictions and chains, and yes there is definitely strategy and a little bit observation required, But Tetris pieces are so abstract and malformed to where you need to be highly observant of the pieces orientation and placement.

Tetris never had original characters to fit into the game to begin with... up until now. The game has gave Tetris a few and unique characters that are fun to see! though this isn't very important.
And unlike Puyo, Tetris does not have a story mode... its just play and slay basically, just trying to reach the end and get a good score.

Tetris also does have some unique tricks up its sleeve to be more "Flashy" with strategies to gain the best score overall!
There are few i can sometimes do, like a T-spin, though its simple to get that after a bit.

What are similarities?
--------------------------------------------

Puyo and Tetris alike are both Puzzle games believe it or not, i know right its crazy. never would have thought that. 
*cough* anyways
They both have several different pieces, and have several strategies to win.

The games had their chances with online play, so they are moderately adapted to online play, some arent big fans of Tetris 99 due to all the rules and targeting, and i get that tbh-

There arent much of customizability other than themes but the music is unusually catchy! Settings are like they should be, though not crazy, so in general the settings are average for both.

It is obvious but yes they do have the same premise of game-play, but aside from that fact they both have practicing modes where you can just relax and that's also even better for Tetris for some who just want to have a plain ol' Tetris feel

These games yes have similarities but they have differences too so just accept that and have fun!

Anyways lets move on

Price?
--------------------------------------------

Is it worth the 20 bucks they charge you for buying the game? this is debatable due to the love of both games but limited style of game-play

If your going just for Tetris and Puyo and the fun of it, yes it is good but if you want to play online its a lot tougher than that on the computer since a majority of the player base is on console. and this is NOT Cross-platform.

Now this isn't something like 60 dollars for a few hours of a story mode, but it focuses of the play of the game and that's good. so it depends, do you want to play Tetris and Puyo on the same game at any time? or do you want more out of it?

If you want the plain old experience of the puzzle games and the online experience this could be worth if you play puzzle games a lot, Its just the price is a little too high for a competitive puzzle game.

I recommend waiting for a sale to buy this. it isn't worth 20 Bucks if you aren't sure you are going to play this well... a lot, and if you want to go for online play just get it on the console, yes true you need a subscription to play online but that's where the vast majority is.


So what do i give this?

This is an 8/10 due to the nostalgic feeling and true nature to the game, but knocks a few points down due to the high pricing and lack of players

author: {'steamid': '76561197977206728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 2424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 334, 'last_played': 1658537504}
review: The story mode is fun to play through (despite the awful dialogue), but they didn't even attempt to implement skill-based matchmaking.  Your rank appears to be an arbitrary number that is discarded during the matchmaking process, and then they queue you against whoever was the last person to request an online match.  It's great when you are randomly assigned someone anywhere close to your skill level, but most of the time it feels pointless.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154004822', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 312, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1642357444}
review:
[b] Schade, ich habe lange gehadert es mir zu kaufen und glÃ¼cklich Ã¼ber die 10 Euro im Sale bin ich definitiv nicht. [/b] 

[h1] Pro: [/h1] 
-  Tetris :)
- Viele Modi

[h1] Kontra: [/h1]  
- Die meisten Modi kombinieren aber Tetris und das nervige Puyo Puyo
- Steuerung stellt sich ab und zu um
- Gegen den Computer ist langweilig und im Multiplayer findet man nur ganz selten mal einen offenen Raum
- Es dauert ewig eine Lobby zu erstellen, nix mal eben schnell mit einer Runde Tetris

[h1] FÃ¼r ErfolgsjÃ¤ger: [/h1]   
Die meisten Erfolge kommen einfach beim Spielen, aber ihr mÃ¼sst sehr sehr oft spielen.

[h1] Fazit[/h1]
Tja, irgendwie hatte ich mir nichts auÃŸer ein wenig SpaÃŸ erhofft, aber selbst da wurde ich enttÃ¤uscht.
Die Kampagne ist naja, Tetris und Puyo Puyo eben. Selbst wenn man mal nicht in einem Level weiterkommt, muss man es einfach nochmal starten und der Computer baut irgendwann so einen Mist, dass du dich fragst wie du je verlieren konntest. 

Der Multiplayer, auf den ich gebaut hatte, war aber auch nicht das Wahre. Die MenÃ¼steuerung ist nervig, es dauert ewig um eine Lobby aufzumachen. Nach jedem Spiel dann wieder das Gleiche von vorne. Leichter hat man es etwas, wenn man einem Spiel beitritt, denn dort landet man direkt wieder in der Spielersuche, hier kann es aber schon mal vorkommen, dass man dann ewig wartet.

Ein Spiel â†’ Eine Minute â†’ Eine Minute durchs MenÃ¼ klicken â†’ Warten ---> von vorne
Kein Spielfluss, kein SpielspaÃŸ, keine Empfehlung.

review: I'm super thankful over the existence of this game and can only recommend it. When my mental health is draining me, I can turn off my thoughts and just start playing tetris. Also, when you have someone over and it's super awkward and hard to break the ice, this game always helps out. Just recommend to play tetris and vibe to some music. I promise, its a game changer for socially awkward people.

author: {'steamid': '76561198345997413', 'num_games_owned': 264, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 1425, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1196, 'last_played': 1665816580}
review:
I bought this with the intention of getting into Puyo-Puyo, but ended up falling in love with Tetris.
There is a story mode, and is obviously not the deepest thing in the world, but the characters and the energy just spark joy. Having to handle both Puyo-Puyo and Tetris at once is a special kind of fun and getting halfway decent at it (even just for the story mode) is a real treat.
Definitely has a bit of a kiddy aesthetic, but screw it, I feel like a kid again when I play Puyo-Puyo Tetris.

author: {'steamid': '76561198366576547', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 81, 'playtime_forever': 969, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 936, 'last_played': 1674744959}
review:
10/10 Masterpiece.

I never thought that you can play Tetris and Puyo Puyo at the same time. This crossover is mind-blowing.
The game mode are great. The story mode is a little bit weak, but acceptable.

Total and a message to Sega:
In general, this game is challenging and great. You should buy this game if you like Tetris and Puyo Puyo.

Sega, I have a question. (and I don't know where to ask)

Could you please release your older games (Virtua Fighter 1,2,3,4,5 or a Virtua Fighter Anniversary Collection; Skies of Arcadia; Judgement; ...) and your new games (Sonic Colors Ultimate, Virtua Fighter 5 Ultimate Showdown, Lost Judgement ...) to Steam?

I'm looking foward to play those games. And I guess that I'm not the only one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198323079151', 'num_games_owned': 132, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 10186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10171, 'last_played': 1652734649}
review:
I'm 22. About to be 23 in a few months. Here's my story.

When I was 14, I got struck down with depression. This led to me missing a lot of school in highschool and ultimately finishing 9th grade with a single credit.

I spent the rest of my teens trying to play catch up, finally receiving my high school diploma by age 19.

But when things seemed to be going well at 19, I was attacked and nearly raped. By the same relative who molested me my entire childhood. I became suicidal and was diagnosed with PTSD a year later.

At age 20, my mom died from cancer. She was a single parent and raised me all on her own since my deadbeat father left when I was 1.

I was now suffering from daily flashbacks due to my disorder.
Grieving the loss of the only parent I ever had.
And sobbing regularly thanks to the horrific things my father said to me while my mom lay dying in her hospital bed.

At 21, I dropped out of university.
I spent the rest of that year taking odd jobs at factories to pay my bills.

When I turned 22, I thought for sure it was my time to shine and begin living my life...

And then COVID happened.

I turn 23 on Dec 11.

I know I didn't waste my early 20s since I was suffering from so much traumatic shit in the span of a few years that others experience over a lifetime, some never at all.

But as I begin my 23rd year. I feel lost.
My PTSD has been in remission for over a year. And I've healed from the loss of my mother... but I'm struggling to shake the feeling that I lost so much time, and will always play catch up with others in the same life arena.

I don't really know why I wrote all this down, but I guess if there's any other lonely soul out there who happens to see my comment, I just want you to know that you got this.

We didn't choose our life circumstances.
We didn't ask for our lives to go off plan.

But we are alive
We're healthy
We've been blessed with another day

If you're the same age as me, our lives are only just beginning.
If you're older, you too can realize your dreams, escape the rigid safety found in your daily routine, and live the life you thought could never be possible.

If you still got a pulse, God still has a purpose.

If you're still hurting, talk to someone about it.

If you feel bored, get lost in a good book.

If you feel lost or confused, reconnect with that inner child and find time to spend doing the things you loved so much as a little one.

I hope to revisit this review in a few years, perhaps before my 20s are up so I can update how my life has gone since then. Til then...

Take care internet stranger. You got this. :)

review:
It's Puyo Puyo, and it's Tetris. 2 games in one.
The story is what you expect from a Puyo Puyo game (cute characters and silly jokes), and it has some nice challenges, but...
After Puyo Puyo Champions and Puyo Puyo Tetris 2 got launched, the online modes are dead. Which means you will not get the achievments for playing (and winning) on the Puzzle League. Which is my case.
It's still silly fun, so grab it if you have money to spare.

review: Probably the worst thing for a tetris player. If your first instinct is to go online and play against someone, you'd be sorely disappointed because you'll either find some god-tier enthusiast trynna clap your cheeks or no matches at all. When you miserably go through the adventure mode to scratch your itch for tetris, you eventually get forced to play puyo puyo. I basically paid to torture myself.

review: Setting the difficulty of the AI is a little tricky to get used to doing, but it's an enjoyable game overall.  I wish they had a colorblind mode that was unlocked from the beginning for the Puyo Puyo part of the game, but Alphabet Puyos are pretty inexpensive to get and work fine.

author: {'steamid': '76561198262468184', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 953, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 953, 'last_played': 1609444038}
review:
It's two puzzle games mashed together, what more could you ask for? The story mode was pretty enjoyable, with a couple exceptions. Other than than, though, the game feels like it's lacking in singleplayer content. Most of the game is designed around multiplayer, though, so it's still a great time with friends. Just don't expect anything great from the online mode. Most players have moved onto the sequel, and the only people left are pros who will obliterate you in under a minute.

I probably would recommend getting the sequel if you want your time with Puyo Puyo and Tetris to last, but this game is still perfectly fine if you have others to play with or if you want to play the story mode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198252400520', 'num_games_owned': 40, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1594152516}
review:
i'm really sad to live with the fact that a puyo puyo game was the first game that i had to take my money back after all this years using steam since my older account made around 2008... i never expected this from a saga that i always loved since the first one, I would never expect a game with such lack of content... 

the tetris mode almost worth, but, where is everything else? the game is raw, simple, small, few things to do.

basically, everything that people say against pp champions, are mistakes and weakness from tetris, and the good things that they say about tetris are good points from champions, weeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeird. 

what people need to remember is... when pp fever was released, they fixed the gameplay problems, problems that made the old ones short and outdated, is not the fever itself, is the defense and attack system, tetris should offer old and new system at least, but they didn't want, fever mode is not exactly needed, but the new defense style should be here to use if we want, but no, we are limited to ONLY ONE THING. i don't know if they added this option now, but when i was refunded at the beginning of the year, everything was missing. 

that is the most limited pp game since mega drive, i'm not exaggerating, this game is really limited and i was desperate trying to find something, a config, a option, modes, rules, anything, but i found nothing, because the game really not have anything, even puyo puyo sun already came with more thing than this. you can't deny because you know that is literally true.

pp tetris came with a good new mode, but they removed all others, that is the problem, but tetris 2 worth, so, tetris 2 is what tetris 1 should be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089251936', 'num_games_owned': 429, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1728, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 883, 'last_played': 1627572158}
review:
I wish Steam had a ratings system beyond approving or disapproving a game because I am kind of a mixed bag on this one. The game is pretty fun sometimes. However it can get absurdly difficult near the end of it's story mode. Especially if you are unused to one of the two play styles. So if you are used to Tetris but not Puyo Puyo like I am, or vice versa, you're gonna have a rough time. The same thing applies if you aren't quick on your feet, figuratively speaking. A lot of times the game is gonna make either Puyos or Tetriminos drop down at a super fast pace, leaving you very little time to react or think things through and that can screw you up big-time.

The writing is also very mundane, boring (with the exception of Schezo, he is hilarious), and juvenile. It brought me back to an unpleasant memory trip to my childhood, roleplaying on deviantart. But if you can get past that, it's a decent experience. The story is also really lackluster but what else would you expect from a game like this?

If Steam had a more expanded rating system, I'd give it, say, a 3/5. Or perhaps a 7/10. It's nothing too spectacular but it makes for a decent way to kill time so if that's good enough for you then sure. I'd say try it out. You'll probably like it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198080580783', 'num_games_owned': 205, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 2185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1032, 'last_played': 1653718765}
review:
Que puedo decir de Puyo puyo tetris?, bueno, siempre eh querido un juego para PC en el que pueda jugar Tetris en su forma mas avanzada? graficamente, Ya que "Tetris 99" lamentablemente no existe para PC. 
Bueno... este juego cumple y te proporciona muchisima mas diversiÃ³n mezclando a Puyo puyo con tetris. Ya sea que quieras jugar tetris vs tetris o puyo vs puyo o mixeado, este lo tiene, Simplemente muy entretenido.

Unica contra: El juego esta en ingles, y puede que dificulte a muchos que quieran conocer la historia del juego.
En cuanto al resto simplemente una obra maestra.

PD: No voy a mencionar el multiplayer por que sinceramente no me interesa mucho, a menos que tenga amigos que quieran jugar conmigo. ^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198092501204', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 2261, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1687056984}
review:
It's the Neptunia gang playing puyo and tetris, what's not to like. Well okay, just the japanese voices but you could mod the character models and just call this Hiperdimension Nepuzzle or something.
The game has unlockables that are not sold as microtransactions! It puts tears of joy in my eyes!
As a small negative, the menus are a bit convoluted. If you simply want to play endless tetris you have to first go through: Challenge -> Marathon -> Character Select -> Settings -> Toggle Endless on/off.

review: Quality crossover game of two classic puzzle games. A lot of the games writing and charm is borrowed from the Puyo Puyo side of things including characters intented solely to represent tetris. Essentially making the story mode a puyo puyo game with tetris gameplay mixed in. Overall recommend, it was also the only official tetris game on steam until the sequel came out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198395557421', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 156, 'playtime_forever': 478, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 473, 'last_played': 1660940077}
review:
Puyo Puyo Tetris ist ein lustiges Spiel fÃ¼r zwischendurch. Ich kannte vorher nur das Spiel â€Tetrisâ€œ und nicht â€Puyo Puyoâ€œ. Da ich jedoch frÃ¼her Tetris gesuchtet habe und mir der Trailer zusagte, habe ich mir dieses Spiel geholt. 

[b]Was ist Puyo Puyo Tetris?[/b]
SEGA hat hier zwei verschiedene Puzzlespiele zusammengewÃ¼rfelt. FÃ¼r Neulinge steht ein Ãœbungsmodus zur VerfÃ¼gung, der einem Spieler in kurzen Leveln unterschiedliche Regeln erklÃ¤rt. Wer Puyo Puyo nicht kennt, findet hier eine ErklÃ¤rung. Das Spiel bietet unterschiedliche Modi und Herausforderungen. 

[b]Alleine und mit Freunden zocken[/b]
Wer unterschiedliche Herausforderungen mag, kann den Storymodus durchspielen. Ohne viel zu spoilern, lÃ¤sst sich aber sagen, dass hier zwei unterschiedliche Teams aus unterschiedlichen Universen aufeinandertreffen. Diese versuchen herauszufinden, was passiert ist, dass sich diese Welten miteinander mischen und mÃ¶chten wieder alles in Einklang bringen. Diese beiden Teams spielen zwei unterschiedliche Spiele: Puyo Puyo und Tetris. Im Laufe der Story lernst du neue Charaktere kennen und unterschiedliche Herausforderungen sorgen dafÃ¼r, dass dir nicht langweilig wird. FÃ¼r jede Herausforderung erhÃ¤ltst du eine Bewertung und kannst bis zu drei Sterne-Bewertungen erhalten. Zum Weiterspielen reicht jedoch ein Stern.  Du kannst online oder offline unterschiedliche Spielmodi spielen. Wenn du dich nicht entscheiden kannst, ob du Puyo Puyo oder Tetris lieber spielen willst- kannst du auch einfach beides wÃ¤hlen, also das fusionieren oder du wÃ¤hlst einen Modus aus, indem du zwischen beiden Spielen hin- und herwechselst in einer Spielrunde. 
Ich habe dieses Spiel mit geteiltem Bildschirm mit jemandem gespielt. Spielst du mit einem Freund, kannst du auswÃ¤hlen, ob du noch KI-Gegner dabeihaben mÃ¶chtest und in welcher Schwierigkeitsstufe. Die KI-Gegner sind nicht einfach zu besiegen. Entspanntes Spielen mit Freunden geht jedoch auch ohne KI. Wobei das gar nicht so entspannend ist- jeder Spieler kann beispielsweise sein Spiel auswÃ¤hlen oder ob er mischen mÃ¶chte und das Ziel ist, seinen Mitspieler zuzubauen, damit er die obere Linie erreicht. Da kannst du nachhelfen, in dem du mÃ¶glichst viele Puyo Puyo-Farbenkombinationen oder einen Tetris baust. Dein Mitspieler erhÃ¤lt dann netterweise Blocksteine oder Reihen in sein Spielfeld. Im Onlinemodus kannst du gegen Spieler weltweit spielen und rausfinden, wer der wahre Tetris- /Puyo Puyo â€“ Meister ist.
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2461081245

[b]Meine Endwertung:[/b]
-[b]Preis-/LeistungsverhÃ¤ltnis[/b]: 6,5/10. Das Rad wurde ja nicht neu erfunden, da beide Spiele, die hier zusammengefÃ¼hrt wurden, ja bereits schon vorhanden waren. Aber die Idee, das zu mischen und daraus ein lustiges, unterhaltsames, sÃ¼ÃŸes und stressiges Spiel zu machen, ist schon gut. Den Vollpreis find ich jedoch vergleichsweise eher grenzwertig. 
- [b]SpaÃŸ mit Freunden?[/b] Ja, das durchaus. Aber sorgt auch schnell fÃ¼r Frustation, wenn einer sehr gut in diesen Spielen ist und der andere quasi dann als AnfÃ¤nger einsteigt.
- [b]Steuerung[/b]: Keine Probleme festgestellt. Bei geteiltem Bildschirm haben wir Tastatur und Controller benutzt und es lief flÃ¼ssig.
-[b] Wiederspielwert [/b]: Ja, fÃ¼r zwischendrin ja. Langwierig Ã¼ber Stunden hinweg wÃ¤re das fÃ¼r mich persÃ¶nlich nichts, da die Reaktionsgeschwindigkeit mit der Zeit einfach nachlÃ¤sst und manche Herausforderungen nicht so leicht sind.
- Charakterdesign: Kawaii! <3 Simpel gehalten, gezeichnet und erinnert an Mangafiguren (was durch die Vertonung noch bestÃ¤rkt wird). 
-[b] Soundtrack[/b]: Da du nicht einschlafen sollst, ist der Soundtrack etwas dynamischer und â€peppigerâ€œ. Ich finde, der Soundtrack passt zum Spiel. 
- [b]Dialoge der Story[/b]: Ich denke, es erwartet hier keiner tiefgrÃ¼ndige Story, die Story ist sehr simpel, etwas absurd, aber trotzdem unterhaltsam und sÃ¼ÃŸ. 
[b]Kaufempfehlung?[/b] Wer Tetris oder/ und Puyo Puyo mag, sollte sich das auf jeden Fall mal anschauen. Es ist halt ein Puzzlespiel auf Zeit, welches mit steigendem Schwierigkeitsgrad oder gegen gute Spieler, schnelle Reaktion erfordert.

review: 80 Hours. That's my playtime, and this game isn't even my most loved game. I just played it for that long. But, I digress, that game is good no matter what, but, with the sequel out on most platforms, there really isn't a reason to buy this game. Maybe a good incentive is to lower the price of it dramatically, like down to PPC's price. (10 USD) The game's still really fun, but taken down by it's sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970757009', 'num_games_owned': 163, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 3799, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3661, 'last_played': 1619502831}
review: If you see other reviews with less than 10 hours saying they don't recommended this game, don't take anything they say seriously. The fact that I have over 61 hours as of writing this review means that for $20, this game has a lot of content to it. Also, if you like getting destroyed by masters of this game when playing online, well you are in luck, this is your game! The story and other single play modes are also quite challenging to grasp sometimes. So go ahead, what are you waiting for, go pop some Puyos or lining up Tetriminos!

author: {'steamid': '76561198107785304', 'num_games_owned': 167, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 980, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 976, 'last_played': 1663977862}
review:
Reviewing this from a perspective of a tetris player.

The matchmaking is pretty bad due to a lack of players.
There is 0 customization for DAS and other basic features.
There is random input delay for PC players so its better to play on console.
You pay to player a worse version of free alternatives such as https://tetr.io/ and https://jstris.jezevec10.com/
They are making puyo puyo 2 with all the exact same features but it costs $30 dollars for some reason.

author: {'steamid': '76561198857903686', 'num_games_owned': 100, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4157, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1873, 'last_played': 1710458453}
review: I'm not personally interested in the puyo puyo side of the game nor particularly concerned with the story, I'm only here for the tetris. This game has many multiplayer features and modes but for someone like me that has no one else to play with ;), I rely on the offline tetris challenges. Theres only about 3 good modes: marathon, ultra and sprint. This is a pretty basic set of modes and not worth the money. However I'll definitely play them coz I love tetris! (also as a side note the time it takes to clear a line isn't too long to go for any real records so anyone interesting in going pro shouldn't be playing this). It really does hurt me to 'not recommend' this but it really isn't worth it for me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198127563474', 'num_games_owned': 138, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 6099, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5338, 'last_played': 1643708474}
review:
Super simple and fun party games!
Or! It has a solo story for you to play and enjoy a multitude of characters and shenanigans!
But absolutely worth getting just to body all your friends with your tetris skills.
(or body your tetris friends with puyo)

author: {'steamid': '76561198152576155', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 413, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 327, 'last_played': 1654755068}
review: I owned this game on Nintendo Switch for a time as well; this port seems to be just as good. Most of my time has been playing Tetris (which is excellent in this game imo) but the fusion mode playing with both Tetriminos and Puyos is good for a challenge, especially if you aren't as familiar with Puyo. The multiplayer arcade section has some really interesting challenges to throw in the mix as well (attacks to make your opponent's pieces insta-drop, pentaminos (5 block Tetris pieces), etc.). Great replay value for the money!

review:
A game that I played for hundred of hours on PS3, before it was on steam, and I finally got the chance to buy it.
It is sad that I came late, online has only few people and most of the modes are dead, but the story is still great and worth playing, also Puyo Puyo Tetris 2 is coming on March and I am definitely buying it, only buy this game if you want to support this great franchise, other than that wait for Puyo Puyo Tetris 2.

Controls are solid.

review: I personally liked that the story was a deep analysis of human desires and that you can't trust everyone. One of my favorite characters that i thought were my friends turned out to crush me with the jellys found in Puyo Puyo. I really recommend this to people that have been wanting an in depth story.

review: It's a very cute and challenging puzzle game that gets more challenging each level you complete. The characters are also incredibly lovable and hilarious in their own ways that you get attached to them super fast, and the story is amazing with the dialogue and plot.

author: {'steamid': '76561198243014926', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 271, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 147, 'last_played': 1711162239}
review: Perhaps this game was a bit too high concept for some of you out there so I'll break it down for you more simple lot. Ultimately the game is a struggle betwixt artificial technology and archaic magic, a conflict as old as the advancement of society itself. But those of the land of Puyo and Tetris see no need to come in to conflict for they are ends to the same mean, change. And with this change comes the furthering of civilization and even ourselves, our humanity. Why did they make the green block kind of hot? From this cooperation of means each can find a way to expand their horizons. As Thomas Vato once said in his seminal work Questology "To manage complexity one needs to understand it to release oneself from the comfort zone or liberate the comfort zone from prejudice." (Vato). In summary release Puyo Puyo Box in the US cowards.

I'll definitely get better and challenge Suisei Hoshimachi.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097166383', 'num_games_owned': 368, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 2277, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1831, 'last_played': 1619856420}
review:
God where do I even begin?
The story and characters are great, there's a decent selection of game modes, and there's online matchmaking.
Story mode is fully voiced, pretty funny, and offers a good single player experience.
But I hate playing online. Nobody plays free play, so you'll almost never find a match there.
Puzzle league though? Good lord, puzzle league. You better hope you can move pieces at hyper speed, perform fantastic T-Spins, and set up good 4-wide/DT-Cannons. Seriously, it's so hard to get a match with someone my skill level, and don't even get me started on the highly skilled puyo players that are near impossible to stop if you cant drop a reasonable amount of garbage on them ASAP. I can't count the amount of times I've been ended by the first chain my opponent has cleared...

author: {'steamid': '76561198850679647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 1870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1060, 'last_played': 1620404313}
review:
I don't really like to say it, but i'll be honest with this game. Bought it from the Winter sale 2020. It's a bit of late, because the sequel is already out, but who cares. I absolutely love this game. It's fun, it got all the things I wanted from Tetris, with that I got finally properly introduced to Puyo Puyo. I have known Puyo Puyo for a long time. From the first game, I've seen it once and if I remember correctly, once tried it. The game got fun and entertaining story and good characters.
This game is worth it, in my opinion.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170175641', 'num_games_owned': 716, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 9192, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7008, 'last_played': 1627256176}
review:
Came into this with absolutely no knowledge of the Puyo series, came out of this loving it and wishing for more to be localized. Puyo Puyo is addicting and really fun!

The game itself is wonderful, the story mode is a great entry point for either series to help you learn, or to just have fun with the charming characters.

It's basically dead online wise, the only people you'll run into are way too good at the game, so that's really the only thing I wouldn't recommend, but if you have any friends to have a private lobby with, this is TONS of fun. 

With the sequel releasing soon on PC, I would recommend it more - simply because it's basically the same game but the sequel has more content and quality of life changes. The only downside is that the characters no longer call out Sega when you launch the game :(

TLDR; would definitely recommend this game for some fun lighthearted puzzle content.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121126521', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1738, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1738, 'last_played': 1609218800}
review:
Well done.  Clean, snappy interface, pretty much what you'd expect from a tetris / puyo puyo mix, with many options and variations.  The character personalities have just a few phrases they keep repeating, and that's really the only part that gets annoying about the game.

On linux, I also found if I leave it unattended long enough that my screensaver would kick in, they didn't work well together and the game hangs.  Fortunately that's pretty rare.

author: {'steamid': '76561198804016984', 'num_games_owned': 106, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 71780, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71752, 'last_played': 1703367539}
review:
Will give this a like purely because of how much I enjoyed it. worth it for the league content. while it might not offer the most fluid or extensive tetris or puyo engine, DAS was slow for my taste and line breaks lowers skill ceiling a bit (tetris main), but overall it was a fun experience. 

Don't recommend buying it NOW though, sequel is coming out in spring.

author: {'steamid': '76561198253298731', 'num_games_owned': 276, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 14412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10992, 'last_played': 1706662759}
review:
[h1] A Brief Summary [/h1]

Overall, this is an amazing puzzle fighter, with a good amount of content to keep you coming back.

[h1] The Casual Experience (Singleplayer) [/h1]

As a puzzle game crossover it does its job. The Tetris and Puyo mechanics are solid. It has everything you'd expect in a Tetris game like score, time attack and endless modes, plus a few other competitive modes (my favorite of which being Swap). The game even has a charming little adventure mode that's actually a pretty good introduction to all the various modes in the game, and as a new player the adventure mode was actually relatively challenging.

That being said as a Puyo game it is honestly a bit bare bones on modes. Previous Puyo games had a plethora of casual and fun modes, something Puyo Puyo Tetris unfortunately lacks, which is a shame because I feel this game has a lot of potential for unique modes.

Nevertheless the game still has a good amount of content and features.

[h1] The Competitive Experience (Multiplayer) [/h1]

Competitively, this is one of the most fun games I've ever played. This game has an extremely high skill ceiling and you'll keep improving even after spending thousands of hours into this game.

That being said it isn't perfect.

Getting into both of these games competitively as the tutorials only teach you the basic mechanics of each game, and you'd have to rely on external sources to better learn key concepts such as Tetris openers, or Puyo chaining forms which are key to playing the game.

If you're playing Tetris vs Tetris its a speedy/aggressive endurance match. Puyo vs Puyo is slower paced where almost every piece dropped is critical to overwhelm your opponent. Both fun in their own right. Puyo vs Tetris on the other hand is a bit of a mess:

From a Tetris player's perspective: 
A Puyo player can be so annoyingly defensive, seemingly taking an endless amount damage and still surviving, and when they attack they do an unreasonable amount of damage. Either the match ends too quickly and not much of a fight is made, or the match drags on for far too long until you make a single mistake which will lead to your demise.

For a Puyo player's perspective:
As a Puyo player you are conditioned to build large chains, but when faced with a fast Tetris player that doesn't become an option as you are forced to deal with an endless amount of garbage, blocking your chains off and have to pray that the game's RNG is kind enough to let you survive. It can be an endurance match that can feel unwinnable sometimes.

There is also one over-centralising mechanic in Tetris called the 4-wide. I won't get into too much detail,  but it is an extremely annoying strategy to deal with, regardless of the mode.

The game's online is decent enough. Most matches I've played are very fluent, with lag usually not being a factor, though I had a few times, when the game would disconnect a match for seemingly no reason.

Be wary though that the Random Matchmaking (aka Puzzle League), at least in this version of the game, matches you up with literally anyone, and I would recommend the console versions instead if you were interested in playing online with random people as those games attempt to match you with someone around your rating (though it may not help that the sequel is out a lot of the player-base migrated to that game)

[h1] Concluding thoughts [/h1]

Throughout the course of this review I've been VERY critical of this game, however overall I love this game. Its the game that introduced me to competitive Puyo and Tetris both games that I have an extreme amount of fun with today, and still keep coming back to. Its a good game casually, and is one of the best competitive Tetris games out there (and THE BEST official Tetris game yet.

[i] *As for competitive Puyo, Puyo Puyo Champions is a slightly better competitive experience, but the Puyo is still great in this game. [i]

review:
its fun if you're literally a god because that's what everyone else is.
going into matchmaking is like throwing a 2 minute old baby into the ocean.
new one came out, buy that one when its available for steam, this one quickly died.
better if you go outside and make friends and then realise how sad everyone that is above 3000 rating has literally no life or is a seasoned tournament player who reaches the final at every event, then uninstalling the game.
overall game is 8/10 but unless you are ridiculously good it will probably be a 2/10

review: Overall, this game is fun. I really enjoy playing Tetris. Also, Puyo Puyo is a little difficult to play (Well for me anyway). This game is competitive with the puzzle matches. Also, the party mode creates non-stop challenges. In addition, the story, especially the extra content, is random and humorous. Finally, the unlockables make the game enjoyable. Overall, a nice, fun, and competitive game.

review:
[h1][b][u]OVERALL[/u]: 8/10[/b][/h1]

Puyo Puyo and Tetris are both legendary games by now and mixing the two is nicely executed here. You get your classic Tetris and puyo puyo modes and a mix of the two on the same grid. It is quite a fair value on a sale. Be mindful that online play most likely is deader than dead by now.

Also could have done without this BS Kawai art style !!!

"Puyos and Tetriminos Collide in a Frantic Four-Player Puzzle Mashup!"

Â°IntroduÃ§Ã£oÂ°

A Sega vendo potÃªncial para uma segunda (ou terceira?) chance de localizar a sÃ©rie no ocidente lanÃ§ando em 2017 uma localizaÃ§Ã£o para PS4 e Switch se valendo de uma brecha na questÃ£o de direitos de Tetris (que estavam por um tempo pela Ubisoft, criadora do terrÃ­vel Tetris Ultimate).

Finalmente em 2018 a sÃ©rie chega na Steam depois de alguns teases nos forÃºns da plataforma de jogos anteriores da Sega.

Â°GameplayÂ°

Tetris usa o sistema SRS como mandado pela Tetris Guideline entÃ£o Ã© garantido Quality of Life como peÃ§as fantasmas, cores fixas, etc. O seu objetivo como desde 84 Ã© completar "linhas" para ou subir a tela de outro jogador de Tetris ou lanÃ§ar "puyos lixos" caso seja uma partida mista, como tambÃ©m fazer "spins" com peÃ§as em entradas especificas assim criando ataques mais poderosos para seu oponente.

O controle para ambos sÃ£o bem idÃªnticos, vocÃª pode locomover as peÃ§as para os lados ou segurar para baixo como "soft drop", botÃµes para girar no sentido horÃ¡rio ou anti-horÃ¡rio. Tetris contÃ©m duas features extras: um "hard drop" que permite num instante fazer cair a peÃ§a no lugar planejado e um botÃ£o para "segurar" uma peÃ§a para usar depois mas vocÃª nÃ£o pode usar duas vezes seguidas.

Â°PersonagensÂ°

O nÃºmero 24 foi algo sagrado para a Sega atÃ© este jogo, portanto alguns personagens de Fever como Accord, Lidelle, Yu & Rei, Ocean Prince, etc... tiveram que dar espaÃ§o para Tetris ter sua representatividade com novas personalidades, eles sÃ£o:

Tee: CapitÃ£o da nave espacial Tetra, o atual "Rei do Tetris", ele encontra Ringo quando tetraminÃ³s caem do cÃ©u em Suzuran. Puyo dropset igual a Ringo.
O: Parceiro do capitÃ£o, oficial de comunicaÃ§Ã£o e mascote, apenas se comunica por "pi" e "bi", basicamente Carbuncle de Tetris. Herda dropset de Onion Pixie.
Ess: Navegadora da tripulaÃ§Ã£o. Ã‰ fofa porÃ©m pirralha, rude e chorona, ama seu "Papa". Roubou lugar e dropset de Lidelle.
Ai: O antropomÃ³rfico chiuaua, chefe engenheiro da tripulaÃ§Ã£o bem cavalheiro e inteligente, facilmente tiltado pelos gÃªmeos abaixo. Usa dropset de Donguri Gaeru.
Jay&Elle: A dupla inseparÃ¡vel e insuportÃ¡vel em suas travessuras, falam em sincronia. NÃ£o surpreendente reutilizam dropset dos fantasmas Yu&Rei
Zed: O aparente intimidador mas esforÃ§ado "dono de casa" da nave, "Pai" de Ess. Dropset de Ocean Prince.

Os personagens Schezo, Feli, Draco, Sat-"Dark Prince", Witch, Ecolo, Lemres e ?? precisam ser habilitados jogando o modo Adventure. Ã‰ tambÃ©m possÃ­vel habilitar sets de voz alternativos, indo desde versÃµes mais hilÃ¡rias, curiosas ou sÃ©rias/assustadoras dos bonecos.

Â°OfflineÂ°

O jogo contÃ©m diversos modos, Adventure vocÃª acompanha o desenrolar da histÃ³ria de Ringo e seus amigos conhecendo a trupÃª da nave Tetra enquanto tentam desvender o mistÃ©rio da junÃ§Ã£o tanto dos mundos de Puyo como Tetris mas claro sem perder o bom humor. Solo e Multiplayer Arcade sÃ£o modos mais tradicionais, eles sÃ£o:

Versus: Batalhe com um ou mais oponentes/amigos com livre escolha entre puyo e tetris. Jogando contra a CPU vocÃª pode decidir uma batalha personalizada ou o modo Endurance em que vocÃª enfrenta um infinito numero de oponentes atÃ© perder.
Fusion: Um dos piores modos do jogo, como a traduÃ§Ã£o em portuguÃªs diria Ã© uma "fusÃ£o" entre tetris e puyo puyo, hÃ¡ uma colher de chÃ¡ que vocÃª pode fazer "cadeias" em cima da hora assim como "linhas" de tetris.
Swap: Alterna entra um campo de Tetris e um de Puyo Puyo em tempos prÃ© determinados, pode fazer cadeias ou linhas de ultima hora para atazanar seu oponente na transiÃ§Ã£o.
Big Bang: Puyo aqui Ã© bem parecido com o modo Fever em que vocÃª deve achar o "gatilho" de cadeias prontas enquanto tetris hÃ¡ entradas prontinhas para alocar peÃ§as precisando apenas velocidade ou cuidado caso apareÃ§a buracos que apenas possam ser usado com "spins".

Challenge contÃ©m modos apenas disponiveis para single player, descrevendo eles:

Endless Fever: Um "Big Bang" de puyo sozinho.
Endless Puyo: VocÃª contra um tempo prÃ© determinado faÃ§o o maior numero de cadeias ou ligaÃ§Ãµes de puyo.
Tiny Puyo: Muito parecido com o anterior mas puyos menores permitem um campo e cadeias maiores.
Sprint: Complete 40 linhas de Tetris o mais rÃ¡pido possÃ­vel.

Ultra: Em 3 minutos faÃ§a seu melhor lol.

Â°OnlineÂ°

HÃ¡ trÃªs modos relevantes:

Puzzle League: Um passÃ¡vel porÃ©m mal planejado modo online competitivo, vocÃª pode nas opÃ§Ãµes desligar os modos mais gimmicks mas ironicamente aqui mostra a fraqueza do crossover, nÃ£o Ã© equilibrado uma partida entre Tetris e Puyo, o que nÃ£o seria um problema caso tivesse opÃ§Ã£o de enfrentar apenas um deles. Caso consiga tolerar ou nÃ£o ver problema infelizmente vocÃª dificilmente irÃ¡ achar contras, achando sÃ£o monstros que irÃ£o atropelar vocÃª em 1 minuto...

Free Play: Caso tenha amigos com o jogo ou entre em um discord que jogue, vocÃª pode abrir salas com diversas opÃ§Ãµes, atÃ© algumas como liberar hard drop para Puyo e claro embates com atÃ© quatro jogadores.

If PPT2 ever comes out on Steam, expect a similar review, as well as some real backlash. You earned it, you richy f**gots.

author: {'steamid': '76561198442202891', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 17144, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15729, 'last_played': 1703032300}
review: This game does a great job of taking two different puzzle games and pitting them together in a very fun way. The visuals are great, all the different game modes are addicting, and the story, while pretty simple and somewhat childish, has a certain charm to it that makes it fun to play through. Of course, there are a few issues, such as the online matchmaking and Tetris having the advantage over Puyo, but overall it is a great game that I would recommend to both Puyo and Tetris fans.

author: {'steamid': '76561198124445301', 'num_games_owned': 219, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 947, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 862, 'last_played': 1636831267}
review:
Esto sera algo controversial pero aqui la reseÃ±a: El juego iba a estar lanzado despues de Puyo Puyo 7 en japon pero debido a las reglas de SEGA de sacar 2 aÃ±os y medio de sacar el juego nos sacaron Puyo 20TH, por eso se nota casi unos rasgos. Tengo tanto quejas como buenas.

Lo Bueno:
- Graficos y fondos muy buenos
- La jugabilidad se Mantiene de los Puyos que nos deja acostumbrados
- El modo Online para jugar con amigos y otros del mundo aunque es casi escaso en la versiÃ³n de Steam
- Algunos modos como el SWAP son muy divertidos

Lo Malo:
- MÃºsica olvidable y algunos refritos del 20 Aniversario
- Trama mala (ejemplo la flanderizacion de los personajes principales, los Tetra Crew no hacen absoulatemente nada en la trama, o relleno como el entramiento del mundo 6)
- Desbloqueables a partir de finaizar el mundo 4 
- Estrellas que la verdad no sirven de nada y solo te da un logro si los consigues todos pero no hay mucha motivacion de rencompensa
- Dificultad del Modo Aventura FÃ¡cil
- DENUVO
- El modo fusiÃ³n es un desastre
- Barrera de Idioma ya que ingles no se apega casi al Japones haciendo que cambie la situaciÃ³n y cambios de personalidad en personajes claro ejemplo como Sig
ConclusiÃ³n: La verdad lo veo como un buen juego pero no superior a los juegos de Puyo Puyo, ni tampoco como el mejor crossover porque se siente algunas partes del potencial desperdiciados. Este juego esta ok para empezar entrar a la franquicia. 7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198169966101', 'num_games_owned': 24, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9833, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1501, 'last_played': 1707821047}
review:
Puyo Puyo Tetris is two great puzzle games in one package, with the possibility to play one against the other, or both at the same time, with the computer or other people. This game also includes a decent story made up of 7 main acts and 3 extra ones.
The one small issue I have with this game is how "Puzzle League" can match you with way better players.
Overall, Puyo Puyo Tetris is a very fun title.

author: {'steamid': '76561198277181291', 'num_games_owned': 217, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 6280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4155, 'last_played': 1708478176}
review:
As much as I love this game (and I really do!), it's hard to go back to Puyo Puyo Tetris after playing standalone tetris games like tetr.io and nullpomino. The pieces lock in and top out near the top rather than giving extra headroom for rotating, there are no settings for DAS/ARR, and the time it takes for a line to clear makes any method other than tetrises almost futile for sprint. As a pure tetris game, you can do much much better for free. 


In addition, the balance between tetris and puyo puyo is also not very good. The tetris player seemingly has to work a good deal harder than the puyo player to match the amount of garbage being sent (at least at my level of play), and getting a perfect clear start in puyo (which is pure and simple luck) guarantees a tetris player to the grave as long as the puyo player knows what they're doing. As a puyo puyo game, this *was* your best shot, until PP Champions came out. 


The game does not function very well as pure tetris, is an average Puyo Puyo game, and is mediocre at mashing them up. However as it is, this game is still awesome. The characters are charming and cute (Feli gang!), and the spells are pretty much the only reason I still choose to return to Puyo Puyo Tetris. I really, from the bottom of my heart, hope that Puyo Puyo Tetris 2 can improve upon the mistakes that are present in Puyo Puyo Tetris 1 as well as improving upon it's strengths. 


(This review is from the perspective of a pure Tetris player, so take most of my talk about Puyo Puyo with a grain of salt.)
