review:
Folgt uns auf: [url=store.steampowered.com/curator/32139821/]German Review Group Curator Site[/url] fÃ¼r weitere Reviews und [url=store.steampowered.com/curator/35795476-Wolferatus-Review-Group/]My Curator Site[/url], wenn ihr mehr von mir lesen wollt.

[h1][b]Puyo Puyoâ„¢TetrisÂ®[/b][/h1]
https://youtu.be/bXusn55QZC4 
[h1][b]Publisher:[/b][/h1]
Sega ist ein japanisches Unternehmen, das offiziell 1952 in Japan gegrÃ¼ndet wurde, der Name SEGA leitet sich von â€Service Gamesâ€œ ab. Das Unternehmen hat mittlerweile Ã¼ber 10.700 Angestellte. SEGA stellt auÃŸer Konsolen- und PC Spiele auch Spielautomaten her.  

2005 stellte SEGA die Entwicklung von Spielekonsolen ein, nach dem Nintendo allerdings solchen Erfolg mit seinen Mini Konsolen hatte, wurde am 19. September 2019 der Mega Drive Mini mit 42 vorinstallierten Spielen verÃ¶ffentlicht.

[h1][b]Story:[/b][/h1]
Puyo Puyo oder Tetris? Oder beides? Du hast die Wahl. Spiele gegen den Computer oder Freunde, versuche dich im Multiplayer gegen unbekannte und steig in der Rangliste auf. Du stehst eher auf einen Story-Modus? Dann starte deine Kampagne und werde zum Puyo Puyo-Tetris KÃ¶nig/in. 

[h1][b]Anmerkung:[/b][/h1]
Dieses Spiel bekommt von mir nur ganz knapp eine Positive Bewertung, da es mir aber SpaÃŸ macht und ich nicht viel Wert auf den MP lege. Eigentlich wÃ¼rde ich Neutral bevorzugen, aber diese MÃ¶glichkeit gibt es leider bei Steam nicht. 

[h1][b]Gameplay:[/b][/h1]
WÃ¤hle zwischen Adventure-, Solo Arcade- und Multiplayer Arcade Modus, dein Spiel aus. Im Adventure Modus spielst du die Story die sich zwischen Tetris und Puyo Puyo abwechselt, im Solo Arcade Modus kannst du dann verschiedene Spielarten wÃ¤hlen wie bspw. Versus oder Party, hier spielst du gegen den Computer. Im Multiplayer Arcade trittst du gegen andere Spieler auf der ganzen Welt an.

Puyo Puyo Tetris ist nicht fÃ¼r Kinder geeignet, ich wÃ¼rde schon fast sagen, es ist nicht mal fÃ¼r AnfÃ¤nger geeignet die keine Skills drauf haben wie ich. Die KI kann nicht eingestellt werden und in den meisten Modis schafft man nicht mal 5 KI-Gegner, weil sie einen mit Skills raushauen ehe man sich versieht. Ein lockeres Spielen wie es damals beim Tetris Gameboy Spiel war ist nur bedingt mÃ¶glich. 

Das Spiel wurde definitiv fÃ¼r Hardcore Spieler entwickelt. Bis auf den Story Modus sind nÃ¤mlich fast alle Modis kaum zu schaffen fÃ¼r AnfÃ¤nger, man muss ziemlich schnell sein und die Steuerung vor allem perfekt beherrschen.  

[h1][b]Sound und Grafik:[/b][/h1]
Der Sound ist gewÃ¶hnungsbedÃ¼rftig, kann im Solo-Modus aber angepasst werden. Der beste Sound ist natÃ¼rlich der modernisierte Themensong von Tetris, er hat zwar nicht ganz so Ohrwurm-feeling wie das Original, macht aber dennoch viel SpaÃŸ. Die Grafik ist gut, schÃ¶ne Charaktere im Anime lock, verschiedene Puyo Puyo Figuren die man auswÃ¤hlen kann und die Tetris Steinchen sehen natÃ¼rlich in ihrer Farbenpracht genauso aus wie man es gewohnt ist.

[h1][b]Tutorial:[/b][/h1]
Das Tutorial erklÃ¤rt dem Spieler wie Mechaniken und Tricks die man einsetzen kann, allerdings zeigt das Tutorial bei der PC-Version nur die Keyboard Steuerung und nicht die Steuerung mit dem Controller.  Man kann auch nicht mit Ãœbungsspielen Ã¼ben, sondern muss sich quasi die Videoclips einprÃ¤gen. Dadurch ist auch kein leichter Einstieg mÃ¶glich, da keiner der Modis im Spiel dies zulÃ¤sst. (Ausnahme - Story Modus)
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1966432172
[h1][b]Multiplayer:[/b][/h1]
Solltet ihr keine Profis sein, vergesst den Multiplayer gegen Radom Leute, ihr werdet zu 98% gegen Spieler antreten, die euren Rang weit Ã¼berschreiten als AnfÃ¤nger. Ich hatte Ã¼berwiegend Gegner die zwischen den Top 2500 und Top 16000 waren. Die Gegner machen einen so schnell fertig, dass man nicht mal 4 Tetris Steinchen gelegt hat, was definitiv keinen SpaÃŸ macht und auch keine Herausforderung ist, da man null Chance hat.

Der Multiplayer ist nur dann zu empfehlen, wenn ihr ihn mit Freunden Spielt, die euren Rank ungefÃ¤hr haben bzw. dieselben Skills wie ihr. Sollte einer eurer Freunde das Spiel nicht besitzen, aber gerne Spielen wollen mit euch kÃ¶nnt ihr ihn einladen, Puyo Puyo Tetris unterstÃ¼tzt Remote Play und funktioniert sehr gut.

[h1][b]Adventure Modus:[/b][/h1]
Im Adventure Modus spielt man mit einem beliebigen Charakter gegen die KI in einer Art Story Modus. Es gibt verschiedene Stages mit jeweils 9 Level. Die Stages wechseln sich mit Tetris und Puyo Puyo ab. Der Adventure Modus ist gut spielbar, hier ist die KI nicht so extrem wie im Single Arcade Modus. Die Schwierigkeit steigt mit jeder Stage und jedem Level etwas an. FÃ¼r mich persÃ¶nlich der beste Modus den man zu beginn spielen kann, da man hier die Spielvarianten kennenlernt und nach und nach besser und vor allem schneller wird.

[h1][b]KI:[/b][/h1]
Die KI ist bis auf den Adventure Modus ziemlich stark, man sollte sich gefasst machen, recht schnell, vor allem zu beginn, besiegt zu werden. Desto trotz macht es SpaÃŸ und ist eine ziemliche Herausforderung. Ich hÃ¤tte mir zwar vor allem am Anfang gewÃ¼nscht, dass die KI etwas lockerer beginnt, damit man einen schnelleren bzw. leichteren Einstieg in Tetris oder Puyo Puyo findet, aber naja, man kann nicht alles haben, zum GlÃ¼ck stehen uns dafÃ¼r die Einstellungen Battle und Endurance zur VerfÃ¼gung, die etwas Abwechslung bieten.  
https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1966432224
[h1][b]Fazit:[/b][/h1]
Puyo Puyo Tetris ist ein gutes Spiel, leider im Multiplayer fÃ¼r AnfÃ¤nger, gegen Radom Leute unbrauchbar. Sollte man sich dieses Spiel also dafÃ¼r anschaffen, kann ich vom Kauf nur abraten, es sei denn ihr seid richtige Profis und kÃ¶nnt mit den Top 20.000 Spieler der Welt mithalten, denn das werden zu 98% eure Gegner sein. Dies wird sich auch nicht mehr Ã¤ndern, da das Spiel sein letztes Update im Mai 2018 bekam.

Ebenfalls keine Kaufempfehlung von mir, sollte man dieses Spiel seinen Kindern kaufen die unter 12 oder 14 sind. Das Spiel ist definitiv nicht fÃ¼r Kinder geeignet, sondern wurde mehr fÃ¼r Hardcore Spieler erstellt. Sollte allerdings euer Kind so ein Hardcore-Zocker sein, dann nur zu. 

Ich empfehle das Spiel in einem guten Sale mit mindestens 40% an Spieler, die eine Herausforderung suchen, gerne den Story Modus spielen mÃ¶chten und mit Freunden via Remote Play SpaÃŸ haben wollen. Die verschiedenen Modis machen SpaÃŸ, bringen Abwechslung und durch den Story Modus lassen sich neue MusikstÃ¼cke usw. freischalten.  Man hat viele Charaktere zur Auswahl, jeder von ihnen hat seine FÃ¤higkeiten und StÃ¤rken, die man im Spiel einsetzen kann. 

Leider ist es nicht so gut wie Tetris damals auf Gameboy oder Tetris Effect, wer aber gerne Puyo Puyo spielt kommt auf jeden Fall auf seine Kosten. Wer sich nur fÃ¼r Tetris interessiert, sollte auf Tetris Effect warten und diesen Titel ignorieren.

author: {'steamid': '76561198135396975', 'num_games_owned': 119, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 7414, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6423, 'last_played': 1657764571}
review:
Over 100 hours later I think I can finally review this. TD;LR at the bottom.

Puyo Puyo Tetris is a game where you can rep your waifu or husbando while playing Puyo or Tetris. The best part? One player can play Puyo while the other plays Tetris!

For $20 you get:
[list]
    [*]A full story mode, which is cute, funny, and a great way to learn the basics of Puyo and Tetris.
    [*]Challenge modes for single player which include 3 challenges for each game. (Endless Fever, Endless Puyo, Tiny Puyo, Marathon, Ultra, and Sprint)
    [*]Five Online, Local Multiplayer, vs AI game modes (Versus, Fusion, Swap, Party, and Big Bang)
[/list]

The multiplayer in this game is fun! You have the choice of playing in a game mode room for Free Play or going head to head in Puzzle League, which is the competitive mode of this game.

But due to the age of this game there is some downsides for this online mode. Here in the west there is not as many active players online. The ones who are active are high skilled Tetris/Puyo players, or new players just picking up the game. The matchmaking is horrible due to the lack of players. Most of them are in Asian countries which I've noticed to cause a bit of lag while playing in some games, sometimes to a point where the game is unplayable due to the delay between pieces. Luckily you can filter out players with a poor connection. Learning as much your preferred game mode and building skill is the best way to ranking up and winning.

So maybe you want to just play offline with AI to learn, but hey how do I change their difficulty?

The difficulty of the AI is actually linked to the character chosen! Here's a quote explaining a bit how they work!
[quote=Mimosa] For Puyo, Schezo, Ecolo, Dark Prince and Ex are amongst the best players. Turning on core AI (by pressing the L1 left bumper) makes them even more powerful, and can do up to 12 chains occasionally.

For Tetris, the AI is comparatively mediocre, since the AI doesn't know how to do T-spins, but they are very good at Tetrises, downstacking, garbage management, and perfect clears, and also combos, so they can still provide a decent challenge, especially if you turn on core AI.

The most powerful AI Tetris players are Feli, Dark Prince, Ex, and Ecolo, although Rurue can give quite a decent whopping at times, just not as powerful as the first 4.

I think, if I had to rate the AI opponents, Dark Prince's Tetris, with core AI enabled is around a 7000-rated human's skill. So ya, they will provide you with enough practice until you are ready to face skilled human opponents. Core AI for Ecolo Puyo is about a 10000-13000 rated human player's skill, maybe more [/quote]

While playing I have found there to be more Tetris players and less Puyo players. (If you're someone more interested in ONLY PLAYING Puyo Puyo I reccommend Puyo Puyo Esports which only costs $10 but is known to go on sale for only $5! Just note matchmaking takes waaaay longer.)

Also the lessons in this game suck, like holy crap, especially since most people in the west don't know what the hell Puyo Puyo is. If you want to learn to play Puyo Sega released official how to play videos on their YouTube made by really good Puyo Players.

TD;LR This game is cute, online can be difficult, watch YouTube to learn Puyo, and have the ultimate waifu war.

edit: fixed some spelling errors because i have a writing level of a middle schooler.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004492155', 'num_games_owned': 160, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 919, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 436, 'last_played': 1580039919}
review:
I will start by saying, I DID NOT pay full price for this nor would I recommend anyone pay that cost.

I have 2 sides to my recommendation.  
Side one...
Hell yeah!  Awesome fun, totally amusing.  Really good story mode, not to easy not too hard that you wanna smash your face against the computer until your teeth push into your brain killing you on impact.
Tons of different VS modes against computers, so you wont really run out of things to do.  Its like throwing on the retro Dr Mario or Tetris and playing.  Its good to have around for those days.

Side Two...
NO!  The online play is something that just drives me nuts.  Not saying I have not attempted and will not continue but their matching system is just a bag of d**ks.  
You will not play against someone at the same capacity or skill level as yourself and work your way up to those higher ranks through grueling hours of torturous fun...
You will play against people who seem to be able to teleport those Tetris blocks into spaces so fast you cannot even see the movement.  However, their skill level at Puyo is less than amusing.  That wont matter. The Tetris portion of it will drive you batty.
If you are lucky enough to play against someone with less of a skill level than you than chances are you are playing on a LAN system, with friends, or you are one of those block teleporters from a distant land.

All in all.
Sale price purchase.  I would recommend it, but for online play or full price... I wouldn't bother personally.  
Only reason I am saying no is because sale prices dont come often and its more likely going to be a full price purchase.

author: {'steamid': '76561198862447192', 'num_games_owned': 2493, 'num_reviews': 285, 'playtime_forever': 3849, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 449, 'last_played': 1592081699}
review:
This is a great game , especially for fans of puyo puyo. For those not familiar with Puyo Puyo..it's basically what you grew up with as dr. robotnic's mean bean machine/kirby's avalanche.

There is a story mode, arcade mode, local and competitive play. Competitive play is fairly active , which is surprising since this is actually an older puyo puyo game than the one released a few months back.

The only issue I actually have with this game is that puyo puyo has an unfair disadvantage in competitive play against tetris. With the the tetrinomos you can press up to immediately have them drop to the bottom where the shadow is. Puyos unfortunately have no such control. When playing against a high level tetris opponent,  this can be a bit harsh.

review:
Aside from my bad opinion about the controls being not customizable in controllers, the game itself is good. But if you will ask me about the online play, sorry no. Because I can't even play online because they're kicking me. I can't even experience the online play. Maybe the community here sucks. They don't accept newcomers here.

Edit: I'm starting to regret that I bought this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198180527198', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 9603, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9603, 'last_played': 1571885986}
review:
As an avid tetris fan I was excited to purchase this game, I've never played Puyo-Puyo but I thought it looked fun. The two game styles sort of mix but they don't really compliment each other in a way that I was hoping. The competitive aspect of the game leaves a lot to be desired, most glaringly the stark advantage Tetris players will have over Puyo players. And I realize the game is for little kids but the story was so boring that it became a chore to even skip the dumb little cutscenes. 

I like playing Puyo and Tetris but honestly I could've saved myself the $30 and just played the browser version like I do at school.

author: {'steamid': '76561198392574310', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 29563, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26420, 'last_played': 1648267637}
review:
Its fun if you get past the trash matchmaking and really try to improve. It sucks in the beginning so its better to start off with a friend you don't mind losing against. Once you get into the 15k rating range it really starts to get fun, and almost nobody quits past that point.
Good luck have fun! I can't imagine myself not playing this game anymore, its insanely fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198312338619', 'num_games_owned': 1389, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 5285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 274, 'last_played': 1675006885}
review:
Would I recommend it?

Yes. But...
This game is more focused on Puyo puyo than on Tetris. There is endless puyo puyo, but not endless tetris. The puyo puyo challenges are more difficult than the tetris ones. For me, who bought it for tetris, because it's the only game that offers t-spins etc. on PC, it's way overpriced for the original price.

EDIT: Well, there is actually endless tetris. It's just cleverly hidden. You need to go to Solo arcade->Challenges->Marathon and there is an option called Lines, which offers two options - 150 and endless. It's not 100% endless, because unlike Endless Puyo puyo, the Endless tetris's kill screen is an actual kill screen, but that was exactly what I was searching for.

review: This is a great mashup of the two greatest realtime puzzle games. I love how I can play Tetris adepts using my superior Puyo skills, and am not forced to suffer the indignity of being bad at Tetris multiplayer.

author: {'steamid': '76561198036010778', 'num_games_owned': 899, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 3950, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3415, 'last_played': 1587248682}
review:
To me, this is the best official version of Tetris I have played, I don't play PuyoPuyo so can't really comment on that side of the game. The story is silly, yet charming, but I mainly play multiplayer versus friends.

I tried to play the competitive matchmaking too, but it seems that only the really hardcore players queue for it - so it's very painful for the average level player. I wouldn't say I am bad at the game by any stretch of the imagination, but I've yet to get the hang of Perfect Clears and T-Spins, unlike the majority of people who play on Puzzle League.

I guess it's great if you're an advanced player and want a challenge, but comp was not for me.

review:
I would otherwise give this game a positive review. However, there are serious problems that must be addressed.

The game lags as hell and doesn't handle packet loss and latency very well. The controls are decent when playing versus bots, but abysmal when playing online as input delay can definitely be noticed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000752379', 'num_games_owned': 316, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 4380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3035, 'last_played': 1641043445}
review:
El juego que introdujo a medio planeta a Puyo Puyo gracias a tener Tetris en el nombre.

PPT actÃºa como buena introducciÃ³n tanto a Puyo como a Tetris moderno, tanto si conoces alguno de los dos como si no conoces ninguno de antes. Sobra decir que los personajes y la mÃºsica son geniales, asÃ­ como las voces tanto inglesas como japonesas. El modo historia es sorprendentemente bueno, ya que aunque no sea un argumento sÃºper profundo, las interacciones entre los personajes son todas 10/10 (si has jugado modos historia en otros juegos de Puyo sabrÃ¡s a quÃ© me refiero).

Mi mayor queja sobre PPT (y sobre Puyo en Steam en general) es que el matchmaking en online es una completa locura, ya que es imposible jugar con gente de tu mismo nivel. A diferencia de en consolas, en Steam el juego ignora por completo el nivel del jugador a la hora de decidir con quiÃ©n enfrentarte, por lo que fÃ¡cilmente te podrÃ¡n poner contra el mejor jugador del mundo incluso si acabas de empezar a jugar. AdemÃ¡s, y como es natural, online estÃ¡ plagado de jugadores que Ãºnicamente juegan Tetris, por lo que si juegas principalmente a Puyo, lo vas a pasar mal (Tetris estÃ¡ en una muy fuerte ventaja con respecto a Puyo, aunque inicialmente parezca lo contrario; abajo lo explico si realmente te interesa), aparte que en escasas ocasiones encontrarÃ¡s jugadores de Puyo. Para rematar, el sistema de partidas online tiene severos problemas de rendimiento, de forma que si el otro jugador tiene un PC mediocre, el bajo rendimiento de su ordenador se traslada al tuyo en un intento de sincronizar a ambos jugadores.

TLDR: Para el single player y para jugar con colegas, PPT en Steam es perfecto. Si quieres jugar online en general, mejor en consola. En cualquier caso, PPT merece totalmente la pena.

PD: Siento la necesidad imperiosa de quedar como un nerd y explicar por quÃ© Puyo estÃ¡ en fuerte desventaja en este juego:
- Tetris tiene hard drop (caÃ­da instantÃ¡nea de las piezas), Puyo no (por defecto)
- En Puyo, si tu pieza se parte en dos, tienes que esperar a que acabe la animaciÃ³n para ejecutar el siguiente movimiento (mientras Tetris sigue jugando)
- En Puyo, la recepciÃ³n de basura tiene una animaciÃ³n que tienes que, de nuevo, esperar a que acabe de reproducirse para poder seguir jugando (de nuevo, Tetris sigue jugando). Este tiempo le permite a Tetris hacer combos en los que Puyo tan sÃ³lo puede poner una pieza entre que le caen lÃ­neas y lÃ­neas de basura
- Center 4 Wide estÃ¡ completa y absolutamente roto y bien ejecutado es prÃ¡cticamente imposible de contrarrestar (de hecho estÃ¡ tan roto que hasta algunos jugadores de Tetris en otros juegos de Tetris exclusivo lo miran mal, no es una cuestiÃ³n de Puyo)
- La basura en Puyo cae por encima del tablero, estorbando en tus siguientes movimientos. La basura en Tetris cae por debajo, aumentando tus movimientos especialmente en patrones como Center 4 Wide
- La basura en Puyo ocupa mÃ¡s que en Tetris, ya que el tablero de Puyo es mÃ¡s pequeÃ±o que el de Tetris

El resultado final es que aunque Puyo pueda generar mÃ¡s basura con movimientos cortos, Tetris tiene en general mÃ¡s flexibilidad, capacidad de absorciÃ³n de daÃ±o y escalabilidad de sus ataques a largo plazo. Puyo tiene ventaja en ciertas situaciones (puede generar mÃ¡s daÃ±o de forma explosiva por ejemplo), pero contra jugadores de alto nivel Tetris suele tener la ventaja

author: {'steamid': '76561198061095767', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1575124692}
review:
As a solo/local multiplayer it's a pretty nice game (I mean, it's tetris/puyo), however you can't customize your joystick controls, so you'll be stuck with just a few presets.
As an online game it's quite bad. It frequently crashes upon entering multiplayer matches. However if you get lucky enough on ranked matchmaking you'll probably just end up with some real high level opponents.

Finally got good enough to consistently beat the AI to the point it got boring.

Went online.
Immediately got destroyed by everyone else.

10/10

review: Puyo Puyo Tetris is a decent take on Tetris. However, the matchmaking system is very broken and multiplayer kinda sucks. The story-line is so bad that it's good, but considering that they are trying to make a story game out of freaking *TETRIS* I don't blame them for it being bad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158813063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 16362, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11936, 'last_played': 1647741253}
review: Absolutely worth the cost if you are a fan of Tetris.  It can be a little difficult if you are new to get into the online scene because everyone left is a veteran of the game, but the story mode is still fun and challenging and it is a good starting game for any new tetris or puyo players to learn and hone their skills in the offline modes and then attempting to work their way through online ranked.  Besides the online scene, the game is incredibly well made, very smooth and nice to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071241478', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 6492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5744, 'last_played': 1609932686}
review: Despite I love PPT, either for its art style and how it combines tetris and puyopuyo into pvp battles, I must say this is the worst game for newcomers for either puyopuyo or tetris because of the price and the lack of player base(especially for rookie players). You will constantly face top players even if you are at the lowest rank. Go for Puyo Puyo Champions if you want to learn puyo, and literally any modern tetris game like Tetris99 will do the trick. I only recommend this game if you are moderately skilled at either puyo and tetris and you are really in love with puyo matching tetris (and vice versa).

author: {'steamid': '76561198085749649', 'num_games_owned': 59, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 15922, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6969, 'last_played': 1676164585}
review:
Great game, very fun to play, has Japanese voices available unlike the Switch version.

The game follows the Tetris guidelines very closely (except 1 very hard to reproduce bug), 12 frames DAS and 2 frames ARR (200 ms DAS and around 33ms ARR), if you spin a piece too much (15 times I think?) it goes down by one and locks into place, the SRS is implemented perfectly and the low gravity and lock delay make it easy to build even when you're at the top of the screen.

The matchmaking is very bad, there is a rating system and a rank system but none of these are used, you just get matched up randomly with whoever is online, and since there aren't tons of players, you'll start to get avoided by a lot of them if you're too weak/too strong, it's still easy to find a game in less than 20 seconds most of the time though, but if you're looking for an opponent at your level you might have to wait like 30 minutes.
If someone is afk in the queue, they will block you, usually the best to do is to wait for them to exit it, I guess that resetting a lot might could allow you find another player doing the same as you but it might take a long time.

Now about modern Tetris, I won't explain the rules but some things have to be noted. The first one is that the opener is very important, it's an enormous amount of free lines sent if you do it properly and it sets your board for the next part of the game. If you mess up here you're most likely dead. The worst opener to deal with is clearly the 4-wide opener, you need to get a lot of lines out really fast to stop them from stacking too high and sending an enormous combo to your face. If that happens you're basically dead and there is absolutely no counterplay which is probably why a lot of people hate this opener. Fortunately, not many people actually 4-wide you, I'd say only 1/5th of players or less do that.
Overall Tetris is very competitive and based a lot on speed, precision, knowledge, and pattern recognition, and is the reason why I bought this game. You also tend to improve faster against more skilled players since they force you to play faster in order not to die, though the ones which are the best at openers will definitely kill you within the first 30 seconds no matter what you do (these are not many though). To end this, I'd like to talk about perfect clear openers, these are really strong against lower skilled players and can end the game in less than 10 seconds, not even kidding. Against faster players, they are a nuisance but can be dealt with by downstacking well, but since the holes are not very split, it will often be about doing a lot of tetrises, which means that you'll most likely have to do T-spins at the top of the screen to survive first.

I won't talk much about Puyo since I'm not a Puyo player, all I can say is that the only way to properly beat a Puyo player is a constant damage input with absolutely no stop, otherwise you can welcome a 7-chain or more that will instantly accompany you to the top of the screen

Optimization wise (or netplay I don't know), when you get 4-wided, or at least when the other combos a lot, the game starts dropping a lot of inputs and if you're not very attentive you're definitely gonna misdrop and die. It really is a pain in the ass and I'm sure it could have been fixed a long time ago if the devs actually cared about the PC version since this doesn't happen on Switch.

I'd recommand buying this game if you want to have some fun playing Tetris, doing the campaign and especially if you like the characters, voice lines, graphic design, I also heavily recommand this game if you like both Puyo Puyo and Tetris.

Tetorisu Ikimasu

author: {'steamid': '76561198027987749', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 708, 'last_played': 1610572299}
review:
Me and my family offten kill some time with puyo puyo tetris,  as far I researched best tetris on market.
Its good family game.  I recommend it.

Only 2 issues I got with this game: 
1. Im old school gameboy tetris guy. so  my brain didnt evolved for those new age tetris rules. Im brain dead for t-block combos throu gaps,  (I watched tutorials, I still cannot put any t-block throu other bricks and those mutiplayers kids do it like champs, their entire tactic is evolved around this while my brain is dead for this), this wasnt possible in classic tetris. 
Maybe make multiplayer mode with classic tetris rules without this t-brick combos?  

2. Multiplayer (only hardcore guys play it), not funny when you are rank 90k on ladderboard and you get pited vs guy who is 500th    (loses vs those guys makes you feel bad, because you getting outclassed to oblivion)   Imagine piting Manchester united vs. local redneck village club , thats exactly how multiplayer feels.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970711212', 'num_games_owned': 1569, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1567027475}
review:
Your enjoyment from this game will depend largely on your love of BOTH Tetris and Puyo Puyo.

For those looking to purchase this game because you love one, but are not fussed about the other, will likely grow frustrated with the main campaign mode, as you are often switching between the two, and never really feel like you are playing a settled game and getting in to a rhythm.

The story of the main campaign is a load of guff (what did you expect?) but a game like this is much better when it comes to Multiplayer.

There are a few modes to choose between, and all of them can be fun, but the amount of fun you can get out of the game will also depend on your level of skill. There are some very good players out there, and being paired with someone who is clearly much better than you will have you punching your monitor in no time.

Best for: Fans of BOTH games

review:
Un jeu dynamique, au gameplay trÃ¨s riche, encore faut t-il s'intÃ©resser un minimum au puzzle games (et s'y investir)! 
La fusion de Tetris et de Puyo est un vrai rÃ©gal, surtout en versus ! Cette version est archi complÃ¨te, propose Ã©normÃ©ment de modes un peu plus casual oÃ¹ tout le monde peut s'y amuser !
Cependant, le online semble dÃ©sert, et c'est trÃ¨s frustrant de se retrouver constamment face Ã  des monstres faute de nouveaux joueurs, il n'y a aucune prise en compte du ranking...

author: {'steamid': '76561198105539140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 1340, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 558, 'last_played': 1577601867}
review:
HARD AS HELL!!!!!!!!!

BE WARNED! This may look kid friendly, but any child, and I do mean ANY child WILL be throwing a temper-tantrum because of how difficult this game can get. I am warning you now, this game is BRUTAL! Specifically, the adventure mode has a LOT of unfair CPU difficulty spikes, specifically, Ecolo, the boss I am STILL, after TWO HOURS am STILL trying to beat. The game's mechanics are fun. The character art is cute and adorable, and I LOVE the music. The game performs well on ANY system. Hell, a POTATO could run this game, making it extremely accessible if you're limited by the tech you're using. HOWEVER, be sure you are ready to deal with a late-game difficulty spike. It's sudden, unfair and WILL relentlessly kick your ass like no tomorrow and without mercy. There are no difficulty settings because this game is trying to train you for the online mode, which is fine, but all I want to do is unlock the other characters. 

Oh yeah... There's plenty of unlockables here. Characters, stages, credits, etc. There's also NO MICROTRANSACTIONS, at least as far as I am aware. But just being microtransaction-free is a MAJOR plus in my book. 

Overall, it's cute, brutal, but still pretty fun, despite the somewhat unfair difficulty spikes.

7/10

review: Long time Tetris fan, having played classic Tetris, Tetris Friends, Tetris Party on the Wii, Tetris 99 for Switch, and a bit of classic Puyo, so seeing both games combined and put to a story was interesting! I do wish that they would have put in an endless marathon for 1v1 Tetris and let it go beyond just 2/3 points before you get a game over, but thats about my only complaint. Otherwise its absolutely amazing and I highly recommend it for PC Tetris players! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198106939391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 9232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4122, 'last_played': 1616348417}
review:
What a lovely combination of two great puzzle series. This game is a must for all who love tetris/puyo/puzzle games. But if you like playing online, this ain't for you. Let's explore the ups and downs of the game (+, +/-, -):

+Tetris and Puyo = simple and awesome gameplay.
+It's very addictive, in a positive way.
+The characters are colorful, strange, funny and well designed. That's not much in this game, but it's still a positive.
+The colors are damn great. The game looks lovely.
+Various game modes provide something for everyone. It's also easy to customize matches.
+There is a story mode! It's fun, but strange...
+/-...and not always in a good way. So much randomness and geekiness.
+/-Sometimes, the game almost crashes, but doesn't. You'll definitely notice the slowdown thou.
-Online modes suck. To me, this is nothing; I don't play online because I don't like it. And even if I did, I would be paired with people "1000 levels" above me. That happens to everyone, I am not that special. Also, the game crashes in the mode from time to time. In short, online mode is a small hell in a golden game.

Puyo Puyoâ„¢TetrisÂ® is the best Puyo or Tetris game available on Steam. It's a great game you don't want to stop playing. Buy this game and enjoy our addiction... but don't go online. 10/10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005097380', 'num_games_owned': 188, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1172, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1166, 'last_played': 1572029549}
review:
I've liked the Puyo Puyo franchise for a long time.
My first exposure to the franchise was back in the Sega Mega Drive II days. I was a kid, I had just started grade school, and on my 6th birthday I received the Sega Mega Drive II as a present from my parents. It was a bundle of console and a game: it came with the cartridge of Sonic Collection, which included Sonic, Sonic 2, and Dr. Robotnik's Mean Bean Machine.
Now, I had already played Sonic a couple times on my uncle's console at that time, so I knew the game (and I liked it), and the fact that it had a sequel wasn't surprising to me (bear in mind, I was a kid in the 90s with no access to Internet or videogames information: I didn't know there was a sequel, it just wasn't surprising) but I knew nothing about the third game of the set, and reading "Machine" in the title I thought it would be a racing game.
Well, cue my surprise when it turned out to be a puzzle game. Most surprisingly, though, was the fact that it ended up being my biggest time sink on the SMD2.
I didn't have much experience with puzzle games up to that point, just some Tetris on friends' Game Boys (I wouldn't have a Game Boy of my own until a few years later, when PokÃ©mon came out, and even then still no Tetris on Game Boy for me), but it truly got me hooked. There was something addicting about the gameplay for me, even as a kid, and I actually really liked the bgm a lot, so sometimes I would just play to hear the music while playing.
Fastforward to the Game Cube era, Puyo Pop Fever came out to the West, and I managed to eventually buy a copy a few years later; it wasn't an easy game to find around here, so it had to wait for when I finally had Internet and a prepaid credit card. I loved the fever mode, and spent hours in the endless fever.
I liked the game so much I ended up double dipping and I bought in on the Nintendo DS as well, so I could play it on the go when I felt like it.
Some time later, a sequel came out... only in Japan. And then other Puyo games came out, but they never made it over here.
I eventually ended up importing a Japanese 2DS to play Chronicles (got the limited edition with the OST included on day 1), though it wasn't quite to my taste (the puzzling itself was too simplistic in the story mode).
Then, news of Puyo Puyo Tetris came out, and it also was slated for a western release. Needless to say, I was delighted.
I bought the Switch version at launch, and when it was released on Steam I ended up double dipping.
If you've been reading up to now, you'll realise I've been digging this franchise for a good while, so you might want to take my review with a grain of salt, but I believe this is a strong entry in the series. It has to offer the best in Puyo and it comes with Tetris, and the Swap and Fusion modes are a nice twist, though I still find Fusion to be quite confusing; Swap's a blast, on the other hand.
If you're into puzzle games, this one's definitely a top pick. It has something for everyone, from the Puyo enthusiast that's been playing for years, down to the casual gamer that has only played Tetris every now and then.
The Story mode lets you get familiar with the various game modes at a good pace, with an increasing challenge, and the Arcade mode lets you simply play what you feel like playing, ranging from the good ol' infinite puyo, down to Big Bang mode, which is a blast (and Tetris Big Bang is even more addicting and fast paced than Puyo's Fever mode).
The biggest downside is that the online multiplayer is generally empty nowadays, but back in my days online wasn't an option to begin with.
Overall, yes, I wholeheartedly recommend this game; whether I'm too biased or not is up to the reader to decide.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040483651', 'num_games_owned': 347, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 303, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 201, 'last_played': 1567582426}
review:
This game has a lot of annoyances and quirks, especially for having such a large online competitive scene. It feels like they built this game for a very casual audience, and once the entire game was built, they decided it was simple enough to add Puzzle League too. Still, it's one of the most popular places to play ranked tetris games competitively online on PC (even if better un-official games exist) so the community is absolutely the biggest reason I bought this game.

This part is just ranting about details, feel free to skip all this and just read the last bit. The game is locked at 60fps, which is a little ridiculous for a modern competitive game released in 2018, in the age of consumer 240hz monitors. If they didn't want reviews to say that, then they shouldn't be advertising Puzzle League on the store page. And it also sets your monitor to 60hz too! If you have a high-refresh rate screen, you have to alt+tab out and back in to force your monitor into its native refresh rate. But then when you do that, the game seems to set itself into windowed-borderless-fullscreen mode even if you set it to regular fullscreen in the settings, so now my adaptive refresh rate isn't kicking in anymore. So that causes much more inconsistent frame times to the eye, and slightly higher latency. There are a ton more small details like this that all add together and drive me a bit crazy.   
On a high-resolution display, the game still appears to be rendering almost everything (even text) in 1080p? the edges are fuzzy and have visible aliasing artifacts everywhere. For a completely 2D game!   
When you change some of the settings, and try to move to a different settings tab, it gives you a prompt saying "your changes haven't been saved...." with a yes/no button. In every other program I've ever used, "yes" will save and "no" will discard. Well this game is the opposite for some reason, it's actually asking if you want to discard your changes. Also why do I have to save my keyboard controls before I'm allowed to even look at my gamepad controls?  
When you first start up the game, multiplayer mode is locked at first. But it doesn't tell you what you need to do to to unlock it?! Why do I have to pull up google for something like that.  
The constant voice clips when you clear a line get pretty irritating pretty quickly in my opinion. But I can just mute the game. But basically all the youtube clips of this game are extremely annoying to listen to, too!  
There are little animations that play when you clear a line. they block your name tag and mostly block your score. So the fastest players (where you're most likely to want to see their name or their score) have their details hidden about 85% of the time or more.  
There are a lot more things like this that I've noticed, but it's hard to remember them all for a review. Just know that this game made no attempt to be perfect....

To be clear this game isn't garbage or anything. If you're younger, just getting into Tetris/Puyo Puyo, and enjoy comics, then this game's adventure mode will probably be well suited for you. But if you're buying it to compete online, don't expect this game to be as well-polished for competitive play as other games are. But whatever, I can live with it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198189205806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 10412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1572, 'last_played': 1606060200}
review:
It's a shame American gamers played little of Puyo Puyo. Other than Dr. Robotniks Mean Bean Machine, Kirby's Avalanche and Puyo Pop Fever. This feels like a slow introduction to a lesser known franchise to newcomers, by putting in Tetris along with Puyo Puyo, I think I worded it awkwardly. Since it has Tetris on the title and it is one of the few officially released PC Tetris releases I love playing Tetris and going nuts stacking them, the interest in Puyo Puyo grew.

The story mode doesn't take itself seriously and that is a good thing. Despite the darker series Puyo Puyo spun-off from, the jokes had me chuckle a bit and I didn't feel at all frustrated one bit. Oh and cuteness, everybody loves cute stuff.

Anyways, I haven't played online because I am still learning how to get better with chains and T-Spins.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084283780', 'num_games_owned': 73, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 45820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32545, 'last_played': 1709501403}
review:
Depois de mais de um ano do lanÃ§amento de Puyo Puyo Tetris, decidi finalmente escrever uma avaliaÃ§Ã£o. Embora possa ser tarde, talvez interesse a alguns jogadores falantes de portuguÃªs que, por acaso, se deparem com isso.

[b]Puyo Puyo Tetris (para PC) Ã© um jogo recomendado? Sim! Vamos aos porquÃªs, separados em tÃ³picos:[/b]

[h1]Familiariedade[/h1]
ApÃ³s anos sem jogos novos para o ocidente, a SEGA decidiu investir novamente na internacionalizaÃ§Ã£o da sÃ©rie, dessa vez usando inteligentemente um tÃ­tulo muito mais conhecido por aqui: Tetris. O resultado, como se pode imaginar, Ã© um jogo que atraiu muitos fÃ£s deste, e tambÃ©m os introduziu a Puyo Puyo. Pude conhecer algumas pessoas que demonstraram bastante interesse em melhorar suas habilidades em Puyo. Essa uniÃ£o de comunidades, de muitas formas, Ã© positiva, pois aumenta a divulgaÃ§Ã£o de ambos os jogos, expande o leque de possibilidades de partidas, incentiva streams e campeonatos que, de outra maneira, nÃ£o existiriam.

[h1]Modo HistÃ³ria[/h1]
Muito embora histÃ³ria nunca tenha sido um dos pontos [i]fortes[/i] de ambas as sÃ©ries (hÃ¡ nada de muito Ã©pico), Puyo Puyo Tetris faz um trabalho excelente a esse respeito. NÃ£o apenas somos introduzidos a uma trama pitoresca, como tambÃ©m podemos observar o esforÃ§o da equipe de traduÃ§Ã£o e de atuaÃ§Ã£o em adaptar tudo da forma mais fiel e intrigante possÃ­vel para o inglÃªs. Talvez o ponto mais forte da histÃ³ria seja o fato de ela mesma nÃ£o se dar a seriedade que alguns poderiam esperar. No fim das contas, estamos falando de jogos onde seus objetivos sÃ£o estourar gelatinas e apagar linhas de blocos... Talvez seja possÃ­vel fazer algo sÃ©rio com isso, mas qual Ã© a vantagem imediata?
O roteiro Ã© bastante simples, mas nÃ£o tarda em fazer uma viagem total na maionese. Como de costume, as protagonistas da sÃ©rie Puyo Puyo acabam se encontrando pela enÃ©sima vez, pois, por algum motivo inicialmente misterioso, seus universos colidiram novamente. AlÃ©m disso, somos introduzidos a personagens completamente novos, os tripulantes da Starship Tetra, uma espaÃ§onave que tambÃ©m se depara com acontecimentos bizarros. Juntos, os novos amigos vÃ£o ao infinito e alÃ©m, passando por inÃºmeros personagens (alguns dos quais sÃ³ fazem breves apariÃ§Ãµes, pelo [i]fan service[/i]) e chegando cada vez mais ao clÃ­max do conflito.
Admitidamente, a trama tem seus defeitos. Apesar de nÃ£o se levar muito a sÃ©rio, a histÃ³ria tem seus momentos mais emotivos, mas muitas vezes eles acabam caÃ­ndo por terra porque alguns personagens simplesmente nÃ£o foram desenvolvidos ou tratados com seriedade o suficiente, o que pode tirar um pouco da sensaÃ§Ã£o de dever cumprido ao completÃ¡-la.
Vale fazer menÃ§Ã£o especial aos trÃªs capÃ­tulos adicionais, que nÃ£o tÃªm relevÃ¢ncia para a histÃ³ria principal. SÃ£o historinhas breves focadas em certos personagens. A histÃ³ria de Schezo Ã© absolutamente hilÃ¡ria e imperdÃ­vel, brincando muito bem com o personagem e desenvolvendo-o perfeitamente.

[h1]Modos de Jogo[/h1]
Ã‰ Ã³bvio que os modos de jogo tÃªm que ser a parte mais caprichada do jogo, e a entrega aqui Ã© bastante satisfatÃ³ria.
[b]Versus â€“[/b] Ã‰ o modo mais simples de jogo. Pode-se jogar uma partida de Puyo contra Tetris, Puyo contra Puyo ou Tetris contra Tetris. Divertido, e tambÃ©m Ã© o modo mais movimentado no online.
[b]Swap â€“[/b] Queridinho dos torneios, principalmente os estadunidenses. Nesse modo, Ã© inicialmente sorteado se os jogadores tÃªm que jogar Puyo ou Tetris. Depois de algum tempo, o jogo muda. O foco aqui Ã© tentar fazer cadeias longas em Puyo e depois complementar com combos em Tetris (o que aumenta o poder do seu ataque), ou o contrÃ¡rio. TambÃ©m Ã© um incentivo muito legal para que os jogadores busquem melhorar suas habilidades tanto em Puyo quanto em Tetris.
[b]Party â€“[/b] Um modo mais casual, que funciona de maneira parecida com o Versus. A grande diferenÃ§a reside no fato que estourar certos grupos de puyos ou limpar certa linha em Tetris dÃ¡ bÃ´nus aos jogadores (pode-se ficar invulnerÃ¡vel por algum tempo, ter o poder do seu ataque aumentado ou deixar as peÃ§as do seu oponente esquisitas, por exemplo). De todos os modos, Ã© o que menos ouÃ§o falar a respeito, o que Ã© uma pena, pois me parece muito divertido.
[b]Fusion â€“[/b] O modo mais confuso do jogo, pois os jogadores tÃªm que jogar Puyo e Tetris ao mesmo tempo. Ou seja, puyos e tetrominos ocupam o mesmo ecrÃ£! Ã‰ bastante infame, o que de certa forma entendo. TambÃ©m parece ter mais lag que o normal, mesmo em partidas de um contra um.
[b]Big Bang â€“[/b] O Ãºltimo dos modos. Os jogadores sÃ£o apresentados a telas prÃ©-montadas, cheias de puyos e tetrominos, e precisam fazer as cadeias e combos o mais depressa possÃ­vel. ApÃ³s determinado intervalo, o jogador que tiver tido o melhor desempenho envia um pouco de dano ao adversÃ¡rio, que acaba reduzindo uma parcela de sua barra de vida. Tem uma apresentaÃ§Ã£o visual muito interessante e seus efeitos sÃ£o bastante divertidos. Para quem procura competiÃ§Ã£o, no entanto, esse modo Ã© de longe o mais fraco, e enjoa rapidamente.
Ou seja, modos de jogo nÃ£o faltam. Foi feito um excelente trabalho referente a isso.

[h1]ApresentaÃ§Ã£o[/h1]
AlÃ©m dos vÃ¡rios modos de jogo, temos ainda diversos cenÃ¡rios diferentes enfeitando as partidas, e a trilha sonora nÃ£o deixa a desejar. Ainda assim, o jogo comeÃ§a com sÃ³ uma parcela desse detalhamento: para deixar tudo mais bonito e variado, Ã© necessÃ¡rio desbloquear os conteÃºdos adicionais completando capÃ­tulos do modo histÃ³ria. Ã‰ uma tentativa positiva e atraente de fazer com que os jogadores adentrem o universo do jogo um pouco mais.
O jogo conta com 24 personagens jogÃ¡veis, 8 dos quais desbloqueÃ¡veis tambÃ©m pelo modo histÃ³ria. Cada personagem tem suas prÃ³prias falas e representaÃ§Ãµes visuais, o que renova ainda mais a experiÃªncia de jogatina.

[h1]Desafios[/h1]
Existem, no jogo, alguns desafios que podem ser completados tanto para Puyo como para Tetris. Embora nÃ£o tenham o mesmo foco competitivo que os outros modos, eles dÃ£o um retoque Ãºnico Ã  jogatina. As conquistas Steam partem de um grau fÃ¡cil a moderado de dificuldade, e tambÃ©m incentivam a busca por aprimoramento e completude.

[h1]Batalhas contra a CPU[/h1]
Essa Ã© a parte da qual realmente nÃ£o posso falar muito, jÃ¡ que nunca entrei a fundo na questÃ£o, mas o jogo conta com CPUs de nÃ­veis variados e com estratÃ©gias diferentes. Para jogadores de nÃ­vel alto, nÃ£o existe muita graÃ§a em batalhar contra a inteligÃªncia artificial, mas para quem deseja treinar e se acostumar com os modos de jogo, as CPUs sÃ£o muito bem-vindas. AlÃ©m disso, existe um modo Endurance, onde devemos enfrentar os personagens do jogo atÃ© perdermos uma partida, o que pode ser divertido para passar o tempo.

[h1]Puzzle League e Free Play[/h1]
Por Ãºltimo, mas nÃ£o menos importante, nÃ£o podemos deixar de falar dos modos online principais. Na Puzzle League, jogadores de todo o mundo competem em todos os modos de jogo (embora exista uma opÃ§Ã£o para desabilitar certos modos) em busca de rating (pontuaÃ§Ã£o), rank (tÃ­tulo) e league (nÃ­vel). No Free Play, Ã© possÃ­vel organizar salas de atÃ© quatro pessoas e convidar amigos para jogar.

[h1]Nada Ã© perfeito...[/h1]
Embora bem trabalhado, o jogo ainda tem pecados incÃ´modos (embora, com o tempo, seja possÃ­vel ignorar alguns deles). Problemas notÃ¡veis incluem:
â€“ Erros no sistema de partidas da Puzzle League, com jogadores fantasmas aparecendo;
â€“ Falta de um sistema que tire jogadores inativos do sistema de partidas da Puzzle League;
â€“ Existem formas de se desconectar de uma partida na Puzzle League, dando pontos indevidos a ambos os jogadores;
â€“ Trapaceiros dominam o topo do ranking da Puzzle League, e nÃ£o hÃ¡ nada a se fazer a respeito, aparentemente;
â€“ Oponentes recentes nÃ£o aparecem na lista da Steam, o que pode complicar o contato.

E Ã© basicamente isso. Os erros negativam pouco a qualidade do jogo. Por todos os pontos positivos apresentado, minha resposta nÃ£o poderia ser senÃ£o sim, vale a pena comprar Puyo Puyo Tetris.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102063164', 'num_games_owned': 556, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 1720, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 253, 'last_played': 1655051983}
review:
I am torn. I've wanted Puyo Puyo Tetris for an insanely long time, mainly because I just wanted a way to play Tetris on Steam and this was the only game on Steam that's available to fulfill that need. That's the main reason I've wanted this. Puyo Puyo be damned. But with this...you're getting two games in one. I guess that's the whole point with what the game's called.

But why am I torn? I wanna mention a few things. The production values for something like this are fantastic. I can easily see now why the game costs as much as it does. There is a full blown adventure mode serving to present a little story mode with a whole cast of characters. I'm not all too familiar with them though, seeing as this is my first entry in the Puyo Puyo franchise(?), but the story is lighthearted and doesn't seek to accomplish much aside from having a reason to combine Puyo Puyo and Tetris into one game. I love the art style and the voice acting. The campaign itself for me ranges from "wow this is really easy" to "oh god I have no idea what I'm doing please help". But that's not a bad thing - people familiar with one game have a good platform to learn and understand a new game in a very casual environment, as the AI often enough isn't too hard on you and treats you as a newbie for a good majority of it. Some may see it as needless handholding, I see it as not overwhelming people who might not be familiar with one or the other (or both).

I also enjoy the fun & quirky game modes, Big Bang was an absolute blast to play and going on a massive win streak there against the AI is super satisfying. And the accessibility for new players is great, Puyo Puyo or Tetris - the game does a great job at introducing players to the core mechanics of each. My only gripe with this though is how there are no maps or tutorials to specifically practice certain techniques. For example, I want to learn how to T-Spin but I find it really difficult to manage setting up T-Spin combos and just end up making a bigger problem than necessary. Some practice maps where everything is already set-up for T-Spinning would've been amazing and would've definitely helped ease myself into the mechanics of the game, specifically timing. The closest the game gets to that is a few challenges during Big Bang if you choose Tetris, but you're never given enough time to complete them before it begins tallying up the results and decides the victor of that wave.

Now here's the thing I don't particularly enjoy - the online mode. I've heard of the numerous connection problems people point out but I always thought to myself that it can't be that bad, but sure enough - t's bad. There were multiple occasions when I was playing against someone and the game just freezes with a connection error. A win is added to my profile and I gain a bunch of ranks. It doesn't feel like I've won anything. That, coupled with the fact matchmaking does NOT take into account people's skill levels means you are going to have a VERY miserable time playing online-versus mode. Seriously, as a very low-skill, low-tier Tetris player, I can't last even 10 seconds with some of these people, leading me to get frustrated and leave. Online is not at all newbie friendly, as every person in the online mode will do anything and everything to win. I tried telling them to "go easy on me" but people always ignore those greetings messages. I tried seeing if there were any newbie free-play lobbies for me to have a more comfortable online experience, but it seems like the only thing anyone ever plays is the matchmaking, so online is a complete no-go if you are at all a low-level Tetris player. Don't even bother if you don't know the ins and outs of either Puyo Puyo or Tetris, you will quite literally get absolutely demolished.

Do I recommend this? If you're only interested in an online Tetris or Puyo Puyo, no. Jstris is a better & free alternative in your browser, so play that if you want Tetris with multiplayer (or go play Tetris 99 on the Switch). As for Puyo Puyo multiplayer, I can't give you any pointers seeing as this is my first Puyo Puyo, Mean Bean Machine not withstanding. If you want a Tetris game on Steam - sure. If you want a Puyo Puyo & Tetris combo game with a story mode that incorporates both while introducing unique twists - yes.

I don't regret my purchase but I only see this game as a single player only game unfortunately. I wish the online community was a little more easy-going towards newer players.

Basically good local play, online play is terrible due to no matchmaking logic.

review:
J'ai voulu dÃ©couvrir PuyoPuyo, un versus unique qui sort de l'ordinaire. Super ! Let's go !
Mais j'ai vite dÃ©chantÃ© face Ã  la pire mÃ©canique du jeu (et surement la pire mÃ©canique du monde): Les DÃ©chets.

[u]Description:[/u]
Des puyos gris (dÃ©chets) apparaissent sur le tableau adverse de faÃ§on alÃ©atoire une fois que vous exÃ©cutez un combo d'au moins 2 hits.

[u]ProblÃ¨me:[/u]
Plus le combo de votre adversaire est gros, plus vous recevez de puyo gris, donc plus Ã§a recouvre votre combo en prÃ©paration (qui devient donc bloquÃ©/inutile), donc moins vous avez de place pour un nouveau combo, donc votre adversaire peut tranquillement vous abattre au sol avec des petits combos de chiasses. LE FUN !

[u]Solution[/u] (la seule et unique):
Faire un gros combo avant votre adversaire ... et c'est tout.

C'est simple, impossible de s'amuser ET de tryhard, c'est soit l'un soit l'autre.
Quand tu dÃ©bute, y'a zÃ©ro mindgame, zÃ©ro mÃ©canique de comeback, zÃ©ro chance de rattraper une erreur, zÃ©ro risque, zÃ©ro envie d'apprendre. Bref, Ã§a s'adresse aux autistes ou aux suceurs de japs (ps: je ne m'exclue pas de ces derniers).

PrÃ©cision, je n'ai heureusement pas jouer contre des gens en ligne, seulement contre un ami qui a 50h.

review: I'm going to support this game, but it's a rather painful support because the online matchmaking in this game is beyond jacked. 99% of the time I get paired to players with five times my level of skill. The story is great, I love the voice acting as well and the character design is the same as in Puyo Pop Fever, the cutesy look of which I dig but I can see why others wouldn't. Plenty of single player options as well, but ack the online leaves a really bad taste in my mouth.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079738529', 'num_games_owned': 283, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 3518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1863, 'last_played': 1641969366}
review:
I'm not very good at this game but it's a hoot. 

This game is practically what it says on the tin; this game is a crazy mish-mash of both puzzle games. Puyo-Puyo is about getting 4 or more Puyos of the same color to touch each other, and and you use gravity to your advantage to link really cool combos. Tetris is, well, Tetris. Everyone knows what that's like. lol When you combine both, it becomes super intense and fun. But, it's a competitive game where you must go head-to-head with your opponent(s) to see who can come out on top after sending loads of garbage blocks/Puyos their way from combos. You can choose either to play Tetris or Puyo Puyo, depending on your preferences.

It comes with a couple of different modes too, like a challenge mode, a fusion mode that combines both Tetris and Puyo into one weird new game mode, and it even has a whole adventure mode. (Of which I've not played too much of, but I think gameplay-wise it's practically the same as multiplayer.)

Trust me, it's very much a good time. If you like the sound of anything I said, then pick this up. You won't regret it. :P

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197960677714', 'num_games_owned': 2155, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 883, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 288, 'last_played': 1597700176}
review:
Puyo Puyo Tetris ist (leider) das einzige Game auf Steam mit dem man Tetris zocken kann.
Es ist zwar relativ teuer meiner Meinung nach aber fÃ¼r Tetrisfans ein absolutes muss.
Am besten zuschlagen wenn es mal im Sale ist.
Ich habe es zwei mal. Einmal auf der Switch und da ich dort schon so begeistert war wollte ich es auch fÃ¼r den PC.
Das spricht schon BÃ¤nde wie sehr mich das Game berÃ¼hrt.
AuÃŸerdem ist es ja ein 2 in 1 wenn man so mÃ¶chte obwohl Puyo Puyo ein Game ist welches in westlichen LÃ¤ndern eher unbekannt ist und stark an Dr.Mario erinnert. Mir persÃ¶nlich gefÃ¤llt Tetris besser aber ein wenig Abwechslung ist natÃ¼rlich fÃ¼r den Preis nicht abzuerkennen.
Alles in allem habt ihr wenn es um das original Tetris geht keine groÃŸartig andere Wahl auf Steam.
Das einzige spielerische Negative finde ich, dass beim Tetris Marathon (quasi die Standard Tetris Version) das Spielfeld das erste Drittel des Bildschirms einnimmt und die Scoreanzeige dann den Rest.
Je nachdem wie groÃŸ der Bildschirm ist oder wie weit man davon weg sitzt kÃ¶nnte ich mir vorstellen, dass es schlecht erkennbar ist. Auf der Switch im portablen Modus ist es schon anstrengend fÃ¼r die Augen gewesen also vermute ich, dass am PC mit gewissen Setups das auch vorkommen kann.
Hier hÃ¤tte man besser wie bei 99 Tetris den Mittleren Bildschirm voll ausnutzen kÃ¶nnen denn beim Zocken interessiert mich das Spielfeld mehr als die Scoreanzeige.
Sonst gibt es aber spielerisch nichts mehr auszusetzen! 
Alles in allem ein wÃ¼rdiger PC Titel der das OldSchool-Game bestens wiedergibt.

review:
[h1] [b] [u] Puyo Puyo Tetris [/u] [/b] [/h1]

Puyo Puyo Tetris es un juego que se agradece de haberse hecho, debido a que combina 2 sagas famosas (Occidente y Oriente)
A pesar que hoy en dÃ­a no lo juega mucha gente como para encontrar a tu nivel en la liga sigue siendo bueno
El juego tiene un modo local bastante amplio por lo que te entretendrÃ¡s bastante

[b] [u] Pros [/u] [/b]
[list]
[*] Modo aventura (recomiendo completarlo antes de ir al Online) (Liga)
[*] 24 personajes a elegir, incluyendo voces alternas
[*] Modo Tutorial para aprender a jugar, no es del todo profundo, pero si lo suficiente
[*] Puedes variar las voces entre el Ingles y el Japones
[*] Varios modos de juego tanto local como Online, incluyendo una Liga
[*] Capacidad para jugar hasta 4 personas tanto local como Online
[/list]
[b] [u] Contras [/u] [/b]
[list]
[*] Jugar de a 3-4 jugadores suele ser muy incomodo si no es Puyo (AÃºn peor en Swap)
[*] Lo que dicen los personajes durante los Combos/Chains no se sobrepone al anterior si este no lo termina de decir, causando asÃ­ Combos o Chains sin voz
[*] El Ranked estÃ¡ roto, puedes encontrar gente de cualquier nivel
[/List]
[h1] [b] ConclusiÃ³n [/b] [/h1]

Si lo que buscas es entrarte al mundo del Tetris o del Puyo o una combinaciÃ³n de ambos 
mediante un Crossover. este juego es para ti

author: {'steamid': '76561197986029918', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 8171, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7718, 'last_played': 1613959100}
review:
A great introduction to players who aren't familiar with the [b][i]Puyo Puyo[/i][/b] series.  The story mode aspect works well with the two puzzle dimensions being merged into one, and the new cast of characters that reign from the [b][i]Tetris[/i][/b] dimension[spoiler]all of which are named after a [i]Tetrimino[/i] piece (-1 character)[/spoiler]fit within [b][i]Puyo Puyo[/i][/b].  I say this loosely, but it's definitely one of the more invested and thought-out plots within the series, all while keeping its charming and comedic values.

Aside from all that, it makes for a great party game with friends and for all ages.  The variety of modes keeps the game feeling fresh and entertaining, and having the option to play [b][i]Puyo Puyo[/i][/b] and/or [b][i]Tetris[/i][/b] is what makes this a must for puzzle enthusiasts.

author: {'steamid': '76561198105504622', 'num_games_owned': 493, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 182, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 174, 'last_played': 1573957252}
review:
Well it's Puyo mode with Tetris mixed in.
Over all this game is okay, I do wish they added more modes to play around with.
Online works fine and doesn't seem to lag regardless where the person is from.
Do note that if you do Puyo vs Tetris, the Tetris player does have the upper hand in terms of attack balancing.

Mostly Tetris players play this game now just as an heads up since there's a new Puyo game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087835461', 'num_games_owned': 479, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 4749, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2034, 'last_played': 1693887092}
review:
I've played a lot of Tetris. I'm no expert, and the players in online make me feel like a beginner, but this is an unmissable classic if you love Tetris *or* Puyo, and I'm actually able to Puyo because of this game forcing you to in the story progression.

Not that I mind, since learning to Puyo helped me better focus on planning for future pieces in Tetris...

Beware the DT Cannon, though...!

review:
It's Puyo Puyo and it's Tetris all under one neat competitive bow!\
It's hard to mess up Puyo Puyo and Tetris, but to flesh out a multiplayer involving both games, multiple game modes, and a campaign goes above and beyond what any of these games was designed to offer.
There is nothing quite like it; I'm glad it was done right the first time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107367737', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 3010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1914, 'last_played': 1611817151}
review:
I have a love hate relationship with puyopuyo tetris. I absolutely love playing tetris and I hate playing puyopuyo. Despite this, the game is still amazing because I refuse to let my incapability to learn how to stack puyo's to determine how good I think this game is. Now if you don't mind, i'm going to go screw myself by placing a tetris piece 1 space away from where I need it.

in seriousness, the multiplayer function is incredibly lacking because it seemed that when I tried to play with my friend, it kept disconnecting the game halfway through almost every single time. Despite this, the rest of the game is great. adventure is very entertaining, I love all the different gamemodes, and the voice acting is fun to hear when you get combos.

author: {'steamid': '76561198051939071', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 9756, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9306, 'last_played': 1577839397}
review: Puyo Puyo Tetris is the perfect gateway into the Puyo Puyo franchise, this game boasts quite a large amount of content (multiple game modes, a story, and multiple score attack modes) and it is definitely worth the price. It should be mentioned for sure that this port of the game has very well documented issues, a better port would be most other versions of this game (i.e. Switch, PS3/4, etc.). However, personally, I have never had an issue with an in game glitch or soft lock, as they are relatively rare and/or easy to avoid. Overall, Puyo Puyo Tetris is a very fun game, and I wholeheartedly recommend this game to any gamer, casual or hardcore.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010179510', 'num_games_owned': 1779, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 423, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1589773232}
review: The video game equivalent of chocolate and peanut butter. Puyo Puyo Tetris blends, well, Puyo Puyo and Tetris to great effect. There are various modes that mix the two to varying degrees, from swapping between the two styles to straight dropping both Puyos and tetrominoes onto the same board. The story mode weaves a story with the Puyo Puyo and an original Tetris set of characters interacting with each other. It doesn't rise above Saturday morning cartoon level fare, but they do a good job of mixing things up, and you can tell the writers and VAs had fun with it. In all, if you're a fan of Puyo Puyo, Tetris, or both, this is worth a look.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014161807', 'num_games_owned': 529, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 985, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 985, 'last_played': 1561092434}
review:
Solid, competitive, and fun puzzle game with the option of either Puyo Puyo or Tetris, two, very popular puzzle games, particularly in Japan. There are also other modes available such as a combination of both Puyo Puyo and Tetris, a mode only available in this title. 

An emphasis on competitive in that it isn't just about stacking quickly and unleashing chains, combos, and T-spins, but you will also want to watch your opponent to see when they will unleash an attack, and be able to react to them, or when they are vulnerable to attacks that will stop them from being able to attack. Understanding the flow of offensive play and defensive play will be key. 

You can still play competitively with knowledge in only one game mode if you wish. Find your preferred play style and clear stacks of puyo/lines to victory!

author: {'steamid': '76561198149890402', 'num_games_owned': 419, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1265, 'last_played': 1708671952}
review:
I was first introduced to puyo when i was around 7 years of age and was introduced to puyo pop fever, in which i had never had much of an experience with tetris. this game intorduces me to tetris, and i am realising by playing this game exactly how great both of these games were. Absolutely nailed it with this game, which can allow you experience puyo or tetris, or even allow you to combine both together, which is actually really awesome. Absolute trip down memory lane, and brings me soo much joy. would recommend to anyone, for an awesome experience and just a ton of fun overall 

8.5/10

review:
Super fun game to play casually with friends or random match. Wish you can fix the screen display such as have a 3 player mode, it often uses the 4 frame space with the 4th slot empty. This makes the screen much too small to comfortably play.

Otherwise, straightforward and simple game.

review: Este juego es bueno para jugar algo "competitivo" aÃºn con todos los errores que sigue teniendo, e igual te enseÃ±a los principios bÃ¡sicos de ambas partes, solo que dirÃ­a que es mejor mantenerse alejado del online, o igual jugar con amigos no es un bonito lugar si apenas empiezas a jugar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198120778888', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 769, 'last_played': 1590334882}
review:
Puyo Puyo Tetris Ist eine Mischung aus Puyo Puyo und Tetris, dass ich eine Warnung ausspreche:
Solltet ihr nur fÃ¼r Tetris hier sein gibt es bessere und kostenlose Alternativen.

Wenn euch diese Warnung nicht aufhÃ¤lt erwartet euch eine kurzweilige Mischung aus Player Vs. CPU Spielen die von den Klassischen Versionen von Tetris und Puyo Puyo bis zur kompletten Vermischung der beiden Spiele mit eigenen Regeln reichen.

Der Online-PvP-Bereich ist mit wenigen, aber starken Gegnern gespickt, Man sollte sich mit seinen Fertigkeiten sicher sein, bevor man hier spielt. Zum glÃ¼ck kann man aber in den Optionen Spiele im PvP bereich bannen, sodass du nur deine lieblings-Spieltypen dort spielen kannst.

Die Story besitzt ebenso wie seine Charaktere einen kindlichen Humor, der mir persÃ¶nlich SpaÃŸ gemacht hat, aber auch fÃ¼r manche zu flach und eindimensional sein kann.

Jedoch wird, sobald man alle Spielmodi im Player Vs. NPC kennt und beherrscht, der SpielspaÃŸ schnell sinken. In meinen 12 Spielstunden hatte ich das GefÃ¼hl, alles gesehen und gemacht zu haben, was das Spiel anzubieten hat.
AuÃŸerdem stellt der PvP-Bereich einen enormen Sprung in der Schwierigkeit dar, dass man sich nach ein paar Versuchen wahrscheinlich komplett davon fernhÃ¤lt. 

Daher kann ich das Spiel nur bei Rabattaktionen um 50% empfehlen, da die kurze Zeit die ich mit dem spiel SpaÃŸ hatte, ich wirklich viel SpaÃŸ hatte.

author: {'steamid': '76561198167467582', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 12721, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5927, 'last_played': 1661414325}
review:
I can recommend this game to anyone who loves either Puyo Puyo, Tetris, or both. I will warn you, though, that there are a few issues regarding balances in this game, specifically in relation to garbage.

Garbage appears in Tetris boards as single lines, making each individual piece of garbage more daunting. The more garbage, the more lines, et cetera. The garbage pushes your board upwards from the bottom, letting you make combos.

On the other hand,

Puyo Puyo players are, when put against Tetris players, not going to have as much fun. Garbage comes from the top, and even single units can mess you up. But that's just Puyo Puyo, so it's to be expected. The fun is taken away with how fast a tetris player can deal damage through combos, Tetrises or T-spins, while a Puyo Puyo player is waiting for garbage to fall. When the garbage finally finishes descending, you can place one to two puyo pairs before the next set of garbage falls, if the Tetris player is good enough.

Don't worry, though; this doesn't mean Puyo Puyo vs Tetris isn't fun. Sometimes, they have the longest games, and they can be quite interesting! Two puzzles collide into one decently executed amalgamation. This game is also a lot of fun with friends that play with you, so always consider that as an option!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011839414', 'num_games_owned': 1788, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 2108, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1895, 'last_played': 1607360759}
review:
Sometimes throwing different games or game types together can bring some interesting results. Puyo Puyo Tetris is a lot more than interesting though. It's arguably one of the best competitive Tetris games out there, and the Puyo Puyo side of things adds for an interesting challenge especially if you play against someone who is only familiar with one of them. A story mode with a variety of tasks and challenges, along with an Arcade mode where you can play all the various modes against the AI or just marathon them alone; makes for rich set of features.

It's not perfect though. The PC port suffers from weird stutters and slowdowns, mostly during transitions between AI players in Endurance mode and during some visual effects. It rarely ever becomes a serious problem though. Additionally, it has Denuvo, but SEGA might remove that at some point.

This game is great and you should play it if you like Tetris or Puyo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092379263', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 15600, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10076, 'last_played': 1680801133}
review:
Pros:
- It's Tetris
- Literally only official tetris game on PC now

Cons:
- Matchmaking system completely broken (doesn't even take ranking into consideration in this broken PC port)
- Servers are god awful, game lags all over the place making tetris unplayable at times
- Matches with puyo puyo are unbalanced for low to mid range players and is equivalent of playing against a 4 wider (the outcome is out of your control = not fun)
- Position of hold box and next piece queue in 4p mode is absolute cancer and somebody should be fired. Seriously, why?

Despite all best efforts by sega to both botch this port from console and screw up every online component imaginable, it's still tetris so i still have to give it a positive review...

review:
En mi infancia, por allÃ¡ en 2012 cuando tenÃ­a 9 aÃ±os, recibÃ­ mi primer portÃ¡til; una NDS. HabÃ­a un gran catÃ¡logo de juegos por haber los cuales incluÃ­a dicha consola, pero entre ellos, uno de los que mÃ¡s llamÃ³ mi atenciÃ³n, fue "Puyo Puyo Fever". Como toda buena impresiÃ³n, desconocÃ­a en su totalidad de quÃ© impartÃ­a el juego, pero una vez que lo probÃ©, no habÃ­a marcha atrÃ¡s. Gradualmente, se convirtiÃ³ en mi juego favorito de dicha consola, en ocasiones, desvelÃ¡ndome con dicho.

El tiempo pasÃ³, y a la larga, terminÃ© abandonando la consola, por ende, el mismo juego.

AÃ±os despuÃ©s, en 2018, me enterÃ© de la existencia de este juego. Estaba emocionado al ver que uno de mis juegos de la infancia habÃ­a vuelto, y mejor aÃºn, en Steam, donde ahora poseo varios juegos que en ocasiones me apetecen jugar.

Ingresando al punto... Â¿quÃ© voy a decir de este juego? Es grandioso, es fantÃ¡stico, es disfrutable y mucho mÃ¡s. La variedad de personajes, soundtracks, opciones, y, sobretodo, el poder escoger entre Tetris y Puyo hacen que este juego sea una osadÃ­a de diversiÃ³n que puede ser disfrutado por cualquier persona. No es difÃ­cil de entender, es sencillo, e inclusive explicÃ¡ndote de manera dinÃ¡mica varias de las mecÃ¡nicas del juego, algunas implementadas en el mismo.

Para mi gusto, este juego es un regalo para mÃ­, pues simplemente no encuentro el aburrimiento en dicho, por mÃ¡s veces que pierda o gane, no encuentro manera de que me pueda aburrir.

Si lo que quieres es relajarte un poco, pero a la vez, divertirte sin igual, bienvenido seas, este es tu juego.

author: {'steamid': '76561198826800109', 'num_games_owned': 92, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1095, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 195, 'last_played': 1691582602}
review:
This game is really fun honestly. I have the PS4 version of it but i do think this version is better because of mods, free online play, Japanese voice options, etc etc. The only thing i don't really like is the keyboard/mouse controls, but that's okay because i can plug in my PS4 controller and play like that.
The story of this game is absolutely hilarious. It's classic SEGA game style, starts off cutesy with a large issue but is still cute and fun, sticks in loads of jokes in the middle, gets more serious, eventually gets kind of dark, but ends up wrapping up happy with everything fine (although, me and my friends almost cried watching the last few cutscenes!). A lot of people complain about the voice acting (mostly Lemres because his voice doesn't really fit) but i think most of it (the only voice i didn't really like was Xander Mobus as Satan, aka Dark Prince in the English version, i'd def change that.) fits.
This game can supply hours of play. If you're willing to dish out some money i suggest it. It's one of the best games i've ever played and introduced me to an awesome franchise.

author: {'steamid': '76561197991157647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 1343, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 12, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1712292727}
review:
Damn this game is fun! It's got a fantastic arcade style feel to it with the Tetris and Puyo games going together side by side. Mix with each other at times and hell there's so many different game modes that mix everything up.

The online ranked matches is going strong and it's competitive with some good players. If you are the type who wants to take these games seriously and compete against other players, check this out now rather than later.

The adventure mode story is absolutely fantastic. Great voice acting really captures the comedy and silliness of it all. Schezo... lol. I literally can jump into the story mode of this game depressed and find it impossible to stay unhappy. Everything is just so fun and the characters are so entertaining. The artwork is incredibly cute too.

I don't really know what the complaints are people are talking about, I don't care to read them either. I really love this game, a lot. And the BEST thing is IMO, is it's designed to be so incredibly flexible and supportive of people who don't have a lot of time to play a game or people who just want to play it for 10-15 minutes and then stop.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017165443', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 421, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1631011825}
review:
I love Puyo Puyo and tetris but the multiplayer is UNPLAYABLE.

I can't play with friends who have the slightest lag. 
Around 80ms ping and you will get constant black screens and disconnection.

Fun game by itself but multiplayer was unplayable for me and my friends.
My friend refunded the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198153957973', 'num_games_owned': 280, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2903, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2898, 'last_played': 1569364004}
review:
God tier gaming done in its simplest form. This game is a prime example that saya "hold my beer" to people that say its all about the graphics

I'd buy it again if I could but I own all the copies for each platform I own. This game got me through a lot in high school and I know that's strange to hear coming from a puzzle game but this really did help me through some rough times

Please give this game your money, SEGA has done a great job of introducing its Puyo game alongside a more commonly known puzzler. Tutorials for puyo are lackluster but you can still have a great time with the tetris aspect of things
