author: {'steamid': '76561198091716240', 'num_games_owned': 134, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 7814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2699, 'last_played': 1584988448}
review:
Incredibly disappointed.

I owned this game on the Nintendo Switch for a long time before this game and was excited when this was announced. After four patches I'm done giving the game the benefit of the doubt.

This game is colorful and fun and gives Tetris  a great deal of personality (something I'm glad it does personally, although purists may dislike it). It's a shame it doesn't make up for the incredibly poor balance the game suffers from. This game's balance is all over the place. For most players, Puyo will be a dominating force, nearly impossible to overcome. For big name players, Tetris easily takes wins. Big name puyo players can still make a name for thesmelves here despite competition from Tetris players, so if you really really need to play a localized version of the game, Puyo Puyo Tetris will do fine. Otherwise move over to Puyo Puyo Chronicle. For us Tetris players not named Jesus we'll just have to tough it out until the next game comes out, and hopefully it's not another Tetris Ultimate.

But now I'll delve into the real reason I'm giving this game a thumbs down. We've had four patches for this game since its release in (basically) March 2018. The console versions have had a single patch since their release in the west in (again, basically) May [b]2017[/b]. The console version patch was a rebalance that was applied to the PC version upon release. So what exactly needed to be fixed on PC? The numerous bugs it had (and still has), obviously!

The developers attempted to fix this game four times and still have not made a truly equivalent game. Although no longer an issue since the first patch, the issue was so amazingly bad it's honestly shameful the game came out in this state. Upon release, players were unable to filter out game modes. This meant modes highly unsuited for competetive play (Big Bang, especially) could be queued for, even if you filtered them out.

Since release, in Puzzle League (the game's ranked queue) the game seemingly makes no attempt to pair you with someone of similar skill. This leads to obvious problems like brand new players running into gods which results in incredibly one-sided matches nine out of ten times. You can also simply avoid fighting players who might beat you, since you will constantly be running into plenty of small-fry. This isn't a problem in the console versions of the game. There was also an exploit that could be used to quickly gain points without actually playing a match. Word has been going around that the exploit was fixed, but I've also heard that a new exploit is working, or that the old one might still actually be working.

The game also seems to have completely awful lag compensation. Either that or it literally will just blatantly ignore your connection filter and pair you with people who have awful connections. You can't tell, because unlike the console versions of the game, when you meet someone in the ranked queue, you can't see how many "bars" they have. The game doesn't simply disconnect you if the match becomes too laggy like it does on the console versions (noticing a pattern?) of the game.

Many people have also stated that playing the game with keyboard feels incredibly unresponsive compared to other tetris games. I'm inclined to agree. While I don't have a controller with a good enough D-Pad to play the game on, when playing on a controller my inputs feel much more instant and more responsive. There are a bunch of different reasons this could be, but I still think it's worth mentioning, especially because so many players prefer a gamepad to keyboard. Popular recommendations are the DualShock 4 controller and the Pokken Tournament DX controller.

When it comes down to picking which version to play, I guess it kinda depends.

[b]If you don't own a Nintendo Switch of PlayStation4:[/b] You don't really have an option here. PC version is fine. You might even enjoy it without being able to compare it to the console versions.
[b]If you own a PlayStation4:[/b] It really depends. If you are incredibly good and can be active at some weird hours (to compensate for the primarily Japanese playerbase) you'll probably enjoy this game. If you only care about offline I absolutely recommend this version of the game over the PC version.
[b]If you own a Nintendo Switch:[/b] Definitely the definitive "version" of the game. None of the bullcrap on the PC version with an active playerbase online. Get it here if you possibly can. I recommend digital purchase because it's more of a "between-games" type thing for most people, and also is 10 USD cheaper digitally,

review: Really fun mix of two great puzzle games. Small but good competitive scene that won't die, too. Story and characters feels like a Japanese arcade machine, specifically like a POP station. Overall good game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198304166952', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 8400, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4991, 'last_played': 1573012934}
review:
I love love love this game. It's fun and addicting, but not perfect. The story is kind of weak and the characters are hard to connect with unless you are familiar with the extended puyo puyo universe (which I didn't know was actually a thing until I started playing this game), and playing online with others is difficult because the lobbies are usually empty and even when they're not there's usually people there that are way above your level (literally my second game online was with the number 1 person in the world). Other than those things, it's great. 

Overall, I would recommend it. It's helped me improve in tetris a lot and the art style is cute.

author: {'steamid': '76561198304888732', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 21097, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7671, 'last_played': 1700517501}
review:
[h1][/h1][h1]Tetris meme review[/h1]
pros: t-spin duodecatris mini is a thing (thanks fusion)
cons: o-spin somewhat exists (thanks hold glitch) but not really usable[h1][/h1]

[h1][/h1][h1]More serious review[/h1]
Pros: Puyo players waited for a Puyo game out of japan in years, Tetris players wanted something on PC that wasn't garbage for competition, I wanted an official game where I could experiment modern Tetris rules convieniently. Everyone's happy cause that game is good.
Cons: Everyone's at a slight disadvantage and the game is somewhat more buggy than its PS4 or Switch counterparts (though it's being worked on and has improved a lot). Singleplayer could have used more modes IMO, like Tetris big mode (thing that Sega made an entire game about, see Tetris Giant/Dekaris) or a Puyo chain simulator.[h1][/h1]

author: {'steamid': '76561198141824856', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 12336, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6056, 'last_played': 1603927292}
review: Puyo Puyo Tetris is a wonderful game. It's vibrant, fun, and a bit addicting. Long time Puyo Puyo fans and long time Tetris fans will find enjoyment in the game in no time. Theres also a lot learning on both endings of the spectrum, and many reasons to come back to this game. It has a mulititude of modes, like Adventure, Solo and even an Online mode where you can compete against other players in a rank based system. Its quite easy to play with friends and many game modes you can play together, such as Swap, Fusion, Party, Big Bang, and of course Puyo Puyo vs Tetris. I would recommend an instant buy of this amazing puzzle game, if it wasn't for two big problems. When this game came out, it was riddled with many bugs and glitches. SEGA is trying to fix the bugs the best they can, however, even with patches, some bugs still remain. Lastly, the online matchmaking is horrendous. If you are a beginner, you'll more than likely go against top 20 players world wide. Since many beginners went against many top players, they have dropped the game and the online has become empty, you are more than likely to see the same players over and over again. I recommend Puyo Puyo Tetris on Playstation 4 and Nintendo Switch before I would recommend it for Steam, as none of those problems exist on those consoles. It's a great game, ruined by being a bad port.

author: {'steamid': '76561198044494427', 'num_games_owned': 645, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 12411, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1637, 'last_played': 1579188068}
review:
[list]
[*] [b]World's worst matchmaking system[/b] that matches newcomers to the world's top class players.
[*] The Tetris control method is full of artificial delays so [b]no one can play with their full capable speed[/b].
[*] Full of players who willingly use any method to win the game -- you'll experience lots of matches in which you place a single piece and have to wait the opponent to place 71 pieces so you can place your second piece after.
[/list]
[list]
[*] It works perfect on Linux, for only first 3 minutes. It's in my opinion worse than just not being able to run at all.
[*] Why the hell they set different prices for different regions?
[/list]

review:
Fan de Puyo puyo depuis mon plus jeune Ã¢ge sur megadrive, quel plaisir de retrouver une de mes licences prÃ©fÃ©rÃ© sur Steam! Tous les dÃ©fauts des anciens aprÃ¨s Puyo Puyo 2 sont corrigÃ©s! PiÃ¨ce identique pour les deux participants! (ou plus)
Le cÃ´tÃ© Tetris est vraiment bien intÃ©grÃ© dans le jeu, tout en laissant les modes classique, ils ont su crÃ©er des modes inÃ©dits qui sont bien emboitÃ© avec Puyo! Un pur rÃ©gal, sans oublier les voix Jap qui sont pour ma part une bÃ©nÃ©diction divine (exceptÃ© pour O avec ses "Pipipipipiiii....")
N'hÃ©sitez pas Ã  m'ajouter pour jouer Ã  ce magnifique jeu!


ENG :

Fan Puyo puyo since my youngest age on megadrive, what a pleasure to find one of my favorite licenses on Steam! All the defects of the old ones after Puyo Puyo 2 are corrected! Identical piece for both participants! (or more)
The Tetris side is really well integrated into the game, while leaving the classic modes, they have created new modes that are well nested with Puyo! A pure treat, not to mention the Jap voices which are for me a divine blessing (except for O with his "Pipipipipiiii ....")
Feel free to add me to play this wonderful game!

However, if you have a PlayStation or especially Switch, you might want to consider picking up the game there for the smoothest possible experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198106171987', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 37278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4151, 'last_played': 1683681576}
review:
It's not the best version of Puyo Puyo Tetris. The matchmaking is broken, there are a lot of audio glitches, random freezes, etc.
It's the weakest version, and i'd recommend the Switch or PS4 version over this one. But if you don't have access to any of those consoles, this is a way better alternative to Tetris Ultimate and a decent Puyo Puyo game.
Please if you're reading this, don't ditch puyo just because you don't know how to play it. check the tutorials. Puyo Puyo is a really fun game that deserves more attention.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161910985', 'num_games_owned': 49, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 62093, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11325, 'last_played': 1673246253}
review:
This is one of the best official PC version of multiplayer Tetris to date, but has a few problems.  

Pros:
+ Great sounds, graphics, and they're all moddable.  Some people even added their own custom characters to the game.
+ Puyo and Tetris, 2 seperate puzzle games at a very reasonable $20 (cheaper than the Switch version).
+ Very strategic gameplay and fairly decent userbase
+ Replay support, online leaderboards
+ Can play on keyboard, joystick, gamepad, mouse, anything.

Cons:
- Matchmaking places you up against anyone, regardless of their rating.  This can be very unforgiving for newer players who repeatedly match up against top players just to get demolished.
- No spectator support, so you'll have to use Steam share feature or stream your gameplay.
- Some game balance could use reworking, as some tactics are clearly overpowered and the Tetris vs Puyo matchup isn't very fun for either side.

Overall, it's a great game with flaws but you'll get plenty of hours of enjoyment from.  Easy buy at $20.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011768574', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 96, 'playtime_forever': 1128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 408, 'last_played': 1601516587}
review: The best of Tetris and Puyo but together, AMAZING and challenging game! Highly recommend it, and if you're old school, will sure end up loving it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198010207622', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 880, 'last_played': 1547854109}
review:
a damn fine port of two games that would've never gotten on PC but are now, so big ups.

The controls are reactive and customizable, with good KB+M support and clean graphics and runtime on my mid-end PC.

there's English and Japanese languages; a lot of charm from the JP versions doesn't translate because this was obviously just done as a courtesy, but it's fine. Who really cares about kiddie voices being tonally accurate when it's all squeals and yays to begin with?

personal note, i really liked how every tetris character is a personification of the classic shapes, with the L and J shapes being awful pranksters who ruin people's days. Because if that isn't perfectly put, I don't know what is.

if you're a casual fan looking to relax with arcade puzzles, or a hardcore fan looking for the purist competitive experience, or just a veteran who wants to check out the new ways the combination creates wild experiences, this is pretty much a must-get.

I'm definitely a casual. I can barely survive the story mode's challenges on both formats. But it's still a lot of fun to practice and play against my other casual friends.

so obviously i don't play online where people do insane super saiyan combos left and right because they've rewired their brains to exclusively output puyo/tetris builds

author: {'steamid': '76561198818431250', 'num_games_owned': 222, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 9272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 530, 'last_played': 1708045816}
review:
This version of Puyo Puyo Tetris is by far one of the best. I have always preferred keyboard controls over any controller, and this game is no exception. The controls are super precise, although the default Tetris layout is a bit... odd. Having the ability to switch between the two languages of voice tracks also makes this version superior to, say, the Switch version.

As far as the rulesets themselves go, I would like to see some of the alternate rules come to this game as a possible DLC. For instance, the Sun, Fever, and Transformation rulesets. I understand that this game's main focus is combining the worlds of Puyo and Tetris, and balancing alternate rulesets with Tetris would get messy, but I would be fine with only being able to battle Puyo vs Puyo in the alternate rulesets. But that is just what I would like.

Would I recommend this game? If you are an avid Puyo or Tetris player, this is definitely worth your money. This game packs a full story mode, along with your typical arcade-style VS mode, with up to 4 players battling with or against eachother. Grab a friend, and enjoy some Puyo/Tetromino-popping action!

Play it. Have fun. Get destroyed by the cruel masters in online play. You'll love every minute of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081755231', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1264, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1021, 'last_played': 1580693251}
review:
Great game if you want to casually enjoy tetris/puyo puyo multiplayer modes or play single player.
But for me personally as a player from Europe, who only wants to play versus 1v1 games, I get horrible latency, because the majority of the players I get matched with are from Japan, and the matchmaking controls do not offer me the ability to set the ping limit. Keep that in mind if you want to use this game for the sole purpose of playing basic tetris online battles.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053426501', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 26948, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9107, 'last_played': 1701665583}
review:
Summary: It's Puyo Puyo... [i]and[/i] Tetris?! IN THE SAME GAME?!
(Warning: this one's a long one!
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Table of Contents:
1. Pros/Cons
2. Review
3. Final Verdict
====================================================================================
1. Pros/Cons
Pros:
[list]
    [*] Puyo Puyo!!
    [*] Tetris!!
    [*] Modding compatability!!
[/list]
Cons:
[list]
    [*] Crashes a lot.
    [*] ESS IS A WHINY BIT--
    [*] Ex's English Alt. voice makes me cringe.
[/list]

2. Review
The story starts off with a girl named Ringo. (No relation to the Beatles member of the same name.) She, along with two girls named Arle and Amitie (who are Ringo's friends), get teleported onto a space-ship, called the S.S. Tetra, captained by a young man named Tee, who is from a seperate dimension. Their dimensions have crossed over due to the Keeper of Dimensions, who's name is Ex, being lonely.
The gameplay is... varied. There are 5 main modes. Versus, Fusion, Party, Challenge, and Big Bang.
Versus is your standard fair. You can choose to play using either Puyo Puyo or Tetris's gameplay.
Fusion is... well, a fusion of Puyo Puyo and Tetris.
Party is a unique mode where you are given an item, and if you clear a line with the item (Tetris) or match 4 near the item (Puyo Puyo), the item is put into effect, and is immediately replaced with another item.
Challenge is endless mode, with 3 of the modes being dedicated to Puyo Puyo (Endless Tiny Puyo, Endless Puyo Puyo, and Endless Fever), and the other 3 being dedicated to Tetris. (Sprint, Marathon, and Ultra.)
Big Bang is a game mode where you have to clear as many lines (Tetris) or Chains (Puyo Puyo) as possible before the timer goes off, after which both players send nuisance to eachother's boards, with the player who cleard the most lines/chains doing damage.

3. Final Verdict
Story: 8/10
Gameplay: 9/10
Graphics: 8/10
Overall: 8.5/10
Meant for...
Gamers who are familiar with puzzle games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198099306504', 'num_games_owned': 179, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 4538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 562, 'last_played': 1671409290}
review: If you want anime girls and puzzles, play HuniePop instead

author: {'steamid': '76561198107464933', 'num_games_owned': 560, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 28490, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7764, 'last_played': 1631329633}
review:
10/10 game.

Insanely high skill ceiling, which is always a plus for me; perfect controls, great art style, 5 different main modes which have different mechanics and strategies, 6 different "challenge" modes, very fun single player story mode, great characters (aside from o. fuck o.), local multiplayer is very well thought out; you can select how many players there are, what controls they are using (keyboard or controller), whether you want teams or not, and you can set ai on or off. On top of all that there's online multiplayer, both ranked and casual. Casual is dead, but ranked always has players online, although they will almost always be extremely experienced players. I highly recommend picking this up if you like either puyo puyo or tetris, or haven't played them before and want to give it a try.

review:
I have been waiting for a PC tetris game to replace TETRIS attack for the WII. This game is similar and totally different than TETRIS attack, but it is good enough for me. It works good with xbox controllers, including mixing xbox one, xbox 360 wireless and xbox 360 wired controllers. 

PRO:
- 4k@60FPS 
- Great local Multiplayer
- A variety of modes
- Good controller support
- Steam Badges
- No Uplay

CON:
- Fusion mode is terrible

author: {'steamid': '76561198215337317', 'num_games_owned': 539, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 2590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1160, 'last_played': 1629209676}
review:
If you think this game is a remake of tetris, youre wrong
this game combine 2 classics game, PuyoPuyo and Tetris

[list]
If you wondering why this game kinda 'expensive' for a classics game, well you see:
 [*] its a remake of 2 classics old game
 [*] its not cheap to buy a license from a 'product', and the music too
 [*] this game is full of new mode to play
 [*] its not easy to make a 'COM Player' for this game
[/list]

If youre a fans of tetris and puyopuyo, this game worth to buy
story mode is hard enough, and funny too

I read another review about input delay and lag in multiplayer mode, and it didnt happen to me
overall, nice characters and graphics + Japanese seiyuu

ps: [spoiler] sorry for bad english [/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198022270757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 63353, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10170, 'last_played': 1711046009}
review:
This is a very good game.

Across all of my incarnations on many other games (I am an advanced soul who has reincarnated across hundreds of games. According to the Michael Teachings cosmology, I'm an enlightened soul), this is the game with the precise cosmic vibrations required to manifest free will.

Since I am a fragment of the all-that-there-is, the purpose of life is to see the divine in the mundane, and manifest the divine in the mundane. This game allows me to do so very well.

I only wish that this game was a bit more like Pokemon - has lots of monsters to catch and play with, then with an entire RPG world like World of Warcraft, with dungeons, and stuff, and some city-builder, minecraft, and FPS elements. And maybe Civ 5 elements too.

Then it will be a perfect game.

Anyway, that said, I recommend this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198098223313', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 10614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2090, 'last_played': 1602622042}
review:
(Point de vue d'un joueur de Puyo)

C'est sympa, j'apprÃ©cie surtout le online/multi. Jouer contre des joueurs de tetris permet d'appliquer des stratÃ©gies differentes, mÃªme si Ã  haut niveau l'avantage pour tetris est Ã©vident (problÃ¨me d'Ã©quilibre), donc il faut Ãªtre un vrai guerrier pour s'en sortir avec Puyo. Ceci dit, on peut penser que c'est dÃ©jÃ  fantastique de pouvoir faire jouer des joueurs d'un jeu diffÃ©rent ensembles d'une faÃ§on pas trop cassÃ©e (un peu quand mÃªme), donc je salue quand mÃªme le travail.

Pas fan des modes bizarres genre swap, big bang truc, moi je veux juste Puyo tsu. Concernant ce dernier les contrÃ´les sont parfaits comme souvent. L'univers fluo pourra en rebuter quelques uns, mais l'humour est de la partie et puis bon, on achÃ¨te ce jeu pour son gameplay d'une profondeur insondable, pas pour le reste.

author: {'steamid': '76561198031675374', 'num_games_owned': 745, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 223, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1529266632}
review:
Me before playing this: "what the everloving fuck is puyo puyo"
Me after playing this(mostly on console, mind): "what is a puyo puyo player but a miserable pile of secrets"

It's a game you really buy for multiplayer where the world is someone's oyster. Usually not yours.
The port is pretty much flawless, it does provide japanese audio option so your ears are safe from the horrors of localization.
The controls are optimized for whatever, really, you can probably make this work with DK Bongos and be good at it if you really want to, it's bloody tetris and/or puyo puyo.
It's also a puyo puyo game, so if you've never played that but want to get into it - a very good point to start.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085189433', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 462, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1619267063}
review:
Puyo Puyo Tetris provides a range of entertaining game modes involving both Puyo Puyo and Tetris for up to four players. This game offers a compendium of both games, as well as a unique blend of the two.

If you're a fan of either game, then this game is worth a buy - particularly given the lack of steam-based alternatives.

Offline multiplayer offers 5 game modes.

The traditional versu mode allows each player to pick  either a Puyo Puyo or Tetris board.

Swap requires players to alternate between both Puyo Puyo and Tetris boards, whoever loses on one board first loses the road.

Fusion offers a hybrid of the two games on a single board. The mode is indrecibly challenging, not only do Puyo Puyo and Tertris blocks soawn on the same board but the block are non traditional shapes, Tetris blocks crush Puyo Puyo blocks, and Puyo Puyo blocks will spawn seemingly at random on your board.

Big Bang is basically about who can clear pre-set challenges with the highest score.

Party is an infinate lives high points scoring round with powerups.

The price tag may be a little steeper than someone would be willing to pay for eithe Tetris or Puyo Puyo, but the though put into the gamemodes and the lack of alternatives on steam make the price quite reasonable.

Subscribe to my curator page for more local multiplayer recommendations: http://store.steampowered.com/curator/7189360/

No soy tan fan de tetris y mi conocimiento acerca de puyo puyo era superficial (en el mejor de los casos), ademÃ¡s de tener la impresiÃ³n de que uno era el aceite y el otro el agua.

[u]Y aun asÃ­ funciona a la perfecciÃ³n.[/u]

Eso no quita el hecho de que salÃ­o con problemas de optimizaciÃ³n, que deberÃ­an es imprecindible que juegues los tutoriales para entender que esta sucediendo en la pantalla, que dichos tutoriales son algo anÃ©micos y que aÃºn tienen problemas en cuanto los juegos en lÃ­nea.

Y, a pesar de todo lo que acabo de escribir, lo adoro.

author: {'steamid': '76561198141201307', 'num_games_owned': 120, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 9742, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7591, 'last_played': 1615791725}
review:
Puyo Puyo Tetris...!
Since I'm aware the existence of this game, I've always wanted this game badly. So much that I'd go buy Nintendo Switch just to play this game. I just can't afford a 'Switch. It was hard for me to let go this game, believing that Sega would never port this game on anywhere. One guy on the official PPT facebook page predicted that it might get ported to 3DS.

10 months later, Sega proved me and the guy wrong. The moment I knew it'll came out, I'm very happy, and pre-purchased it right away. By the time it was released, I downloaded and loaded the game for the first time. "This is it," I said to myself, "The thing I've truly wanted". Words can't explain on how joyful I am at the time.

[h1]TetrisÂ® Puyo Puyoâ„¢[/h1]

The brilliance of this game comes from combining two action puzzle games, Puyo Puyo and Tetris. Puyo Puyo is a Japanese game where you connect 4 adjacent Puyos and try to beat your opponent by executing large chain setups. Tetris is a Russian game where you make a solid line and try to beat your opponent by clearing Tetrises, T-spins, and Combos as fast as you can.

Of course, nothing is perfect. The system, however, has a major flaw. It favors Puyo players. They can simply build and fire a large chains to send an astronomical amount of garbage, rendering Tetris players helpless. Tetris players cannot do this. All they can do is to play really fast without misdropping anything, and hope they could bury Puyo players before they even have a chance to fire.

Another problem arises when this game lacked players at start. Since Tetris and Puyo Puyo is a very well-known game, this attracted the existing Puyo and Tetris pros into the Puzzle League. These pros play extremely well. Pushing the newcomers into abyss. This discouraged the potential customers to buy this game (it's also expensive).

4 times Sega tried to fix this matchmaking problem, all of them which they failed. The reason is very simple, there's not enough player to be matched with the same skill level. These godly players can be seen with 10000 ratings or more, some of them even reached 20000 ratings, and they also have Star or higher leagues. Unless you're one of them, fighting them is a death wish. You. Will. Fail.

Due to the same problem above, Free Play also lacks players. This is unconfirmed, though, as I can only see from my viewpoint in a third-world country. Maybe I could try use a VPN and go reach the rest of the world, fixing both Puzzle League and Free Play problem. But that would cause more latency, [spoiler]which is bad[/spoiler]. Maybe someone can confirm this?

The rest of the game is good enough. You can't use the CPU to train yourself to get better, since players are always better than CPU (though, there is AI core codein other Puyo Puyo games that can be activated to give the CPU a godly skills, which I'm not sure if there is one in the game). You can try select high-tier characters ([strike]Satan[/strike] Dark Prince, Ecolo, Ex) to CPU and giving it the spicy handicap to give yourself the best AI (If you ever found the AI core code, tell me!).

One more thing. Story mode CPUs are a joke! They're so easy to beat, you don't have to worry not be able to see the entire story. The story, though.... *sniffs* *cries*

EDIT: Yay, I've reached 10k rating! As I've said earlier, if you're great at Puyo or Tetris, it's possible to climb the Puzzle League (but not the top leaderboards, obviously). I reached it with Tetris.

[h1]This game, explained in terms of other games[/h1]
It's literally written in the title.

Gameplay:
If you're a pro or like to be beaten by pros (or you have friends), then it's good! Otherwise, go play against the CPU.
Story:
Their story mode almost made me cried.
Graphics:
Each character only had like 3 pose in story mode, but only one in the character selection screen! Wish they have more.
Achievements:
Yeah, go try getting the 10-win-on-puzzle-league achievement on this so-dead game.
Multiplayer:
You can play with friends, or take on some 10000+ rating players.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060498180', 'num_games_owned': 518, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 3377, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2831, 'last_played': 1679541863}
review:
Even with the bugs, VA mix ups and online lameness, these things are too far between (other than online) to really put the game down. I got into Tetris via the NES, and this game definitely quenches that area of Tetris I've desired. Puyo Puyo I have a lesser experience, racking maybe an hour or 2 in PuyoVS. The blend of both genres that I have grown interested in is exacltly what I've wanted, and the mixing of said genres welcome (fusion can go die please). The game itself is really fun and addictive. I'd recommend.

TL;DR : Game has bugs, they are so insignificant that you can still have fun.


oh yea this game has mods

author: {'steamid': '76561198080568830', 'num_games_owned': 175, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3365, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1818, 'last_played': 1711081471}
review:
[b]PROS:[/b]
[list]
[*] Puyo Puyo and Tetris work very well together
[*] Story mode is engaging
[*] Tons of playable modes
[*] Both english and japanese voice acting (PC exclusive feature!)
[/list]

[b]CONS:[/b]
[list]
[*] No online filtering for each game. The closest you'll get is swap mode.
[*] Game is heavily unbalanced at higher play levels. It's frustrating to play Puyo online as such. However, at lower play levels, it's frustrating to play Tetris online.
[*] Plentiful sound bugs.
[*] Bad learning environment for both Puyo and Tetris. You get only 3 tutorials for Puyo Puyo, which cover nearly nothing.
[/list]

Easily my favorite game at the moment, and it's stayed that way for half a year, even despite the huge flaws.

I started on the switch version, very curious as to what Puyo Puyo was, and I was already a huge fan of Tetris. After playing the switch demo, I was hooked and cashed in. Giving around 2-3 hours of time to watching puyo puyo tutorials on youtube, I could make a decent 2-3 chain. 

Ever since then, I've completely fallen in love with Puyo. I can easily get a 10-11 chain, and I find it fun even when just playing offline, on my own. 

Online is fun, albeit a bit frustrating for both beginning players and proffesional players, because the game has a hard time balancing the two.

This is the best way to play Puyo and Tetris on the PC. Super big reccomendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066696396', 'num_games_owned': 449, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 6434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2841, 'last_played': 1611462743}
review:
Bad port of a great game.

Most of the bugs at launch have been patched, though I'm sure the Puyo puyo Tetris purist will be disaapointed.
But, as someone doesn't have a Switch or PS4, this port does the job.


As for the game itself?

9/10 Love it! And can't stop playing it. 
High recommend, if you know how to optimize your setup around bad ports.

author: {'steamid': '76561198028319431', 'num_games_owned': 235, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 7247, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3381, 'last_played': 1599199706}
review: I'd say this game is definintely worth getting to play with friends or if you like playing either puyo pop or tetris. There's some issues with voices in the adventure mode, the mixing is pretty bad. In gameplay the voices can overlap one another if you get a big chain but I believe this issue is present in older titles as well. Overall though, this is a fun game and can be a blast even if you don't play online. I recommend it for sure, but I would say play with a controller. It's the best way to play in my opinion, but keyboard and mouse controls are good too from my experiences.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058268165', 'num_games_owned': 142, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 943, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 875, 'last_played': 1552353831}
review: i am a very casual puyo puyo and tetris player. and i bought this because it looked extremely fun. which it is, the main storyline is your typical teeheehee silly talk characters. but im sure alot of people are more interested in the multiplayer aspect. and let me say as of writing this review. the multiplayer lobbies are unfortunately somewhat dead. there are multiple gamemodes but most of the lobbies seem to be non existant with nobody in there besides 2-3 in a match at most. and when you do get into a game most people will usually outskill you. (alot of japanese try hards) the same goes for ranked 1v1 matches. there is no rating difference and you will often get matched against people at 15k rating (you start at 2k) and will get massacred if you are not great. that being said. theres quite a few levels in the campain and it is pretty fun to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041905817', 'num_games_owned': 3251, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 3022, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1239, 'last_played': 1609139165}
review:
Do you like Tetris? Do you like Puyo Puyo?
You probably do, since you're looking at this review. The game has many different modes and is sure to waste many hours of your time! Not everyone might be a fan of the story or voice acting, but the gameplay is just great, along with the music. It has many varying levels of difficulty (in the form of different opponent characters) as well as the ability to play and compete online.
Also, this is pretty much the only licensed game for either franchise on PC.

review: I'm so glad that I can play tetris again. Since this game is mixed with tetris and puyo, it will be a bit hard to balance. I think puyo is way more powerful than tetris. With almost 7~8 combos you opponents cannot do anything. It needs banlace patch urgently.

review:
STEAM VERSION NOT RECOMMENDED, BUY ON SWITCH INSTEAD

playing online is pointless, everyone auto picks puyos and uses a script to play with 100 percent efficiency. pass on this game if you want to play ranked matchmaking in any capacity, or get it for switch or something with a nice boxed copy and actual players to play against instead of bots.

author: {'steamid': '76561198144724064', 'num_games_owned': 79, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 12467, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7358, 'last_played': 1662985881}
review:
this is my review 
 
puyo Puyo Tetris is a well-made puzzle game with awesome music and gameplay

adventure mode is super fun and easy to earn points for the shop and to learn about the game

tetris is fun and with the srs can you defeat your enemies very fast 
t spins are easy to do, 

puyo Puyo i remember Puyo Puyo as a spin-off game ( mean bean machine )
with this game, I learned so much from this game that I've become much better at mean bean 

ranked matches
playing online against someone with Puyo Puyo and Tetris is awesome
but I have to admit it as a guy and Puyo player that knows how to play 2 games very well
you will found somebody out of your league that does four wide or a guy that plays really Puyo Puyo is a little hard but still fun to go against someone that has more experience
makes you good at does games

so this was my review 


ps I'm from the Netherlands sorry for my bad grammar

author: {'steamid': '76561198027361060', 'num_games_owned': 303, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 7104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4891, 'last_played': 1616749394}
review:
(previous entry about lag with 3 or more players when at least one player is playing Puyo Puyo or the mode includes Puyo Puyo)

It seems that multiplayer lag is finally fixed for my friends and I (at least for versus), so I shall change my review to say recommended. I really do like the multiplayer as I feel it is the most enjoyable when you and your friends are stressing/panicking over garbage you send to each other. 

I am glad they are still trying to patch and fix the issues and not given up on it. 

Also, as mentioned in previous review that I also enjoyed the story mode since it had some comical stuff and was overall cute. I prefer the Japanese over the English, but the English dub wasn't completely awful.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068246286', 'num_games_owned': 242, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 3310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3186, 'last_played': 1545877369}
review:
A great action-puzzle game with a single player campaign that's actually worth playing. It can be tricky to learn at first (especially Puyo Puyo, which hasn't had a release in NA for 14 years), but a competent tutorial helps a lot (even if it's a bit short). The only real flaw is the Online Matchmaking rarley pairs you with similarily ranked players, so getting destroyed by people ranked #1 regionally can happen to people who've just started the game.

Basically, if youre at all interested in the game, you'll definitely enjoy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968748110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 230, 'playtime_forever': 564, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 564, 'last_played': 1521395290}
review:
Fast, and fun! 

Puyo Puyoâ„¢TetrisÂ® is a fun, face paced and addicting puzzle game!   You get the best of 2 worlds in puzzle gaming, and even get to play them at the same time!  

Gameplay
Puyo Puyoâ„¢TetrisÂ® is exactly what you expect. It's got the best elements of a Puyo Puyo game, based around the Fever engine, now mixing the classic experience of Tetris!   A new mix to the game is now not only can you do Fever in Puyo Puyo, but they made a Fever mode for Tetris as well!  Game has several modes to play such as Story Mode, Fusion, VS, Multiplayer, and more!  Game is okay to play alone, but this is an awesome game on multiplayer!  Get your best friends around online, or even Local, and get to it, because you'll be having a wild time!   Story Mode in the game is......Bland... It's got new characters to the game, and it's really just a basic reason to get Puyo Puyo to meet up with the Tetris Universe. Your investment in the characters will most likely be little to none. It's all about the gameplay here, and that's what's important. 

Sound
Music is pretty forgettable, and the voice acting (Japanese for me) will leave you bored really. This is one of those games that go good with your own music, or a Podcast in the background,  

Graphics
Colorful and exciting when in gameplay!  It retains the same engine design we've seen since Puyo Puyo Fever. If it isn't broken, no reason to fix it I guess. The animations even seem to be slightly recycled from previous games as well. Regardless, it's good as it is.

Controls
Kind of a personal gripe, but doing Hard Drops in Tetris gave me issues at time.  The button (Most of the time Up on the D-Pad) can be a little TOO sensitive, and i've found myself messing up rounds like that. I've tried other mappings, but they just didn't work out for me, so I guess I can only request that to change the sensititiy a little on the Hard Drop command?  Regardless, everything seems fine. 

Issues
Only technical issue I had with the game was an odd sound glitch. I would locally Verse a friend and we'd play several round in the same stage, and characters. Upon going into another round, sometimes the voices of the characters would either switch, only one side would work, or it would be totally silent. This happened quite a few times, and it was odd.  Like I mentioned really, the voice acting isn't anything to write home about, but it's still an issue that should be addressed. 

Overall Puyo Puyoâ„¢TetrisÂ® is an awesome game! It's cheap and well worth the full price of $20!   Get your friends, or find some new ones online, and have fun!  It'll have you on the ropes and sweating like crazy!  I HIGHLY RECOMMEND this title! 

9/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197985215786', 'num_games_owned': 2073, 'num_reviews': 199, 'playtime_forever': 280, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 280, 'last_played': 1521396026}
review:
Tra i punti fermi della mia infanzia c'Ã¨ sempre stato Tetris. Giocato rigorosamente sul Game Boy di un amico di mio padre, dopo ogni cena partiva il momento gioco e io gli bruciavo le batterie cercando di battere ogni possibile record. Un gioco tanto semplice quanto malvagio, capace di far divertire piccoli e grandi e che SEGA ha voluto riprendere per unirlo a Puyo Puyo, altro storico esponente di tutti quei giochi rompicapo come Dottor Mario o Super Puzzle Fighter 2 Turbo. Una scelta simpatica, che Ã¨ stata ben supportata da una buona quantitÃ  di alternative di gameplay per rendere il pacchetto piÃ¹ interessante.
Questa si articolano in una campagna single player per imparare a gestire e migliorare le nostre abilitÃ  con entrambi i giochi, e tutta una serie di modalitÃ  multigiocatore che faranno la gioia di amanti delle sfide online e di quelle sul divano con amici, birra e patatine. Soprattutto quando si deciderÃ  di scontrarsi nel Party Mode, una modalitÃ  caotica e piena di imprevedibili poteri che richiederanno maggiore attenzione e abilitÃ  nell'adattarsi a regole temporanee (come non poter ruotare i blocchi o altri bonus/malus).

Come giÃ  spiegato ampiamente da Peppe nella sua recensione per la versione Switch, Puyo Puyo Tetris Ã¨ esattamente quello che sembra: l'unione di due giochi che mi hanno mandato il cervello in pappa visto l'approccio piuttosto diverso richiesto per vincere le partite. Fino a quando le due entitÃ  vivono di vita propria non avrete chissÃ  che problemi, a parte l'ovvia preferenza per una modalitÃ  rispetto all'altra, ma il bello verrÃ  tutto nel momento in cui le due si accavalleranno (modalitÃ  Fusion) o, peggio di alterneranno (modalitÃ  Swap). Nel primo caso, i blocchi di Tetris avranno un peso specifico superiore sulle bolle Puyo, aggiungendo quindi una dimensione di gravitÃ  che farÃ  esplodere i Puyo durante la discesa, ma che rigurgiterÃ  tutto quello che Ã¨ stato tolto sopra il pezzo del Tetris utilizzato.

Nel secondo caso, invece, le due modalitÃ  si alterneranno dopo un determinato lasso di tempo, imprevedibile, che vi obbligherÃ  a modificare rapidamente la maniera di pensare: nel Tetris l'obiettivo Ã¨ creare linee orizzontali (ancor meglio se in blocco invece di una alla volta), mentre con Puyo Puyo dovrete ragionare in termini di colore e quantitÃ . Se quindi il primo vi porterÃ  alla creazione di strutture verticali compatte e con pochi spazi da riempire al momento giusto, il secondo sarÃ  un vero castello poco uniforme di colori, nella speranza di avere abbastanza luciditÃ  da innescare reazioni a catena una volta fatto esplodere uno o piÃ¹ colori. Per di piÃ¹, nel momento in cui avverrÃ  il cambio, riuscire a pizzare correttamente il pezzo in discesa produrrÃ  notevoli bonus durante l'esecuzione dell'altra modalitÃ , rovesciando bolle e pezzi grigi nel campo dello scenario.

Ma Puyo Puyo Tetris non Ã¨ solo tecnica, ma Ã¨ veramente tanto divertimento, che giochiate da soli o con amici. BenchÃ© la storia della campagna sia piena di colori e robe senza senso, questa vi allenerÃ  senza sosta per migliorare le vostre capacitÃ . La curva dÃ¬ difficoltÃ  Ã¨ piuttosto ripida, e non mancheranno momenti di stallo in cui vi chiederete COME sia possibile raggiungere certi punteggi in cosÃ¬ poco tempo... e la risposta sarÃ  sempre la stessa: dovrete evolvervi. Evolvervi in mostri di combo, in macchine assassine da movimenti automatici, perchÃ© che la combo di due tasselli lunghi sia la base fondamentale per un Back-To-Back, e che i Puyo Puyo vadano messi a colpi di 3 a 3 a scalare per creare combo devastanti, dovranno diventare concetti cosÃ¬ ovvi da non preoccuparvi piÃ¹ del SE riuscirete a vincere, ma pensare a QUANTI secondi vi basteranno. L'autismo scorrerÃ  potente nelle vostre vene, e si trasformerÃ  in risate e blasfemia se vi diletterete con amici. Insomma, nel dare un tocco di modernitÃ  alla tradizione, SEGA ha confezionato un prodotto divertente, immediato, complesso e godibile da tutti che non si puÃ² non consigliare. Che siate curiosi, amanti dei party game (di logica) o piÃ¹ semplicemente nostalgici, Puyo Puyo Tetris Ã¨ il gioco che fa per voi. Adesso lo trovate pure su Steam a 20 euro.

Ho perso l'uso delle dita creando combinazioni umanamente impossibili grazie a un codice gentilmente offerto dagli sviluppatori.

8,5

author: {'steamid': '76561198079069616', 'num_games_owned': 1351, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 2575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1252, 'last_played': 1581990490}
review:
It's Tetris and Puyo Puyo, but more 

The folks at SEGA bring us Puyo Puyo Tetris, a game aimed to combine the endless fun of both games and it does this VERY well. If you've ever been a fan of either of the two games, then this will most definitley interest you. 

[h1] Story [/h1]
Wait there's a story in this game? Yeah.... and it's not very exciting either. Basically tetris blocks start falling out of the sky in puyo puyo land and our main lead Rinko has no idea why and must search for the reason why the two dimensions collided. Nothing exciting but it passes the time. 

[h1] Gameplay [/h1] 
Don't expect JUST Puyo's and Tetrominos in this for SEGA has decided to create different game modes named Fusion, Big Bang and Swap. Fusion is the most interesting of the three as your board contains both puyos and tetris blocks leading to fun and thought provoking gameplay. Big Bang is just puzzle mode and Swap is exactly what you think it is. (swaps between the two games). The game also features Local Co-Op and Online Mode to play with a few friends. There's also a Party mode for people who like items (ew) and a challenge mode if you feel brave. 

[h1] Features [/h1]
Puyo Puyo Tetris also comes with various different settings and gamepad support. The game allows for Japanese VO and I had no issues playing with a 360 controller. The game also comes with lessons on how to play Puyo Puyo and Tetris as well as a replay feature. The game features a wide selection of characters and a shop to purchase alternate voices and costumes for your puyos and tetrominos. 

[h1] Online Gameplay [/h1] 
Don't bother unless your good or you'll play with friends over Steam. The online ranking mode is hard to compete with since there's no guarentee you'll end up with players your rank. Other than that, there was a few connectivitey issues I noticed. 

[h1] Final Thoughts [/h1]
It's a tetris game with puyo puyo. Does it beat the online free versions? Probably not, but the game is still worth it's price. A clean UI and a fun way to pass the time with a few friends since it allows split screen local co-op. You'll probably won't see SEGA's new gamemodes anywhere else either. If you like either Tetris or Puyo Puyo, get this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198443790363', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1954, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 887, 'last_played': 1644053200}
review: okay, when you're playing agianst the cpu and you're on endless mode or whatever and you defeate an opponent and it pulls in a new one, during that little time a lag spike happens and it doesn't read your inputs. So maybe you're rotating your piece during that time, you want to quick drop it, you press the rotate button and quick drop it immediately after, but uh oh, you were rotating during the lag spike, that means you weren't rotating at all and you just threw an L piece in the worst spot possible. I don't know why it would lag, it's not online, it has no reason to, but man it's a run ruiner

Hormis le dÃ©sÃ©quilibrage entre les deux gameplays (uniquement prÃ©sent en mode [i]online[/i], moi j'y touche pas avec un baton), la seule chose que je trouve un poil pÃ©nible (et encore une fois, c'est l'amateur de Tetris avant celui de Puyo-Puyo qui s'exprime), c'est le ton extrÃªmement colorÃ© et globalement trÃ¨s niais/cucul de l'habillage du jeu. author: {'steamid': '76561197998071409', 'num_games_owned': 1012, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 4233, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1317, 'last_played': 1611357331}
review:
Since I heard about the Switch Version (and not having a Switch), I wanted this game so badly.
I loved Puyo Puyo Pop on the DS and I play alot of Tetris from time to time anyways.
So getting this game was a kind of a no brainer.

The Story mode is kinda actually good. Its very basic and simple but its fun. Play Some Puyo vs Puyo here, play some Tetris vs Tetris there. Play Puyo Puyo Tetris everywh-  wait. still not the Switch version.
Different kind of modes do tackle the formular of both games very...interesting.
The Fusion Mode that literally combines both gameplay styles into one.
Swap - Which lets you  play Puyo and Tetris in turns.
Big Bang - Which is basicly just a speedrun of how fast you can fit Tetris Blocks into there holes or in Puyos Case. How Fast you can analyze what pattern you need to clear.
Party - This Mode is kind of similiar of what you may have seen in different Tetris Games. Random Items are being dropped in which you can send as an attack to your opponent by clearing the Lines.
It does also include the Sprint Mode (Clear 40 lines asap) and the Marathon Mode. 

For those who want to get this Title to compete online, heed my words.


You are going to get rekt. Srsly. You Will.

If you are new to puyo and felt like "man its been since the GB i played some tetris!" you should probably practice alot.
Personally, I'm a Tetris player and for me its hard to get into Puyo effeciently.  A good Puyo player who can fluently build a Combo Chain of at least 3 or 4  can send you so much garbage that you gonna have a really really bad time.
Puyo in Versus feels extremly strong so in order to compete with it  you need to send lines youself very quickly to disrupt their chain building.

There are alot of tutorials out there so if you are interested in playing competitive, thats something worth checking out.

Tl;DR:  Fun, Good price for the game, Modes are fun, Story is quite good.  Netplay is aswell no issue in most cases. Get your butt handed in Ranked Mode.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005120813', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 420, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 347, 'last_played': 1536041107}
review:
I just hate how laggy the game is even though the other player is just another state over. I don't know if it's because of balance issues Tetris vs Puyo, but Tetris always seems to have an unplayable delay.

The UI is pretty terrible as well the way it handles on the PC. I use A,D for left and right and W,S for Hard and soft drops thanks to my habit of playing FPS games and those controls only work in the game itself. They don't actually map to the direction in the UI.

I own the Switch version and to be honest, I think you're better off playing the Switch version over this. That version just feels way more polished.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087992826', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 77, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 77, 'last_played': 1521173688}
review:
It's my two favorite puzzle games in one with a lot of fun game modes that make it pretty appealing to those who like vanilla Tetris/Puyo Puyo, or those who want a nice blend of the two. Each truly feel like they compliment each other perfectly, and the presentation is a wonderful cutesy treat to boot. Really happy it came to Steam, and I'm glad Sega is looking into the PC market more! 

However, the PC port at the time of this writing is a little rough around the edges. Sega seems to be pretty transparent though and a third patch will probably drop. The biggest issues is the game seemingly forcing itself into Big Picture Mode for no real reason(?) and a lack of a way to properly quit the game while using a controller (you absolutely need a mouse to exit it).

Still gets a recommended for me though. It's priced pretty reasonably and it's basically the only decent version of Tetris on PC (let's pretend Ubisoft's Tetris Ultimate doesn't exist). Puyo Puyo is as fun as ever too, but you'll be quickly humiliated with how everybody will be able to curb-stomp you in that.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138069636', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 4461, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1861, 'last_played': 1644269964}
review:
[h1] This game is absolute chaos.	[/h1]

Puyo puyo Tetris is a very well made fusion of two of the greatest puzzle games ever. Therefore i have to talk about both sides in this review.

[b] Puyo puyo	[/b]

Puyo puyo is a game that isn't very well known outside of japan, if only for some reskins. It revolves around making some coloured blobs connect with atleast four other blobs with the same colour. I said "connect" because they just have to touch each other, no mater the direction. And as you do that, make them do combos as they fall.

[b] Tetris	[/b]

Tetris is ... well ... tetris. The famous puzzle game that everyone and their parents know and have played atleast once in their life. For anyone living under a rock, it revolves around making many differrent blocks form a row so you can clear them and gain points. Reach the top and you lose. Simple.

[b] The fusion.	[/b]

Puyo puyo Tetris allows [u] any	[/u] player to play [u] either	[/u] of the two. Meaning, when playing, one player can play Puyo puyo and another tetris. The characters are some from puyo and some originals made for the tetris side of the story. And by story i mean the most generic, with like 1 plot point story you can think of. That's to be expected from a game made out of 2 puzzle games. The music is nice and the backgrounds are cute.

[b] Conclusion	[/b]

This game is made to bring players of those games together. Get a couple of friends and some controllers and go all out.
(This game has online multiplayer but it's good only for friendly matches as the ranked matchmaking is terrible.)
Ps. Did i mention that it's the best tetris game ever made? :)

10/10
Buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198140210094', 'num_games_owned': 306, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 6215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3710, 'last_played': 1587303958}
review:
Fun game and it's totally worth it, although the unranked online communinty doesnt have enough players; there's not enough people in any rooms nor someone creating rooms. Somehow the rank matchmaking is better (I dont want to play rank cause im still a newbie tho).

Tip: Wait another month to buy this game if you want to play multiplayer.

Anyway the other game modes are fun especially swap and fusion, I still dont know how to properly chain puyos but I'm getting there. 

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198089477451', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3479, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 166, 'last_played': 1614919052}
review:
Before I begin my review, I will say that I am as much an amateur at TETRIS as I am an expert at Puyo. I have played every Puyo game that has graced the United States without fail. And I have never had any sort of problem, no matter which platform I played on. 

That being said....this is a puzzle game worth experience whether you're Yapanese or A-murrican. 

The story is whimsical but hilarious - O and Carbuncle will grow on you quickly if you like Pokemon and Yokai Watch - and the combination of Puyo and Tetris is surprisingly challenging. The most difficult is when you do a Cross Battle (what I call it) where both Puyos and Tetriminos fall in the same grid. You get a few drops of one type before it switches to the other type, which doesn't sound bad - except Puyos prevent you from forming lines of Tetriminos, while the big bulky blocks not only stop you from forming big chains, they SQUISH Puyos and make them fall back down from the top of the grid, potentially ruining whatever combo you were working on. You get a massive point boost if a combo of one starts a combo of the other......and your opponent doesn't get there first. 

Another excellent (and fairly easy) challenge is Swap Battle. You get one grid for Puyo and Tetris each, and periodically switch between. The best part is that the last piece in your grid will keep falling even when you switch, letting you stack combos from both grids simultaneously and crush your opponents with Garbage Blocks and Puyos! 

With Champions out, and plenty of support from SEGA and love from the fans, PPT is definitely a puzzle gamr that's open to anyone and everyone!

author: {'steamid': '76561198049568933', 'num_games_owned': 127, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 6853, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3598, 'last_played': 1579943052}
review:
The game is a perfect mix of both worlds. Regardless if your preferred cup of tea is Puyo or Tetris, there's a place for you. Playing with friends that are new to the game or are too mediocre at tetris? Big Bang mode fixes that ! there's a place for everybody in this game.

This game stretches your creativity for both playstyles. Learning what to do and when to do it or how is all part of the learning curve. Whether it's to creating long chains of combos or to spam out triple T-spins, learning is all part of the fun.

Absolutely lovable character designs and art complements the style of the game. Playing against friends that spent long amount of time practicing tetris on other tetris games as a mediocre puyo player, we all learn the different techniques and dynamics in this game that pushes our skills even further.

I can't recommend this game enough to people as it's a wonderful party game. Worth

author: {'steamid': '76561198012902673', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 380, 'playtime_forever': 713, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 713, 'last_played': 1520817393}
review:
Puyo Puyo Tetris offers two classic falling-block puzzle games for the price of one, and they're both a ton of fun in here, even if Tetris both is more fun and has a competitive advantage between the two. This becomes quite apparent when you're playing a Puyo Puyo vs. Tetris match or, to a lesser extent, swap or fusion modes. It comes with a story mode as well, which gets really challenging, but at least if offers the option to skip levels if they're giving you too much trouble.

Suffice it to say that this is the best Tetris game on Steam, even if that isn't really saying much on its own.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100596665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 4788, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1221, 'last_played': 1685382848}
review: God damn I've never had as much fun playing a game on steam. The best fucking competitive game on the platform without a doubt. This shit is so fucking intense, I don't even get as sweaty playing a tied game of cs go as when I'm in a 10 minute long match of tetris. This game is damn well balanced and is easy as hell to improve and climb the ladder. I can not emphasize how good the ranking system is, I mean finally a game that did it fucking right. Also this game is waaaay better than tetrisnfriend's online matches. The people on here are so much better and offer a challenge that will make your fucking balls explode. And it also has puyo if you're into that shit but its too god damn complicated for me. To conclude, this game changed the way I look at this classic title and 10/10 would recommend you can play this shit for hours and not get bored if you're a tetris fanatic.

author: {'steamid': '76561197989964287', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 13475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2279, 'last_played': 1668563493}
review:
The game is an unbalanced mess. If you like competetive tetris, steer clear of this pile of dung, puyo has a major advantage on trash sending over tetris and its just rediculous. Unless you are god tier tetris player you will lose 90% of the time to your average puyo player simply because it is unbalanced. Not only that, it takes about 2 hours to find someone of average skill level to play against, half the time you are backing out of the lobby because you have been put up against the world no. 1, what a brilliant system. 

As I said, steer clear if you are only interested in the online component.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087482992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 3399, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2633, 'last_played': 1605338197}
review:
To be honest, this Tetris game is not suitable for me, but that doesn't mean I shouldn't recommend to other Tetris lover

I am sort of a quick/fast player, not fast as Microblizz for sure. Getting sub 35~37 in sprint shouldn't be a problem in JSTris or Nullpo but because this game didn't have DAS, ARR, Initial Hold + Rotate System, it seems so impossible for me to get a similar time.

Sometime, I tend to go fast, I press hold while the lines are being cleared. In my mind, I had switched my piece. In reality, I didn't and then miss drop.

Yeah, I should stick to JSTris or Nullpo ;-;
Gonna keep this game in my library, just in case Harddrop organize a Tetris tournament~~
(PS: I took 15 hours+ just to get max score (99,999,999) in endless marathon, had fun)

author: {'steamid': '76561198071615021', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 31394, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1225, 'last_played': 1606948059}
review:
Singleplayer
+great story for a puzzle game
+six extra solo mode
+able to simulate multiplayer battles with 1-3 AI
+endurance mode for continuous games
+able to change difficulty on games, (-endurance)

Multiplayer
+able to create rooms in freeplay modes, both public and private
-hardly ever any public rooms open (probably just limited players, but still)
+ranking labeled on players in puzzle league
+filter for internetspeed
+filter for gamemodes
-no filter for rank/league in puzzle league
-big bang mode glitched (38/37 seconds left and the opponent glitches and you can't go past a first round)
-occasional glitches with matches (possibly opponents closing the game)
-no way to quit a game after both had clicked ok
-got in a match with myself, clicked ok before i noticed, game crashed, funny but irritating

Other things
limited sound options (no problem for me, plays muted)

Recommended if you want to play singleplayer, or want to play a bit flawed multiplayer

author: {'steamid': '76561197993703914', 'num_games_owned': 452, 'num_reviews': 107, 'playtime_forever': 3001, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2519, 'last_played': 1677735816}
review:
Puyo Puyo Tetris is an amalgamation of the two puzzle games Puyo Puyo and Tetris. Tetris has always been more of a single player focused experience, but the end result of the mix is a more complex whole which like Puyo Puyo is more multiplayer oriented, and it's an absolute blast to play it as such. You can play either game type alone in Versus mode, with each player choosing which they'd like to play. Or you can play Swap, a simple yet brilliant mix of the two games which has players switching between Tetris and Puyo Puyo at short fixed intervals, which allows for the introduction of more tactics such as swap combos and sharing punishment from your opponent across the two boards between swaps. The other main game type is Fusion, which has you managing Tetris and Puyo Puyo blocks on the same board simultaneously. For me this mode is a little too complex for me to enjoy and the chaining mechanic isn't as fun or as satisfying as that in normal Puyo Puyo, but there is a method to its madness and others may find it more enjoyable than I did. 

In all game modes the more you do well by either clearing Puyos or Tetris blocks from the board, the more nuisance blocks you will produce for your opponent's board, which are by their nature difficult to clear. The way for the opponent to counter these is to either respond to their opponent with similar efforts before the nuisance blocks can drop, or to clear the nuisance blocks from the board. This means that while undertaking their own efforts, players need to be aware of their opponent's actions and when they might need to counter their actions. 

If I have one issue with the game it's that Tetris and Puyo Puyo in a straight up Versus match against each other feels unbalanced. This mostly has to do with how nuisance blocks are generated for each game type and how they affect the player's ability to counter. It is a problem that is more with how the game fundamentals work than with the amount of nuisance each game type generates, so simple balance fixes on the part of the developer will probably never rectify this. For this reason the most balanced way to play is Versus against a player using the same game type, or Swap mode. Unfortunately in online ranked games there is no way to specify Versus games for only Puyo Puyo or only Tetris players, so Swap mode feels like the only consistently balanced game type on offer for ranked games. Yet there are numerous other game modes that feel like they have no place being in the competitive ranked system, such as Party mode, which introduces luck into a primarily skill based game in the form of randomised powerups, so not including the ability to play Versus specifying game types is an even more bizarre omission. 

There's a lengthy adventure mode, which has you playing all the various modes as part of a story. It is well designed for easing a beginner into the various game types. Most levels are punctuated by story scenes which play out in a visual novel style, with well drawn characters and voice acted dialogue. Both the Japanese and English voice actors do a terrific job of bringing the colourful cast of characters to life. I wish there were difficulty settings though like previous games in the franchise, as there is only one standard difficulty. The game is worth it even if all you do is play the adventure mode. 

When you are done with fighting AI opponents you can play hotseat multiplayer, with friends online or against opponents worldwide in a ranked league system. This is where the game truly shines, though be prepared to see how the skill ceiling for the game is. This is a game that truly fits the description of being easy to pick up, difficult to master - you will see people who have been playing Tetris for over two decades with mindblowing APM. As of this date the game has been out for about a week and though uneven matchups were certainly a problem at launch, it seem to be less of a problem as players' ratings more accurately reflect their skill level. If you want replayability, this game has it in spades with its online ranked mode. 

You can also save replays of every match you ever play and upload it to the game servers, to be viewable by the playerbase. This is great for recording games you want to remember, for going back over what happened, or for critiquing your own gameplay. 

Puyo Puyo is an amazing, well presented puzzle based game with robust single and multiplayer that is well worth its asking price. It is the sort of puzzle game that anyone will be able to pick up and learn to play easily. You will keep thinking to yourself just one more match, keep doing that over the afternoon, and before you know it it will be late into the twilight hours. If there was a way to play online ranked games with just Puyo Puyo or Tetris this right now be the definitive game for both. As it is, purists of either game type who want to play competitively will probably want to look elsewhere, but I can still highly recommend this game to all others.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029579963', 'num_games_owned': 675, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1520294300}
review:
The game is overall excellent but I still requested a refund because apparently I am either HORRIBLE at Tetris and Puyo Puyo, or the people who play this game are world-class experts. I was not able to win a single round online... not once!!! I'm not an inexperienced player, I've been playing Tetris since the NES version. Also, it didn't seem as though there was a huge online population for the game, and certain game modes were very hard (if not impossible) to find matches for. 

Aside from the skill level of other players and seeming lack of player base, I have nothing bad to say about the game. It is bright, cheerful, plays just as it should, etc.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998827138', 'num_games_owned': 1217, 'num_reviews': 426, 'playtime_forever': 444, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 377, 'last_played': 1557390490}
review:
This game is fantastic.

They managed to make it balanced enough to be quite fun and competitive to play any mode - be it Tetris vs Tetris, Puyo vs Puyo, Puyo vs Tetris, or the mixed modes (two boards that swap at fixed intervals, or a single board with both piece types).

The netcode seems pretty good so far; I'm in South America and still I can play against people from Japan, Taiwan or Australia with no lag.

The matchmaking doesn't seem to care too much about your current rank, so you'll face players of all skill ranges. This is probably a consequence of the player base not being high enough to have a more refined matchmaking. Crossplay would have been fantastic, a pity that it doesn't have it.

The presentation and colorful style all have a great upbeat feel; and the developers are quite active on fixing issues this first few days.

Really easy to recommend this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978381846', 'num_games_owned': 4093, 'num_reviews': 53, 'playtime_forever': 673, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 443, 'last_played': 1680551214}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041115905', 'num_games_owned': 1014, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1073, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 597, 'last_played': 1613066893}
review:
The game is really fun either alone, online or in local multiplayer.
If you ever played tetris (Which is very likely), and enjoy, you're going to enjoy this game.
The gameplay consists of Puyo Puyo, Tetris and a mix called Fusion, and boasts a lot of modes to keep you occupied, and for the low price, it's a must buy for anyone who enjoys simple puzzle games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081999873', 'num_games_owned': 357, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 3262, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 587, 'last_played': 1658634160}
review:
I didn't think a Tetris and Puyo Puyo mash up story would be good but it is. The characters are likeable and have some great dialogue as well. The voice acting is great despite some bugs in the japanese voice acting option. The visuals are great and sounds are also great despite some repetitiveness.

I'd give it a 8.9 Tetrises out of 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198205578331', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 91718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4168, 'last_played': 1707030077}
review: Love this a lot, played it on the PS4, the Switch, and finally PC version is out!! One thing is that I wish that there was a way to change the player name when playing online mode. My name is kinda raunchy and I'd rather have something more SFW on a game where young kids could be playing...

author: {'steamid': '76561198086125715', 'num_games_owned': 110, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3284, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1639, 'last_played': 1698942231}
review: Fun game to play with friends, not randoms online, ranking system is nonfunctional and useless. It will pair any rank with any rank, I got paired with the rank 15th player in the world when i just started. Don't buy if you don't have friends to play with, are really good at the game, or enjoy singleplayer only.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025412019', 'num_games_owned': 277, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 885, 'last_played': 1689015818}
review:
Poco puedo decir que no sepÃ¡is de Tetris, porque es la fÃ³rmula que todo Cristo deberÃ­a conocer hasta la saciedad. Sin embargo, [i]Puyo Puyo Tetris[/i] es algo mÃ¡s peculiar y creo que se necesitan unas explicaciones que pongan en contexto este juego. 

[i]Puyo Puyo Tetris[/i] representa la uniÃ³n de esfuerzos por parte de SEGA de extender y hacer atractiva la franquicia Puyo Puyo a nuevos jugadores incluyendo su propia versiÃ³n de reglas de Tetris. Este juego saliÃ³ en todas las plataformas disponibles en JapÃ³n en 2014 (3DS, Wii U, PS Vita, PS3, PS4, One), y posteriormente en el resto del mundo en 2017 (PS4, Switch), marcando asÃ­ la primera localizaciÃ³n occidental de Puyo Puyo despuÃ©s de 13 aÃ±os (Puyo Puyo Fever).

En Puyo Puyo Tetris, los universos de ambas partes chocan para combinar las modalidades de ambos juegos. La parte del juego menos conocida en occidente es, evidentemente, Puyo Puyo. Si bien es similar a Tetris, las figuras de colores llamadas Â«PuyosÂ» caen de dos en dos y desaparecen cuando hay cuatro del mismo color conectadas. Se consiguen mÃ¡s puntos cuando la distribuciÃ³n de los Puyos permite que estos reaccionen en cadena. Â¿Os acordÃ¡is de [i]Columns[/i]? Es mÃ¡s o menos parecido, solo que rotando las figuras. Â¿QuizÃ¡ [i]Dr. Robotnik's Mean Bean Machine[/i]? Es el mismo juego con un lavado de cara para MegaDrive. Â¿O puede que os suene [i]Kirby's Ghost Trap[/i] o [i]Kirby's Avalanche[/i]? Es tambiÃ©n el mismo juego, pero para Super Nintendo.

El diseÃ±o de [i]Puyo Puyo[/i] viene de la mano de Kazunari Yonemitsu, que lo concibiÃ³ como un [i]spin-off[/i] de un juego de rol de la compaÃ±Ã­a Compile, donde trabajaba. Ese juego de rol se llamaba [i]Madou Monogatari[/i], y tampoco es muy conocido en occidente, pero eso es harina de otro costal.

Llevaba aÃ±os deseando que trajeran algo de Puyo Puyo a occidente y me sorprendiÃ³ la estrategia de localizaciÃ³n para consolas, y ahora en PC. Me comprÃ© la versiÃ³n de Switch y, sin dudarlo ni un momento, comprÃ© tambiÃ©n la de Steam. Mucha gente descarta comprarlo porque Â«no es mÃ¡s que TetrisÂ», pero es muy injusto calificarlo asÃ­. Los controles, los grÃ¡ficos, la mÃºsica, los efectos de sonido casan a la perfecciÃ³n y resulta muy satisfactorio y divertido, como jugar a Tetris DS. Y ademÃ¡s se incluyen un montÃ³n de modos de juego, entre ellos online competitivo y amistoso.

El juego es apto para expertos de cualquiera de las dos facciones y tambiÃ©n para novatos en juegos de puzles, porque dentro hay numerosos tutoriales y modos de juego sencillos de juego para novatos. Y ademÃ¡s, los canales oficiales de 
[url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HyNDaUSqgE0]SEGA AmÃ©rica[/url] y [url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HWG16uAeNwo]Deep Silver[/url] en YouTube tienen vÃ­deos para aprender tÃ©cnicas mÃ¡s avanzadas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048041128', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 420, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 420, 'last_played': 1520571783}
review: One of the most addicting games ever. This is the ultimate combo puzzle game and it's super fun. I suck really bad at it but it keeps me wanting to better myself at the game. Literally looked at the clock and it was 1 AM, now it's 4:24 AM and I'm writing this review. God, help me.
