author: {'steamid': '76561198047893025', 'num_games_owned': 59, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 298, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 145, 'last_played': 1577509215}
review:
I love Puyo Puyo dearly and have been waiting eagerly to play Puyo Puyo Tetris since its Japanese release years ago. I was at my wit's end about to buy a Japanese copy of the Vita version, so I'm so incredibly happy it's finally available on PC and I'll be able to play it in English.

However, there are some issues with this port that cause trouble, as others have mentioned. The music does not loop properly and there are bugs with the characters' voices playing properly. 

In the end, I would still recommend it, as Puyo Puyo Tetris is an excellent game, but this port's got some issues.

Edit: I previously had a comment about the matchmaking not working properly (matching me with people whose skill rank is much higher than mine), but this problem seems to have since gone away. Maybe it was just the servers going nuts on launch day.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107870285', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 44972, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4479, 'last_played': 1638117391}
review:
Great crossover game. I like both Puyo and Tetris game.

UPDATE : 27/3/2018
Sega done a great job by updating their game to fix many bugs that been broken since the release.

STATS:
Pros
- Good game for both puyo and tetris side.
- Customize keyboard bind.
- Have both JP and EN audio. (been fixed on Patch 2 and Patch 3)
- Multiple game mode.
- Good story in adventure mode. (Yes you can finish adventure mode in 130.00%)
- Guess what? It also packed with all DLC like PS4 version
- Suck at game? There a simple tutorial for specific game mode where you can learn basic about it.
- There an alternate voice for both EN/JP.
- Puzzle League for Online Match Ranking (been fixed on Patch 1)
- Unlock everything (cheats code) can be done with Xbox controller / PS4 controller.

Cons:
- Lagswitcher by opponent 
- No custom button bind for controller (You can only pick on pre-setting controller setup) 
  (You can use anti-micro to link keybind from your controller to Keyboard so it act like you using keyboard key while using controller)
- Input freeze when playing in laggy online match.

OVERALL : JUST GET THE GAME! :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198063087827', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 496, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 153, 'last_played': 1530050476}
review: It's great! whether you love just one of the games or both, this is still by far the best version of both of these games available on PC. It's pretty, runs great (I've had no issues short of 2 quick stutters), has great style, and has tons to do. 100% recommend.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143459140', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 6844, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5625, 'last_played': 1696876092}
review:
The game is a faithful adaptation of what I've seen so far compared to the console versions. Of course, errors that should be fixed with a day 1 patch should go through, like fixing some of the voice issues, performance errors there and here, and resolution stuff. Besides that, the core game is amazing, to say the least. Who would've known the spiritual successor to Tetris&Dr. Mario would be so frantic?!?!?

I am not very keen on Puyo, since Tetris is my main, but I totally recommend this game in whatever device you can play it, including PC.



though, do fix some stuff plz
update: thanks for fixing some stuff

author: {'steamid': '76561198079196858', 'num_games_owned': 259, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1287, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 268, 'last_played': 1656540412}
review:
I'll be honest, Puyo Puyo is basically Dr. Mario, with gravity, for weeaboos.
Luckily, I happen to be a weeaboo, so this is right up my alley.

In all seriousness, this is an amazing game and well worth the 20 dollar price tag. Competetive puzzle games are always fun, and this is no exception. I would recommend waiting a bit though, since in its current state, while not unplayable, the game is pretty buggy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043083265', 'num_games_owned': 610, 'num_reviews': 79, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1519765906}
review:
Itâ€™s the best of both game franchises(along with their perspective quirks)

However i can confirm that the bugs from the pre-release beta that was given to reviewers are still around like the irregular music looping and the low volume of the voices during cutscenes, and a little one I found during endurance swap where the background doesnâ€™t change when the mode shifts from puyo to Tetris

The point is, while this port is flawed for the time being, itâ€™s still worth your time as this is living proof that two game franchises can be smooshed into one and actually work. (Also play this and stick it to Ubisoft for their horror show that is Tetris ultimate)

author: {'steamid': '76561197975530152', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 89, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1519785098}
review: If you plan on playing online, get it on Switch or PS4. Avoid this one at least for now. I'll be beating the opponent to a pulp and then all the sudden, it starts pausing every single time I drop a piece while the opponent can still freely move, giving them an unfair advantage. Made sure it wasn't an issue on my end, internet connection is perfectly stable. As for PC, I'll avoid all the technical issues by playing TetrisFriends.......for free.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083028065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1932, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1669637865}
review:
I played this on the PSVita and double dipped just to play it on the big screen! (I almost bought a Nintendo Switch just to play this game on the big screen!) It's in my opinion, the BEST tetris game of all time! I bought it to play Tetris, not so much of Puyo Puyo though.

Down side is the online lobby is still pretty quiet. But you'll have a blast of a fun just playing with the AI alone. The AI is very very intelligent, and will give you quite a bit of a challenge. This game has one of the best Tetris AI I've ever seen.

I love to just turn up the volume so my neighbours can hear it's awesome music! :)

One thing though, this version does have some audio bugs. The music doesn't loop properly and sometimes the character voices doesn't play,. I hope it gets fixed soon!

author: {'steamid': '76561197962220587', 'num_games_owned': 366, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 1254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 594, 'last_played': 1524690476}
review:
This is an amazing value. You get two full puzzle games (Puyo Puyo and Tetris) as well as various hybrid games that involve both. In addition, there are numerous modes for each game type, unlockables, ONLINE multiplayer with MMR (yes!!) and even a full fledged story (this is so sick!). Infinite replayability, visuals and audio are extremely crisp, and the game runs ultra smooth.

Thanks for this one SEGA!

author: {'steamid': '76561198090333211', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 16412, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1697, 'last_played': 1629806200}
review:
It's nice to see Puyo Puyo Tetris on Steam, the game itself is amazing! I own the Switch version, and decided to get this one as well.

There are a lot of issues too. Poor sound mixing in Adventure mode, music doesn't loop properly, problems with the characters voices and in some rare ocassions, the game can crash. The game in this state it's just not right. Hopefully, it will get patches to fix those issues soon. Fortunately, they (except the game crash) are aesthetic, and don't affect the gameplay.

Despite that, I still recommend this game for those people who love Puyo Puyo and Tetris, this game itself deserves more attention. Puyo Puyo deserves more attention in the West as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561197985115170', 'num_games_owned': 635, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 574, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1691501789}
review:
I'm rather glad a Puyo Puyo game is on Steam...but honestly I am hoping they will release PUYO PUYO 20TH ANNIVERSARY which is one of the best puyo games of the series. Not to mention, it'd be nice to see Puyo Puyo Chronicles or a return for the Madou Monogatari series (the deep lore RPG version of the game XD)

That aside, I played the game on PS4 and what's there is great regardless. Lots of fun modes and serious modes, the adventure mode offers a challenge to new players and even challenges after the story mode for the more experienced. It's also a really great game to play with friends. There's a number of modes to especially enjoy for single-player that can help newcomers practice for multiplayer modes against friends or online.

Music wise however, it's really sad they didn't include a single theme for the puyo characters and make some originals for the tetris characters. So the music will get repetetive eventually.

So far I've found no issues with the pc version and hope I don't either.

One really nice addition to the game is the Japanese voice acting cast as the english voice acting cast was just subpar. Some were good...some were bad...Satan (dark prince), is just kind of a miss. Yes he's silly, but the voice just isn't really deep enough. Satan offsets the whole cast with his voice compared to the others in all the past Madou Monogatari and Puyo games. Klug's voice is...you can hear it for yourself and then listen to the original...it ain't right XD. Lemres was completely missing the point of the character (or the director did) But Schezo was pretty nice, Rulue wasn't too bad, Ringo was pretty fitting. Overall, some of the voice actors really caught the essence of how the character is supposed to be but some were just missing the point almost...or the voice caster and director assigned the roles in rather odd ways.


Overall. I love Puyo Puyo Tetris and I can say so far, the steam version may just be the superior version released so far. But it'd be really awesome to see Puyo Puyo 20th anniversary, or even the Madou Monogatari games like the one on Sega Saturn or even a new game done in a Madou Monogatari style (puyo being a more silly, less deep version of Madou Monogatari)

author: {'steamid': '76561198277617467', 'num_games_owned': 165, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1118, 'last_played': 1708999622}
review:
Tuning in this game for Tetris feels very bad. The controls also feel unresponsive since clicking hold sometimes just doesn't register. Matchmaking is also garbage as it places people with >10000 skill rating against each other pretty consistently since no one really plays this game. Denuvo also just sucks in general. Puyo is also immensely overpowered and if you aren't better than your skill rating already and are going against a person w/ the same skill rating, Puyo will probably smash your head in.

I would say that the story is pretty well polished though and ONLY buy this game for the story.

OVERALL: Play Tetris Friends or jstris if you want to play online for this game and if you're going for the story, it's ok to buy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198126917362', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 3111, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 567, 'last_played': 1637190215}
review:
"Today is boring!" *Teleported to a ship because her wishes were met quickly*

The only realy problem I had so far was that during act one stage two the game crashed so I missed a small portion of the game. I am super excited that this game is out!

Current Pros: 
The voice acting is funny.
The text is easy to read. 
A good combination of Puyo Puyo and Tetris.
Shop that allows you to customize your avatar,  and blocks.
Free music

Cons:
I can already since a pattern that might lose it's charm.
The controls are a bit sensitive for the XBOX controller
It can be difficult at times to find someone to play with online. 

I will contiue to update this review as I progress further into the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035003116', 'num_games_owned': 752, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 10997, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5793, 'last_played': 1666469196}
review:
When this version of Puyo Puyo Tetris released, I was fairly disappointed with the porting job. It was all over the place, while the game would technically work, there were issues, both major and minor that were very noticeable. [url=https://i.imgur.com/ccgbvRd.png]My original review[/url] slammed this port, and recommended that you buy a different version of this fantastic game.

2 patches down the line, I can now safely say that Puyo Puyo Tetris on PC is now a serviceable port. It is not perfect, mind you, but the biggest issues such as improper music looping, voices not working properly, ranking resets, etc are now gone. There are some smaller issues still present but really nothing anyone will actually care about (though for me, there is the exception of the BGM selector only being present in single player settings and not online ones, like in the other versions - why???).

Anyway, I now highly recommend that you pick this game up, and would even recommend this specific version over the PS4 at this point due to the much larger playerbase. There are some very nice advantages this version has over the console ones, which are easy modding, ability to play on any keyboard/controller you want, dual audio and maybe even the ability to play in 4K???? (I don't have a 4K monitor but this should work - dunno how the assets would look though).

The Switch version on the other hand, has more polish and portability, as well as better netcode (some games are incredibly laggy but what can you do) and (from my own experiences), a bigger playerbase. Though be prepared for 95% of your fights to be against the Japanese. I do still find myself playing both versions of the game frequently. Also no Denuvo, but idk if that is actually affecting anyone trying to play this offline like Sonic Mania, but Denuvo sucks anyway so eh

In conclusion, PC port is good enough now, buy this game, have the time of your life getting destroyed in Puyo Puyo and/or Tetris.

author: {'steamid': '76561198350624803', 'num_games_owned': 502, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1519775185}
review: This game is ass. It gets rid of the reason I find Tetris fun in the first place.(AND Why Im good at it on normal versions.) For one, there isnt any matchmaking system. By that I mean I got placed with the number 2 player in their region multiple times. 2.) There isn't a ranked mode based on score. That means you're forced to play the shitty party oriented games (in ranked mode, mind you) or the ass-y versus. I dont hate versus mode, but when you go against people who play with speed being the number one priority, it becomes frustrating quick as hell. Wait untill they add rankings based on points, not how fast you place something,

author: {'steamid': '76561198040485548', 'num_games_owned': 1073, 'num_reviews': 114, 'playtime_forever': 1684, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1569048660}
review:
I really love this game. I bought the Japanese PSVita version years back, the Switch version day of release, and now I'm playing it on my preferred platform. A lot of people give this game hate, and I don't understand why, I think it's a great game.

If you're a fan of Puyo Puyo or Tetris, I recommend this game.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198066496648', 'num_games_owned': 277, 'num_reviews': 73, 'playtime_forever': 907, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 99, 'last_played': 1617125679}
review:
Puyo puyo legal por primera vez desde puyo puyo feaver para pc! 
Es un must si te gustan los juegos puzzles games, es divertido y puede llegar a ser competitivo si te gusta el ambiente, recomendado.

author: {'steamid': '76561198117953718', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 3487, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 708, 'last_played': 1623357673}
review:
One of the best Puzzle Games ever finally appears on Steam.
Puyo Puyo Tetris is a fun, fast paced, multiplayer puzzle game by Sega Sonic Team.
And like the title suggests this game features both Puyo Puyo (Puyo Pop) and Tetris, you can play the games on it's own or play some kind of mix of the two. So even if you just like one of the puzzle games this game still got you covered with many game modes for both.
I own the PS4 version of this game as well and as someone who sunk many hours in that game I'd say this port is pretty well done, there are a few minor glitches but nothing game breaking for me atleast.
If you're looking for a fun puzzle multiplayer game both online and local. Puyo Puyo Tetris is for you. And here's hoping to more Puyo Puyo (Puyo Pop) being brought over to the west because the series has got many more games like this, with even more game modes.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995081634', 'num_games_owned': 534, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1375, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 332, 'last_played': 1565074586}
review: Sega, thank you for a PC release! I had previously played on Wii U and 3DS, but it is nice to play a proper translation. It's nice to get some sweet releases and I am happy to finally have a chance to give Sega some of my money.  And if you have never played this masterpiece, I'd say the $20 price tag has more than enough content to make it worth your time.

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561198202455762', 'num_games_owned': 704, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 238, 'last_played': 1605229339}
review:
I recommend this game so much, however there are a few issues that I have run into with the PC port. 

Sound mixing in story mode is awful. It's on the same level as Sonic Adventure 2, where the music drowns out what the people are saying.

Music doesn't loop properly. It's jarring to hear the music improperly jump to the beginning of the song and just break the flow of it. 

Puzzle League Mode chosen even though I turned it off. I once got Big Bang mode chosen in Puzzle League, even though I only play Swap and Versus and only have those on. 

There are more issues that others have found, but these are issues that can easily be fixed or removed, like Denuvo!

author: {'steamid': '76561197998914313', 'num_games_owned': 968, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1519987686}
review:
Day One Release

Infinitetly better then Tetris Ultimate. Still needs some work with Netcode and bugs, but other then that, it's fully functional.  DAS feels a little clunky causing a lot of Misdrops so if you're a keyboard user like I am, you may have to take some time to get used to playing this game on Keyboard as from Gamepad (console) to PC keyboard didn't translate very well. So keep that in mind.

Best Tetris & Puyo game on Steam, adios Tetris Ultimate, we didn't really care to know you... you piece of s&#^$

author: {'steamid': '76561198105203752', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 12061, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 646, 'last_played': 1704047167}
review:
This is a fantastic crossover between two great puzzles. I've been wanting to play this since it was released in Japan, and it's really exciting to finally see a pc (and English) port to something that you would normally see there! It's also a grand sigh of relief that there's finally a proper tetris title on steam that everyone will love!

As one who's played countless hours of Tetris Friends, I would highly reccomend this title.

Now if you'll excuse me... I've gotta practice the puyo puyo side a little more ;P

author: {'steamid': '76561197988828057', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1370, 'last_played': 1571686340}
review:
Great game if you're into either Puyo Puyo or Tetris, and it's certainly better than the [i]other[/i] Tetris title on Steam. A lot of content is locked behind the adventure mode, but you can input cheat codes to unlock all the content that you'd normally get by playing through it, so if you really don't like Puyo Puyo or you really don't like Tetris, you're not really forced to play both modes. Competitive and party modes are available online, and the DLC from the original Japanese releases is packaged into the PC version.

Localization is a little odd. Some attack quotes are changed for seemingly no reason, but I haven't checked with each and every character to confirm the extent of these changes. But [b]dear god[/b], Sig's voice makes me want to hang myself. It sounds like he wants to hang himself too. Rather than the creepy monotone he is in the Japanese, English Sig just has a nasally "nerd" voice. Several performances by other character also lack tones and emotions that are present in the Japanese voices, or just plain aren't spoken very clearly. Ess's defeat line, "Let's try again!", is spoken tearfully in the Japanese, and accompanied by a fitting sprite, but in English she just sounds [i]indignant[/i], while her sprite still has her bawling. But this is mostly personal preference, and if you haven't played in Japanese then you probably don't care a whole lot about this.

Localization aside, the port isn't without its own issues, though. On multiple instances I've had crashes during Adventure cutscenes, infinite loads when moving between screens, and the PC port just handles music very poorly. Loop-points in music are assigned incorrectly, making VERY noticable jumps in the music that simply aren't present in other versions, and there are also a couple other audio-related bugs that were introduced by the jump to PC. The bad music looping is the worst part, everything else I can just gloss over.

author: {'steamid': '76561198086125734', 'num_games_owned': 779, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1592872162}
review:
cons
-denuvo

pros
-its literally everything you'd want in a hybrid of puyo puyo and tetris

playing extensively on the switch, i know everything the game has to offer, including a solid story (with great english actors), many unique modes which take the best of both game to create new modes like fusion, swap, and party

However it also has the basic's such as vs.(2-4 players) ranked and unranked and marathon modes


the balance between puyo puyo and tetris is always debated but im not very good competitive wise 



overall i'd highly recommend this for any puzzle lover as this is one of the best puzzle games on steam (and the best tetris game); i spend $60 on this game between the switch and steam versions of this game and its worth my money for such a well designed game

author: {'steamid': '76561198121347821', 'num_games_owned': 183, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 37, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1519759090}
review:
I've recently gotten into the Puyo Puyo fandom nearly a year after this game's release. And after replaying Dr. Robotnik's Mean Bean Machine I wanted to try this game out. I sucked at the demo on the Switch and then months later I ended up buying the physical game (It was hard to find at a few of my local GameStops) for the Switch and I love it. The characters, music, gameplay, competitive battles, mixing Puyo Puyo and Tetris may seem like a weird idea on paper, but seeing this japanese puzzle game alongside another famous puzzle game mixed very well for fans who love Puyo Puyo and Tetris. =D

And then you have the PC Port.
This could just be me because I don't have a beefy PC like all the other rich boys do, but from my experience first playing on console first and then PC made me think otherwise.

For example, I'm happy that my PC is able to run this game, but it just seems like this port is... sloppy. Please don't take my word for it because I may be wrong. And if I am, please let me know.

For starters the music in the cutscenes seems WAY too loud. And the voices of the characters seem to have been slightly toned down so that you could barely hear what they're saying if it wasn't for text boxes... And for some reason after the music in the cutscenes play out they suddenly restarts, giving it a bad looping experience without it transcending with the looping music properly.
And one thing that's disgraceful is the fact that not only are the voices in gameplay when you get combos toned down so that you can barely hear them, if you restart a level, the voices are cut out!!
And at one point when I defeated one of the characters in level 1-3 their dialogue box was switched to the main character's. DXX

I mainly only use a controller for certain games like this, because I'm just not comfortable using a keyboard or mouse with this game. But for some reason, moving your puyos or tetrominos left and right feels a lot more stiffer than on the Switch. coupled with the fact that even the MUSIC in the gameplay loops this just feels... So sloppy... DX

I'm serious, I had high hopes for this, but I just don't understand how it could be handled so badly... And don't bring up Denvuono or whatever that is. I have Sonic Mania that has that and it was able to run on my PC just fine.

This port however is just sloppy and needs refining so that you can hear the voices, fix the music looping and make the controls more refined to fit the console versions. It's not terrible but I would highly suggest you buy it for the Switch or PS4...

But hey, like I said. I could be wrong. Maybe my PC isn't powerful enough to fix those little issues I had. I'm no PC expert so take what I said with a grain of salt.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020474041', 'num_games_owned': 338, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 2127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1834, 'last_played': 1581056863}
review:
==MARCH 15TH UPDATE==
Ahh, that's more like it! They finally squished out all the mayor underlying bugs in this game. NOW you can truly experience a (so far flawless) experience now!

==ORIGINAL REVIEW BELOW==
As a biased Puyo fan, of course I'm gonna recommend. It's fun and easy to learn, but hard to master.

...oh, and Tetris is still a thing somehow.
The only complaints I have are that the music won't loop properly and some characters' lines have been swapped around during their spells. Nothing that can't be fixed via patches.
If you have the Switch or PS4 versions, stick to them as so far they're the best ones around, but if ya don't have them, or ya wanna face against an even larger playerbase, then by all means go for it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198052485827', 'num_games_owned': 542, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 57880, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31943, 'last_played': 1711010885}
review:
Best Game Ever

Old Review:
Great game but the port has some shortcomings:
- Denuvo (Of course)
- Quick launch buttons on the title screen arn't present
- Music doesn't loop properly anymore
- The PC specific UI looks odd and kinda ugly (The huge red X on the title screen)
- The overall sound is too quiet and voices are drowned out by the music at the default volumes
- Some sound effects don't play properly (e.g. the swap mode roulette)
- Some UI elements have notable artifacting compared to the console release
- Matchmaking tied to download region (Fixed as of Mar 3)

Edit: Also prone to crashes

author: {'steamid': '76561198042090558', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 4242, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1085, 'last_played': 1571685927}
review:
For more than 25 years, Arle Nadja has been solving every problem thats occured in her life the only way she knows how, with a game of Puyo Puyo, only now she has Tetris to consider.(Well unless you include her brief endeavors in the Madou Monogatari series but that's not what we're here to talk about.)

So! What is Puyo Puyo Tetris? Well, it's one puzzle game titan going off against another staring characters of the Puyo Puyo franchise. I'm going to assume everyone knows what Tetris is, because well, how couldn't you know what Tetris is? So I'll explain the history of Puyo Puyo.

Created all the way back in 1991 by Compile before the licence was fully acquried by Sega and passed onto Sonic Team, Puyo Puyo was a very popular puzzle game in Japan for years and still is to this day, the objective isn't so much as to keep your board clear, but rather to use your board to create as many combo chains as you can in order to send trash blocks to your opponent to defeat them, Sound familiar? If you're a Sonic the Hedgehog fan, you may be familiar with Dr. Robotniks Mean Bean Machine, which was a localized version of the original Puyo Puyo, likewise with Kirby fans who played Kirby Avalanche which was also another version of Puyo Puyo on the SNES.

Puyo Puyo Tetris isn't the latest installment of the franchise (That'd be Chronicles), but it is one of the most popular because of the variety that it offers thanks to the inclusion of Tetris, you can choose to play whichever puzzle game you'd like, there are a multitude of modes, an adventure story and helpful tutorials to enjoy. There's alot of content here for the price of admission.

I think my favorite mode in this game is Swap, where you play both games that alternate with the other every 25 seconds, I.E you play Puyo Puyo for 25 seconds, then it switches to Tetris for another 25 and so on until someone is defeated, requiring you to be aware of both boards of each game and having the capabillity to play them and being able to return to each one from where it was left off.

If you're looking for a very enjoyable puzzle game to play against friends, I'd definately recommend it, but be prepared for the games of your life if you plan to go online, if there's one thing I've learned by watching a youtuber called Shirobrawl for a solid year and a half, it's not just that people are good at this game, it's that they're REALLY good, seriously if you want to see what high level players are capable on in this game, I'd definately recommend watching Shirobrawl play as well as some others like S2LSOFTENER and Tamer Koh, you'll be in absolute awe at how well some of these guys can just make the Puyo combos happen and how fluid the Tetris players can just stack them blocks as soon as they appear on the screen, the skill ceiling for this cutesy carefree puzzle game is so shockingly high, it's bound to catch alot of people off guard, best way to describe Puyo Puyo Tetris, is the old saying "Easy to learn, difficult to master".

On the topic of balance, I can't say I envy Sonic Team on that front, being given the task to make sure that these two completely differant games are equally competitive with one another must of been no easy task, the community consenseus from what I understand that Tetris has the advantage over Puyo Puyo if played incredibly well, but it's likely a very volitile system, tweak one thing about Tetris, suddenly Puyo will either crush them or lose to rapid consistancy, make it so Puyo's can drop instantly, then Tetris can't keep up with the continous combos, It's likely that I don't know what I'm talking about so I'll stop, but as far as I know the game does still recieve updates, so they'll continue to tweak this system as time goes on, plus balancing concerns aren't a problem in mirror matches, so something to take into consideration.

But either way I give this a solid thumbs up, It's good! Wonderful production quality, nice soundtrack, attention to detail, vibrant and cheery, a large amount of variety and also has the single best "Start!" sound I've ever heard in a video game. If you're a puzzle game enthusist, this should be a no brainer. Thanks for bringing this to Steam Sega, I've always wanted to try it out and now I finally can.

Bayoen!
